description:
Found this gem on yelp.  Went on a Monday night.   Such a charming place.  Was nice and quiet, so was able to enjoy the ambiance.
Food was yummy.  I had bruschetta, with the heirloom tomatoes,, on garlic bread.. so good.
Seafood soup was tasty also, but just a bit salty for my liking.... but I think I'm a little salt-sensitive.  the seafood in the soup was fresh and cooked perfectly.  My friend had the Wild Boar pasta, which was amazing.  I'll get this next time I go.
I enjoyed my dinner there and look forward to another visit.
author: Ken V.

description:
This is a cute little local restaurant on Larkin in the Russian Hill district.
We were greeted warmly by our host, and seated along the wall. The interior has high ceilings with plaster walls and lighting that will make you feel a little like you are outdoors. Mostly 2 tops that can be arranged to accommodate the necessary number of diners in a group.
Our server Germano, was very nice and attentive the entire evening. All the service staff were great.
We started with the arugula salad, and the beet salad. Both were very good. Neither were large enough to split, as we sometimes like to do when the salad is prior to a larger main course. 
Main courses: 
The Pappardelle with 'local' wild boar and mushrooms. Not sure where they would find 'local' wild boar in SF... but whatever... This dish was a little flat. Nothing really 'bad' about it, just kinda 'meh'...
I had the evening special of linguine with rabbit, asparagus and cherry tomatoes. I thought the linguine itself was excellent, and there was an ample amount of rabbit. But, that rabbit was rather overcooked making it dry. 
All in all, I would have to say the dining experience was just OK. We may come back to see if there are other menu items that we might enjoy more.
author: Greg S.

description:
Very friendly staff, great little-spot-in-the-neighborhood vibes. Food is good and enjoyable, but nothing I would rant and rave about. The linguine was great, but the spaghetti was underwhelming. 

Recommendations: Linguine allo Scoglio

Pros: 
- Helpful, welcoming staff
- Great location and interior decor 
- Reasonable prices

Okays: 
- Food--good noodles and taste, but doesn't quite pack the "wow" factor 

Cons: 
- n/a
author: Perry H.

description:
I love this spot!!!

Local spot. If you're a tourist and have found this place you win. 

We've been coming here for 10 plus years. It never disappoints. Great food. Great service. Great location. Only thing not great is they only serve beer and wine but they have a strong Italian wine menu. 

You can have a great dinner only eating their appetizers. Get 3 or 4 for two people for a flavor party. 

Arugula salad with pears and pecorino. Tortino zucchini. Balsamic portobello. Gnocchi frito. Meatballs. All insane. 

Every pasta dish on the menu must be tried. Mouth watering. 

Salmon - don't remember what it's called but it's insane!!!

Russian Hill location - as good as it gets!!!
author: Dave K.

description:
Loved this place! 

I got the truffle and mushroom pasta with gluten free penne, and it was really good! I'd definitely recommend. We also ordered the truffle mushroom pasta without gf noodles--even better!

Most pasta dishes can be made with gf noodles. 

This restaurant is on the smaller side and on a fairly quiet corner. It has a bit of a friendly neighborhood feel, but the food & wine menus are still extensive. 

Great place to go for both locals and out of town visitors looking for a nice dinner outside of the chaotic downtown area. I'll definitely be bringing family visiting from out of town in the future!
author: Tess G.

description:
I got a glass of free prosecco through the Yelp check in offer. 

We ordered the Ravioli do zucca and lasagna. The ravioli was pretty good but the lasagna was average.
author: Rohan K.

description:
Amazing authentic Italian food! Great staff that is very caring and helpful! 
I ordered the Lasagna and it was amazing! After I ate here once I try my best to go back whenever I am in the area. Meals and portions are worth the price!!
author: Antonio G.

description:
For the love hidden gems, Neighbourhood Italian restaurants, amazing polenta, to die for ravioli, mediocre wines (4rounds, 2 of chianti and 2 others) and delicious deserts, and impeccably casual Italian service.

I have been wanting to try this place for a while now, didn't happen until this beautiful Thursday evening.

The place wasn't too crowded (atmosphere is romantic or family oriented - not super casual). The interior is warm, not too dark or too bright. The feel is cozy and friendly.

Tried the butternut squash -to die for -ravioli (disclaimer, i have loved most of the raviolis i have tried in my life... mostly from restaurants right here on Hyde). Also tried the Polenta mushroom plate and all the glass wines on the menu followed by desert... I wasn't too impressed with the wines.. but surprisingly surprised with the desert - wasn't too excited about it at the beginning - go check them out
author: Mary N.

description: We came in off a random recommendation. We were seated quickly. The food was delicious and very authentic! The ambiance was tasteful and lively but not too loud.
author: Emily V.

description: Amarena is a hidden treasure. The space is intimate and romantic, yet casual. The food was absolutely delectable (we ordered the orchiaetta and the wild boar bolognese), and the wine selection was diverse and affordable.
author: Marilyn R.

description: Have to go dine in-person but I get food delivered from Amarena regularly and it has never been a disappointing experience! Their Gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce and ravioli are consistently good
author: Guru Y.

description:
Authentic, romantic, neighborhood resultant on Nob hill. The owner is extremely friendly and relatable. I've been here a number of times, and each time he has come to the table and asked us how our food was. 
Service: I don't think I've ever seen this place not extremely busy! But, although the house is usually full staff never makes you feel like they forgot about you. They are always very attentive! But, I would recommend making reservations.
Food: AMAZING!!!!!! Food has an authentic Italian flavor! Food is not cheap but WELL WORTH IT! This place does not cut corners when it comes to their dishes! 
Atmosphere: Atmosphere makes you feel like your in Italy! Very romantic lighting. Tables are fairly small, but that adds to the intimate experience. Honestly this is one of the only restaurants I go to that I actually enjoy the experience and only take out my phone to take a picture of my plate. 
Price: not cheap but not over priced.

All around this is one of my favorite date spots!
author: Angelica N.

description: Not going back. Honestly the food made me sick. Also not very professional staff. The owner walks in and turns up the lights at like 8:30pm-goodbye ambiance...
author: Anna M.

description: The service was awesome and the food was authentic as well! Big shoutout for the truffle mushroom fettucini and the sweet wine pasta.
author: Yu Z.

description:
Initially, I was excited to find an Italian place in the neighborhood with ads both on Yelp (the first thing you see under the name) and on Opentable - telling me that they have a 3 course prix fixe menu for $29.95 from 5:30- 6:30 pm on weekdays and all day on Tuesday. I booked a reservation for 6:00 PM. 

Once we're at the table, the waitress is rambling through the specials and I ask her about the 3 course prix fixe. She tells me that it doesn't exist! I show her the ad on Yelp and she tells me it's just for New Years Eve. I insist that she look at it again and she doesn't bother going to anyone else before she comically tells us that this deal does not exist. 

I don't like patronizing places that make false promises. We left. We won't return.
author: Christine Y.

description: Came here for a birthday celebration with four other goals. It was a cute, intimate place. I don't like when restaurants get too loud. Service was great, it felt authentic and personalized. I got the evening's special, squid ink risotto. It was really good! If you feel like stepping out of the traditional red sauce pasta realm, definitely get the risotto. Don't be afraid of the "squid ink" part or that the risotto is black...it's actually quite tasty.
author: Amber G.

description:
Cozy and authentic neighborhood Italian restaurant in Nob Hill. The host, who I assume is the owner is Italian and extremely friendly and hospitable. We had a reservation but they weren't ready so we promptly got a seat at the bar.

Service- 4 stars-Slow but attentive and relaxed. They are small and it was clearly slammed on a Saturday night. The service was slow but they knew we were waiting and came by enough to update us and even gave us a glass of wine on the house. Additionally I never felt rushed to get out of there and we were able to have good conversation.

Food- 5 stars-Some of the best and most authentic Italian food. We started with the verdure which was grilled excellently and was a nice light starter. I had the tagliolini al funghe with truffles and it was incredible. Sometimes I feel pasta is overpriced for something I could make myself but this was definitely not the case. My sister got the parchadelle which was also nice. 

Atmosphere-4 stars- The smell of truffles fills the air. This place is buzzing with life and transports you to another place. It's small and tables are packed in. Our table was near the bathroom which was mildly annoying.

Price- Not cheap, ran us about $60 each for a shared app, entree, 2 glasses of wine.


Overall fantastic intimate Italian. Great for a date or intimate dinner with family or friends
author: Alison B.

description: Our first time to this place. I went all vegetarian and was impressed with the grilled vegetables and the arugula salad. My companion had salmon and loved it. Great family hospitality. Great neighborhood spot.
author: Mighty M.

description:
One of my favorite Italian spots in San Francisco. Intimate and romantic!

Cannot wait to come back on my next visit to my former home.
author: Paul H.

description:
We were hanging out in Russian Hill and randomly craving Italian food. Amaerna had a lot of openings on Open Table so we made a reservation and wandered over at 6:30 on a Saturday. The restaurant was pretty empty but seemed to have a steady flow of reservations (we saw the screen).

We ordered:

Appetizer: Mussels and clams: pretty standard white wine and garlic steamed shellfish dish. Good but nothing too special.

Wild Boar Ragu: I didn't try this but it received good reviews.
Fettucine with mushrooms in a truffle cream sauce: It smelled delicious. The pasta and mushrooms were great but I'd say the sauce was a bit too salty at the end.

The service here was quick since it was pretty empty but hey, we enjoyed it for what it is: a cute, neighborhood joint!

3.5 stars
author: Ninette C.

description: Love this place! The food is amazing here! I have had several dishes & have never been disappointed. Also, really enjoy their sangria & wine. Every time I've gone the staff has been very friendly & tentative. Cute authentic spot you don't want to pass up :)
author: Christine O.

description:
This was my birthday dinner pick...  Amarena is a cute, romantic neighborhood spot.  I came here with the DH, auntie, and two kiddos.  We all really enjoyed Amarena!

We started with the arugala salad (my oldest proclaimed it the BEST salad ever!) and the burrata.  The vinaigrette on the salad was sooooo good it really made the dish.  It was the perfect blend of sweet/tart/tangy.  The burrata was also very good.  The tomatoes that accompanied the dish, however, were too "mainstream" for my taste.

Hmmmm... let's see....  What did we have?  I know I had the tagliatelle with mushrooms and the others had the lamb, papparadelle alla cinghale, bucatini, and orecchette.  My tagliatelle was the BEST--everyone said so!  I seriously had to fight my foodie daughter off my plate!  But generally, the pastas were all very well made and their accompanying sauces were tasty and well seasoned.

So the only weird thing about this place is that the bathroom is tucked into a little corner (not their fault but...) and there is a small table right there with only a sheet separating the table from the bathroom door...  Just a little too close for comfort, I would think.  But otherwise, I would definitely recommend Amarena!
author: Christine T.

description: Lovely, authentic Italian cuisine. Great wine selection, great service, great food!! The wine we selected was out, we were recommended a replacement which was outstandingly good and complimented the food perfectly. Great spot to catch up with old friends as we did, but would also be a nice date venue or family dinner....
author: Di V.

description: Best Italian food anywhere. We had butternut squash ravioli and gnocchi and have never tasted better. Fun, attentive, friendly staff. Can't wait to go back!
author: Jackie S.

description: Amarena is a great neighborhood Italian restaurant. The restaurant was quite busy, but that did not affect the attentive service nor the high-quality of the food. It's definitely on my list of go-to Italian places in SF.
author: Dan D.

description:
This is one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco, and it happens to be local which is fantastic!

This is the place to go to if you want:
1. Extra-ordinary, authentic Italian food and wine
2. An atmosphere that some hits family, intimate, romantic, and relaxed all in one go
3. Reasonable prices
And you can usually get in, maybe with a bit of a wait, any day!

The only warning, though, is it's a small neighborhood place.  At times the service can seem a bit slow - because it's relaxed.  And there's only a few servers.
author: Kevin F.

description:
I picked this spot for my birthday dinner on a recommendation from a co-worker. It was also conveniently close to my friend's house where we were having a pre-dinner bottle of champagne.

We had 7pm reservations - but called at 6:30 to see if we could push it out to7:30 - no problem at all they said.

We got there and there were very few tables occupied.  We sat in the main room and ordered some wine (the next day my husband said - "the food was cheap/reasonable - it was the wine that was expensive." (now it was my birthday so I don't know the final bill)

We ordered a lot of food. The charcuterie platter - LOVED the fried bread it came with. ALSO we had the lasagna, the veal chop and the parpadelle.  The veal chop was nice and crispy. and the lasagna had lots of flavor and very delicate homemade noodles. We also asked if we could get 1/2 order if the gnocchi, our waitress said no, then came back and said the kitchen would do it.

the service was just a little weird, I am not sure if she was new, or just confused, but she didn't know much about anything when we asked questions.
author: Amy W.

description: The restaurant was pretty empty on a Thursday night, which should have been a sign for us. I do not understand why this place has such good reviews. The service was just okay. The server was trying to push us to order more food when we were not that hungry (In hindsight, it was a good idea to not order more food considering the quality of food). I ordered the pappardelle pasta with boar meat. The pasta was overcooked and the meat sauce had a funky smell. For dessert, We shared a tiramisu which was extremely disappointing. I get better tiramisu at my neighborhood Safeway. Not coming back here again.
author: Chet L.

description: Cozy atmosphere, one of the best meals we have ever eaten! I had the seafood pasta which was recommended by the waiter and it was amazing! My daughter had the mozzarella/tomato and eggplant appetizers and both were amazing! We both agreed, one of our top meals out ever! High recommend Amarena.
author: Sue H.

description: With San Francisco having its fair share of amazing Italian restaurants, this was something of a let down. We ordered the burrata cheese plate and the gnocco fritto con affettati for starters. These were simply amazing. Their pastas were mediocre. We ordered the Pappardelle al Cinghiale and the LineTagiatelle ai funghi e tartufo with the truffle sauce. Both were mediocre, salty, heavy and creamy. But overall it was an ok experience and I'm still questioning the quality of the food with the prices I had paid for this restaurant.
author: Joel V.

description: Everything I had at this place was delicious. We ordered beef carpacio, burrato, and calamari as appetizers. I ordered the clam mussel, and shrimp linguine. The portion size was huge. I often find Italian restaurants skimp on portion, but this place did not. It was $23 for my plate, and the tiramisu was on point. Service was good. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for Italian food in the city with cute ambience.
author: Shu T.

description: The pasta and salmon here are so amazing. I have ordered the regular pasta and the gluten free and both are so yummy!
author: Tara K.

description: We originally went here because they have a gluten free pasta option, but it quickly became our absolute favorite Italian spot in the city! It has a quaint, cozy atmosphere and the best people own it/work there. Our favorites are the Carpaccio appetizer, the Papardelle, Buccatini, and Orecchiette pastas, and their delicious homemade sangria. We would eat here every weekend if we could!
author: Alisa C.

description: Easily snatched a res for 2 on a Sat night around 8:30 pm on opentable. We were quickly seated but noone came by to our table for quite a while. We finally flagged down a waitress and ordered a glass of house red, eggplant app, gnocchi and lasagna. The complimentary bread was delicious. Glass of house red was surprisingly good as well. Eggplant appetizer was a tad greasy and unremarkable. My gnocchi however was delicious!!!! My friend's lasagna was also good but the gnocchi was really the star. Each gnocchi was perfectly fluffy and melted in my mouth. Towards the end the service improved a bit as well as the restaurant was clearing out. Cute neighborhood italian place - easily accessible, decently priced, cute ambiance, good food!! Will be back.
author: Yin H.

description:
When my SF native friend asked if there was anything in particular I wanted when I came to visit, I thought about what I should get that I can't here in Los Angeles. LA is a food mecca into itself and has cuisine representative of nearly every culture within its county limits. However, there are some cuisines in San Francisco that stick out more than LA and for me, its Italian food. 

In searching for Italian (and a last minute reservation on a Friday night), we were able to get a table at Amarena for a group of five. When we arrived, the place was busting with people. The restaurant is within a small house and a small bar in the back. Upon entering, it was noticeably warm inside while it was a conventionally crisp SF nighttime outside. We had a reservation for 8:30 and took a while to get noticed by the host who was seating and deliver wine bottles. We waited about ten minutes to be seated. This was a bit of a turn off and loss of a star for me. Once seated, we perused the menu and decided on a shared appetizer and what our main courses would be. 

We decided on a Burrata with basil and yellow tomato. It was very appetizing and an easy shared plate. For my main entree, I was really craving pasta so I decided on the Linguine also Scoglio, a seafood mix of clams, muscles, prawns, and calamari in a light tomato sauce. The pasta was handmade and cooked al dente. The tomato sauce had a touch of spice that made it more interesting. The rest of my party also opted for pasta dishes, and seemed satisfied with their choices. 

I wanted dessert, and asked our server for a suggestion. She suggested the Salame al Cioccolato, which I never heard of and told it was a more regional dessert. I had no idea what it would look like, and when it came out, it was in the form of biscotti but moist like a cake. It lived up to its chocolate-y name, with a nutty twist. It came with a side of vanilla gelato. I was pleasantly surprised with this dessert and will be on the lookout for it here in LA. 

Despite the slight wait and off warmth of the inside, it was overall a great dining service with good food and better friends to share it with.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
We enjoyed this lively and  pretty Italian restaurant over Labor Day. Veronica was our waitperson. She did an excellent job of making recommendations and getting all the details taken care of.  One app we really liked was the roasted portobello mushroom w balsamic vinegar. Even our family member who does not care for 'shrooms liked it!  The other apps were great as well, salmon tartar and bruschetta were all devoured.
Pasta dishes  are homemade and have great tooth. The ravioli was delicate and full of great flavor. The veal chop Milanese was truly a "Dino-chop" Huge and perfectly crispy and tender. Highly recommend this wonderful small restaurant. Make reservations!
author: Elizabet S.

description:
We tried this restaurant for the first time tonight and I was a bit disappointed in the food.
The olive oil they served with the bread was extremely bitter. The pasta was mediocre. 
The ambiance was great but as far as Italian food goes there is way better options in the city.
author: Venus D.

description:
Restaurants like these are one of the reasons I love living in San Francisco. Amarena is a cute little neighborhood restaurant tucked up in the nicer residential part of Larkin. 

The starters- we tried the spinach salad and fried calamari/seafood appetizer- were tasty, but the star of the show were the pastas. The tagliatelle with mushrooms and truffles were magical. Perfectly al-dente homemade pasta tossed with a decadently earthy blend of mushrooms, garlic, and truffles. While certainly not light, this dish wasn't weighed down by too much cheese or cream, and left me perfectly satisfied. 

My partner tried the pappardelle with wild boar ragu. Wide, delicate strips of pasta were covered with just the right amount of sauce. Nothing remained. 

Service was efficient and friendly, if a tad forgetful. 

I'll return again in the future, if only for the mushroom pasta!

Terry
author: Terry N.

description: Went to Amarena for dinner with new friends last weekend and had one of the best dining experiences in years. Palo and his staff are on point with top-notch service. The food was excellent, they even made a vegetable only plate for one our friends. Amarena is not to be missed.
author: Gary H.

description:
This place is a very nice neighborhood Italian restaurant. 
There are so many things we love about it. The pastas are amazing, freshly made and light yet very flavorful. Nice vibe, not pretentious yet feels special enough for a date or a special occasion. 

This used to be one of our "special occasion" restaurants we came to earlier on in our time in SF, but we hadn't been back in 5+ years, so we were very excited to come back and eat their delicious food. Overall we still enjoyed the experience, but couldn't give it a 5 star rating based on 2 glaring things...

1) Our service (just to our table) was horrendously slow. Everyone around us who came in after we put our orders in got their orders before us. And we're not just talking about a 5 minute extra wait. More like we waited for 30 more minutes compared to everyone else. 

2) They recognized that we were unhappy with the wait so they comped us a dessert, which was nice of them. We ordered the tiramisu--hey it's an Italian restaurant! Sadly, this was the first time in a decade of eating at SF restaurants that I was not able to finish a dish because I found it inedible. There was ZERO sweetness to this dish, like the pastry chef forgot to add sugar and added salt instead. I had three bites to make sure I wasn't imagining this, and my husband had a bite too and found it disgusting as well. The waitress asked how it was and I told her my honest opinion, she offered to give us a different one (again, very nice of them) but at this point we had stayed in this restaurant for waaaay longer than intended and our babysitter was waiting, so we just ran out of there. 

So sad, we really love this place! Hope they improve on our next visit...
author: Sfmama M.

description: This was was just ok. The service was good, food was edible but nothing I would come back for, and the ambiance could have been better. This place was probably great 10 years ago but not at the moment.
author: Bob S.

description:
Very cozy location and the place. Excellent staff great service. The host was so pleasant and called us to invite us earlier in case we are ready and I found it very sweet and nice. We reserved a table for 12 people and didn't have to wait long to get a reservation nor to wait to be served on the busy pre Christmas time.
As far as the food it is good but not the wow. Their bread was not the best, my party usually finishes the bread way before appetizers come but this was remained untouched. It was more like a soft sweetish rather than crispy baguette. Lamb chops were great, crispy calamari excellent, muscles in white wine was a good choice. Overall it was what we were looking for that night. I'd still give 5stars.
author: LOVEMYKIDS L.

description:
I moved to the city a year ago and have been searching for my favorite, go-to Italian joint since. I've tried a handful scattered throughout the city and just haven't found "the one" (I'm obviously very passionate about my Italian food). I stumbled upon Amarena for a friends birthday dinner and my search ended. 

This place is everything you would want your regular Italian joint to be. It's a homey atmosphere - smaller but not congested. The food is amazing. I took a taste of what everyone ordered (I'm that friend) and everything was incredible.  I highly recommend their seafood pasta - unbelievable. 

Above all else, though, is the service. The woman waiting on our table was passionate about the restaurant and made sure we had an excellent experience. She made great recommendations, was attentive to the table and really made our whole experience at Amarena great.

Overall, highly recommend Amarena. Great food, warm atmosphere and tremendous service.
author: Katie R.

description:
i loved everything about amarena. it's an intimate restaurant in russian hill that serves up some delicious pastas and entrees. came in with a group of 6 for dinner last night via reservations on opentable.  place was pretty empty so we got ALL the attention. not sure if that was warranted because as soon as the wines started flowing we got super rowdy (of course).  the wine list is great - lots of delicious italian varieties to choose from.

we ordered (A LOT OF FOOD) - calamari, beef carpaccio (skip) - a slew of pastas: gnocchi with gorgonzola, gnocchi with truffle (they were very generous with the truffle), seafood linguini (a giant serving), bucatini, the pappardelle with wild boar ragu - and finished with mains - veal milanese (large portion) and osso buco on polenta (larger portion).  everything was pretty freaking delicious! the pastas are for sure drool-worthy, as was the veal. i really liked the attentive service, they kept checking on us every few minutes too make sure everyone had enough wine.  would definitely come back!
author: Christina L.

description: A very nice neighborhood restaurant. Friendly service, clean, serving good food.
author: John D.

description: I finally visited Amarena last week, and it was to die for. As someone from Modena, I loved their appetizer Gnocco Fritto with cold cuts. I had the butternut squash ravioli and they melted in my mouth. Someone else in my group got the gnocchi with gorgonzola and radicchio...they looked delicious. The lasagna was ok, classic but didn't leave an impression on me. Wonderful service and ambiance. If you're looking for a romantic spot, ask for the table on the window side!
author: Elettra F.

description:
A cute little gem in the city. Decor is delightfully old world Italian.  Great food and service, by both the wait staff, and bus boy. Excellent Creme Brulee and Tiramisu.  Perfect el dente Marinara Pasta with Seafood.  Delicious Lamb with great tasting mashed potatoes.  My man does not like Marinara sauce so he asked if he could have a cream sauce (not listed on the menu) with his seafood pasta.  The chef agreed.  The cream sauce was spot on, and he loved it.  Good bread too. 

Unless you get lucky, parking is hard to locate, so be sure you allow yourself enough time to find parking before booking the reservation.  It took us a good 20 minutes to find a space then we ended up walking for almost 15 minutes to the restaurant in the Rain.  Well worth it though.  The food here is fantastic!
author: Karen S.

description: Long overview 5-star review for Amarena, given I've now been here 20+ times and I live less than a block away.  This place is the definition of a neighborhood gem.  The ambiance is lovely - warm and inviting from the moment you walk in the door.  I've found the owner(s) and service staff to be nothing but incredibly friendly and helpful.  And perhaps most importantly, the food is on point!  They even recently started heating up the free bread, which up until that point was probably my only consistent gripe about this place.  In terms of specific food items, we've settled into a routine by now and if you stick to any / all of the following, you won't be disappointed:  cucumber salad, any derivation of a burrata appetizer, butternut squash ravioli, gnocchi, and the truffle mushroom pasta is out of this world.  Can't wait to go back again soon!
author: Brian D.

description:
Really amazing. From start to finish. Perfection. Service exceptionally warm and friendly. Had a nice meal where the music wasnt blaring, all service staff was there to assist in any way and never rushed us. True european dining 1.5 hrs later our meal was complete. Nice wine by glass and bottle selections.

Food fresh, elegant yet approachable. Seasonal features. Home made delicious pasta. Desert unique and delish!

A hidden gem and must try!
author: Jodi M.

description:
I came here on a whim after some girls I was with asked me for Italian food. The space is beautiful and located on a quiet/cute street. I ordered the calamari/shrimp, lamb pops, and gnocchi. The calamari wasn't the cheapest calamari I have ever had but it tasted like it should have been. The plate was mostly shrimp and not much calamari, the portions were extremely over salted. Worst calamari I have ever had especially in SF. The gnocchi was solid, the most solid dish. I hated the tacky garnish (way too big of parsley). The cheese sauce is rich and strong, and the gnocchi itself was the right texture. The lamb pops were $40ish and tasted as if they should have been part of a $15 buffet in Las Vegas. The presentation was so "cruise ship" esque. I have laid off reviewing for a few years but this experience was so bad I had to write a review. In retrospect I should have stayed in the marina and just stuck with the Italian Homemade Company. 

The takeaway from this review is, the price point of this establishment does not match the quality of the food. The setting matches the price point, they just need to work on the food.. The server I had was extremely solid, very charming and smiley guy!
author: Robert O.

description:
Amarena is one of my absolute favorite Italian / Dinner restaurants in SF. The food is out of this world. The pasta is absolutely fantastic. I've taken several groups of friends/family to this place and they all loved it. We love the Italian lady and always trust her recommendations on wine and specials. 

You have to start with the burrata and the meat plate. The mortadella and prosciutto is amazing but even better are the fried bread that its served with. 

My favorite pasta is hands down the Paccheri dell"Alpino - it is absolute perfection I always make someone at the table get it so I can at least have a couple bites. 

The osso bucco is also lovely -- really big and hearty but so tender and flavorful. 

As for dessert, try to save room. We love the tiramisu and gelato.
author: Shanna N.

description: Amazing!! Best pasta I've had in San Francisco! Wait staff is also amazing and so accommodating. Sangria was great and so was the music, can't wait to come back!
author: Catalina M.

description:
My first meal in SF for the weekend and I was really disappointed. There were other items on the menu I KNOW I would've enjoyed more. Should've gone with my gut-feeling. Also, I'm just really picky when it comes to Italian food because I've had really amazing and authentic Italian dishes in the last year. 

Let's start with the positive. Loved the romantic, fun, and trendy atmosphere. Service was also fantastic. 

For starters, I went with the Cucumber salad. It was a bit bitter... I should've gone with the Carpaccio. As for my main course, I chose the Orecchiette pasta which I should've gone with the Butternut Squash Ravioli instead. The orrecchiette pasta was too heavy and creamy. It should be lighter and I should be able to taste all the flavors instead of just cheese. 

Really annoyed.
author: Michelle H.

description:
This place is the best ! 
Paulo the owner is fantastic
 
I feel like I'm in Italy 
Always great wine the place is so charming 
A true gem in San Francisco 

The food is wonderful and the experience is one in a million !
author: Spike 2.

description:
Just had dinner here and I was not too impressed. I think that the food is decent, but overpriced. 

We started off with free bread, which was soft and went well with the oil served. Unfortunately I think that the bread was better than our entrees. My boyfriend and I ordered the salmon and the ear pasta with broccoli rabe and sausage. The salmon was overcooked and lacked flavor, but I really liked the fried zucchini that came on the side. The pasta was a bit undercooked and too cheesy for my liking. The menu said that it was white wine sauce, but all I could taste was the overpowering cheese.

Service was okay- we had to ask more than once to get bread refill. The bill came out to be over $70 for two of us, including wine. Overall I would probably pass on coming back and go elsewhere.
author: Sophia H.

description: Great little local date spot. My boyfriend lives around the corner and it's our favorite spot to grab a bite during the week...especially if we can sit outside on a nice night. Staff is great!
author: Jaime J.

description: Nice little neighborhood resteraunt. Ambiance was nice. Food was really tastefull. We had the linguini with clams/shrimp which was the best. Veal was ok. Butternut squash raviolis also really good.  Lots of great flavors going on with the food. Could not figure out the service. The resteraunt wasn't that busy, but our waitress was not taking care of business. Slow, slow n slow.  Did not know if they had specials, brought our food to the wrong table and had to ask for cheese for pasta! If you are going just for the food it is recommendable.
author: Arturo B.

description:
First, have to say, what a FABULOUS location, wonderful facade on the outside of the restaurant, and super adorable and cozy interior and atmosphere. We had reservations for six and they were very prompt about seating us when we arrived. They did have to put two tables together, which seemed strange since we had reservations for six and I would have thought, with a reservation, the tables would have been ready. But no big deal. 

This was for my birthday and it was definitely a quiet evening. The other patrons in the restaurant seemed to be enjoying themselves and that was a good sign. 

We ordered a couple bottles of wine, a couple of appetizers and our main entrees. The wines seemed reasonable in price. 

However, the appetizers were so minuscule and overpriced, it was a little disheartening. We ended up having five of us show up for the dinner and we ordered the eggplant, the calamari, and the salmon tartare.  The eggplant was literally three small bites or so. I had a teensy little piece to be able to share with everyone. I didn't have any of the calamari (due to it also having shrimp and I am allergic to shrimp - probably should have said it contained shrimp in it on the menu), and the salmon tartare, once again was such a small portion, I ate two corn kernel size bites to ensure others could try it. It was very disappointing. The tartare was completely bland with very little flavor. If it had not been for the arugula to give it a little zing, it would have tasted like air. 

The eggplant marinara sauce had great flavor other than at the end, you got a note of it being a little burnt, meaning the simmer was too high. 

For dinner I ordered the lamb chops. I ordered them medium rare and received medium well, dry, bland teeny (3) little bite sized "coin" style drenched medallions. The mash that they came with, I picked up in one scoop with my fork and they retained the round scooper shape when I did it. I had a couple of what looked like tempura battered veggie sticks on the plate. DEFINITELY an overpriced dish. 

My friend ordered the Spaghetti Vongolese and we decided to share each others dinner.  She had some of my lamb and I took a few spoonfuls of the spaghetti. Again, the spaghetti was super dry and bland. I actually took a spoonful of olive oil and some pepper flakes and made it have some flavor. 

Everyone else's dishes looked delightful (Gnochhi w/truffle, Short ribs, and Veal Scallopini) were the other dishes. They all seemed very happy with their choices. 

Service was very good and attentive and the server did a great job of taking care of us, even though my water remained empty the entire dinner, after I had drank all of it the first time. 

I don't think I will go back to this restaurant. However, I harbor no ill feelings on the matter. Just not as goos as some other Italian restaurants in the area.
author: Tanya C.

description: Most of the food was fine but not very good, chicken was pretty good, carpaccio was bad, we had some good wine and had a good time.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
What a cool little Milanese restaurant tucked on a quiet corner away from the bustle of Polk St. The service was friendly and attentive and the food delicious. I loved the decor and ambiance.

My favorites here:

Pappardelle with wild boar ragu - very good

Orecchiette with broccoli rabe and Italian sausage - very good

Osso bucco - delicious

Perfectly cooked rack of lamb with blueberry sauce - delicious

Tiramisu mouse with a fresh shot of hot expresso - astoundingly good

Amareno cherries with vanilla ice cream - very good
author: David T.

description:
Came with a party of six on a Saturday night with reservations. It is a small corner restaurant with valet parking since the parking in this area is super hard. Once we entered we got greeted and seated right away. The owner/manager was really friendly but a bit hard to understand with his strong accent. 

Forgot the name of the red wine we had but it was very light and had a mild after taste which was awesome for my likings - and that says a lot because I don't like to drink lol.

We started off with two appetizers:

-Beef carpaccio: very delicious especially with the arugula and cheese toppings. The beef was a bit hard to tear apart when we were trying to grab our own pieces but I was a big fan of this dish.
-salmon: can't seem to find the name of the dish, but it was like a salmon poke dish. The salmon was soft and topped with arugula which went well together as well. Not bad but nothing spectacular.

Entrees:
-Truffle gnocchi special: this wasn't on the menu but a special that our waiter told us about. The gnocchi was very soft but a bit bland without the truffle sauce. The sauce was made perfectly and I truly enjoyed every bite.
-Butternut squash ravioli: my favorite entree of the evening. This was my boyfriend's dish and I took one ravioli and immediately grabbed a few more after the first bite. The butternut squash was perfectly sweet with the cheese and filling! I will definitely order this again when I'm back.

Desserts:
-Tiramisu: didn't try this one because I am not a fan but everyone else really liked it and the presentation. It was in a cup with pieces of tiramisu bites with a milky substance.
-Creme brûlée: this dish was okay, nothing special. Starting to realize I'm not a fan of overcooked sugar on the top of the Creme brûlée too :/
-chocolate crepe and vanilla ice cream: my favorite dessert of the three. The vanilla bean ice cream was very delicious and was paired with a chocolate covered crepe. I enjoyed the ice cream more than the crepe :p

This place has good service, good food, and not too expensive! Will definitely be back!
author: Amanda C.

description: Amarena is a very lively place & they were accommodating for our group of 5. Like many restaurants in SF, it's on the smaller side so be prepared to sit fairly close to your neighbors. While I appreciate good wine, I by no means consider myself a wine snob (it takes a lot for me to turn away a glass). However, our group tried 3 different wines on the menu, and they all tasted corked/sour - the waiter was trying to be patient and helpful while we tasted. The food was mediocre and came out lukewarm; Truffle gnocchi & calamari were probably the best things we tried. The Creme brûlée had a lemon flavor to it (not mentioned on the menu) and the tiramisu is almost deconstructed & served with a shot of espresso. We really wanted to like this place based on the reviews but it was underwhelming at best.
author: Tori M.

description: If you're looking for a nice date night restaurant, this is it!  They gave my husband and I a table in the back, candlelit, white tablecloths.  The service was prompt and very friendly.  The food was very yummy and served quickly.  I had the butternut squash ravioli and my husband had the lasagna.  Both were very good!  Price was about what you'd expect.  The only reason I gave 4 stars and not 5 was they didn't offer certain wines by the glass.  I wanted a glass of rosé, but they only sell it by the bottle.  Also the restaurant is small- but that just adds to the ambiance...very cozy.  Try it out!
author: Scott And Diane L.

description:
I actually really enjoyed my experience at Amarena. It was a Saturday night, and I wanted to take my sister out for a birthday dinner. She felt like pasta, so we made early reservations for 6pm. When we arrived, the restaurant only had a few other patrons: an older couple that was probably in their 70s (early bird special anyone?) and a young family with a small child. 

It took us a while to figure out what to order, and the server laughed at us because we kept arguing about starters, but ultimately we settled on a couple glasses of red wine, the arugula salad, paparadelle with meat sauce, and linguine with seafood. All of the food was really good. And they even brought out lots of bread and butter on demand. When we polished off the first basket, they even brought us a second without being asked. And when our cousin randomly showed up (with separate reservations), the wait staff even brought her an extra chair for our two top! Basically, food was really good, and service was even better!

I highly recommend ordering the tiramisu for dessert as well. This was definitely made in house and in the most traditional fashion. They provided a miniature creamer pitcher of freshly made espresso for us to pour over the ladyfingers and marscapone. It was divine!
author: Leslie H.

description: Great neighborhood spot! The service is awesome and the food is very good. Some menu items are a little hit or miss but they have some really fantastic dishes. My favorite is the bucatini. It's seriously to die for. Definitely recommend!
author: Caitlin M.

description:
Went here on a weds night. 

First, we got there pretty early and the waitress was more than happy to let us enjoy wine outside and enjoy the beautiful weather, which was very kind. 
While we were outside we ultimately had the heirloom tomato appetizer which was absolutely amazing. 

Next, we shifted indoors for dinner quite a bit later. More wine was enjoyed, of course.  Two small plates were ordered. Unfortunately my memory is failing me but they were delicious!  Believe me, it wasn't the food. The wine and good conversation distracted me hah. 

However, the salmon entree was so mind blowing I stopped mid-sentence and had a moment with my food.  I don't even have words and if you like salmon at all, I can't recommend it more. 

Finally, I got to meet the owner Paolo and his wife- they're wonderful!  Definitely a family affair restaurant. 

This was a top-notch experience. Thank you!
author: Alicia Marie P.

description:
My wife and I went here for her 31st Birthday dinner. We were looking for authentic Italian food, and found it! It is a laid back atmosphere and it was great.

We started out with the burrata and had the Butternut Squash Ravioli (which was fantastic) and the Gorgonzola Gnocchi (which was amazing) for our main courses. We found a new favorite.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Ci Sta!! Que ristorante miraviglioso! The mains were fantastic and the service was impeccable!
author: Brittany T.

description:
I came here on a Friday night with three friends and without a reservation. They told us they didn't have a table right now, so we started walking down the hill. I heard one of their staffers chase us down across the street and yell out for us to come back if we wanted because they would have a table in 10 minutes. No sweat! We walked back and waited about 20 minutes. The man felt bad enough that he gave each of us a glass of some bubbly red wine while we waited. I've NEVER been offered free wine for an unexpected wait. Sold!

As for food, we tried bruschetta, Ravioli di Zucca (stuffed with butternut squash in a butter, sage and solty ricotta cheese), and another pasta with truffle sauce I forgot the name of. The bruschetta was delightful--definitely recommend that. I also loved the ravioli: the squash and ricotta gave it a unique flavor.

I'd definitely come back if I were in the area!
author: Ashish B.

description:
Solid Italian restaurant in Russian Hill. It was a beautiful afternoon, so the hostess set up some tables outside, and we were able to enjoy the sunset with our meal. Great service!!

The beet salad and lasagne were both delicious, along with the burrata. Although it's hard to mess up burrata... this one was paired with perfect heirloom tomatoes.

They make all of their pasta in house - it makes a difference!
author: Michelle L.

description: Cool decor, packed house.  The pasta was great, and I was delighted when they gave us some wine while we were waiting for our table.  Good service, good sauce, get the table near the window!
author: Charles C.

description: One of the best Italian restaurants I have been to...delicious authentic Italian food
author: Gwen R.

description: Love Amarena! My favorite Italian place in the city... very cozy and romantic...the food is amazing!!!
author: Bella S.

description: Love this place! Every waiter we've had has been amazing (has had an Italian accent as well) and super nice. The food is great with the added bonus of having gluten free options for those who love Italian but can't always indulge in pastas and bread. Try their sangria! It's bomb.
author: Stephen C.

description: Absolutely delicious food and service! We ordered a good variety and everything was spectacular. I would come here again!
author: N R.

description: I love their food! The squash ravioli are excellent. They had fresh truffle once that they used for the truffle gnocchi, I'm dying to have this dish again. I went with a friend who lives half time in Italy, and he confirmed that it was excellent Italian food. The baked eggplant & burrata are my favorite for a starter.
author: Stéphanie F.

description: The food was so good that I wished the portions were larger. Service was perfect! Food came out in great time. Room was a little smaller so it was hard to hear across the table during our 8 person dinner reservation. Parking sucked balls so if you're not used to driving in the city, catch an uber.
author: Chayce A.

description: After coming back from a 2 weeks stay in Italy, we were craving Italian food. More than that, though, we were craving that feeling of home grown, made-with-love, sentiment that is pervasive throughout the charming Italian countryside. Not sure how but we found that at Amarena. It wasn't just the food--which isn't a passable matter as it was every bit he authentic, delicious Italian experience--but it was the rustic atmosphere that felt like a night of home cooked food by your Italian grandma. We even met Paulo, the owner, who was the epitome of a charming Italian friend chalk full of compliments, smiles and good intentions. Love it, want to make it a regular stomping ground. Definitely a must visit!
author: Ryan P.

description: Great atmosphere- feels local and treated like a local- especially if you are nice. Visitors need to understand this Italian restaurant loves to serve good food and treat you as if you are visiting their home. The pasta is fresh and wine list is decent and reasonable. Fun place , good food and good service.
author: Todd G.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in SF. I love the vibe, love the service, and the food is amazing every time I go there.
author: Joe W.

description:
Pretty cute neighborhood spot. Food was yummy and probably on the 4 star scale (not 5, best meal of your life but solid home made pastas).  I had the salmon which was great and shared a pasta.  The best was the pasta with Italian sausage. 

Why 3 stars?
Went as a group of 7 and tip was included. $63.10 on a $291.01 bill.  Yep, 21.6%.  Nothing wrong with the service, but come on, that is steep.  18% is what I would expect, 20% I would understand given the group, but going above that merits a dock in a star in my opinion.

General feedback, the plates are thrown in the bin during clean up with no care causing it to be VERY loud from simplely plates banging around.   Could be a cute, quiet neighborhood spot, but you find yourself trying to talk over the cleanup.  Think they could take their time removing plates, and maybe move clean bin back to kitchen so not as loud in the eating area.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Excellent, authentic little Italian restaurant in Russian Hill. Warm and intimate ambiance - high ceilings, white tablecloths neutral walls distressed to give the feel of old Italian architecture. 

My entree was spectacular. They had fresh black truffles in house and had a few menu items featuring them that night. I chose the homemade gnocchi - certainly some of the best I've ever had - perfectly tender and done in a rich sauce with porcini mushrooms and fresh truffle shaved on top at the table. I'm drooling a bit thinking about it right now!

Our group shared a few small plates as well including the Frittura Mista, which was nicely fried and not too heavy;  porcini mushroom done with garlic, parmigiano and polenta (didn't blow me away honestly, though the folks I was with absolutely loved it), and an eggplant dish with a tomato sauce. 

The serving sizes were generous, and we packed quite a bit home. 

Ultimately a great little find!
author: Leah M.

description:
Came here last night with the hub for my 30th bday dinner. Great homey ambience, we're from Boston (no living in SoCal) and this place reminded us so much of it! 
We began with the beef carpaccio, it was soooo tender and flavorful!!!
My husband had veal - which he only ever orders at our favorite Italian place back home, so the standards were high. He loved it! Amarena's recipe adds in sage and it has the most beautiful flavor!
I ordered the broccoli rabe and Italian sausage pasta. I only ever have it when my father feels like cooking it. How was it at Amarena? Phenomenal!!!!!
Absolutely delicious, it made me homesick!  

This place has a fantastic wine selection, and our waitress was sweet, and had great recommendations.

For desert we had the chocolate salame, different - and tasty!

My only tip to the owner - the bathroom needs an update! Please :)

Other than that - this restaurant is amazing!!! A 100% gem!
author: Ashley D.

description: First time here! My friend has been 3 times before and suggested we stop in before heading home. Could not feel more like Italy. The food: AMAZING. The service: SPECTACULAR! Best Italian I have EVER had or been to. Highly suggest the Gnocchi. Ask questions, have fun they are top notch. Veronica; so knowledgeable and friendly, amazing waitress. Paulo, the owner, so humble and genuine made sure we felt welcome. Daniel, our second waiter very prompt and attentive. Go, go!
author: Taylor H.

description: Pure Magic! We had our wedding reception here and it was perfect. Paollo helped create a stellar menu and let us rent out the front room and decorate with flowers and glassy baby's to set the right vibe. Perfectly tucked away and out of the rush of Polk street, this place has a romantic mood in a private setting with some of the best Italian food I've ever experienced. The Bruschetta and Butternut Squash Ravioli are outstanding!
author: Jake W.

description: Really enjoyed the environment and food here. The portions were well sized and all the sauces were great. Plus, I love when a place handles its vegetables with as much care as its proteins, and that is definitely true here. Also, they gave us a free glass of champagne because they were running a little behind. I definitely appreciate that!
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Exquisite Italian food. I can't stress how difficult it is to find a gem like this. It's like I stepped right back into Rome.

- Hands down best gnocchi I've had in years. 
- The Amatriciana was perfect.
- bruschetta that I've been missing since Rome

Our server was sweet and funny. It was nice to speak Italian in an Italian restaurant again. 

I highly recommend this place.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
My first #Yelp review 

My friend recommend this spot for the wine bar. I ended up ordering the barata and spa'ghetti. Delicious! 

Even better was the staff. Honest and knowledgable. Recommended all around
author: Allison M.

description:
Ordered the chicken was told it would take longer she suggested an appetizer ( we no longer had the menus) she suggested one with fried bread with mortadella and prosciutto. When the bill came that little appetizer was 18.95!
She should have told us and we should have asked. New to the neighborhood we won't go back!
author: Lori M.

description: Butternut squash ravioli is amazing here. Must try. Staff was very polite, bread served was very soft and fresh
author: Abhishek G.

description:
The waitress here with the heavy italian accent is super adorable.  Lots of "ciao bella" here and "bella" that... When asked for her opinion on wine based on what we liked, she was spot on!  

The food was decent.  Not great but not bad.  I probably wouldn't come back even though it's in my neighborhood and the service was great... But I want me food to dance in my mouth and I didn't get that.  Food always comes first for me... ambiance and service second.  =)  

But do come and try it out!
author: Vicky T.

description: Food was great! Staff was extremely friendly however service was a bit slow.
author: Angela P.

description:
I mean, can it get any better?!!!!

I brought my honey here for a date night and I am so glad he enjoyed it as much as I did. 

I first learned of this amazing place when my girlfriend's parent took me for an early NYE dinner. The whole time I was there, I was thinking "I have to bring my babe here bc he loves Italian." I had their Wild Boar pasta dish and it was AMAZING! The sauce was magnificent!

The second time around, I had their Seafood Linguine. Loads of clams and mussels and a few pieces of jumbo prawns to fill me up! And the sauce....THE SAUCE!! It was so freaking delicious I took the rest of the bread we had left to soak it all up!! The boyfriend called me a Piglet in the process. What can I say? I LOVE FOOD! 

My honey babe boyfriend had a tube pasta dish with some kinda cured meat (maybe?) and that was just as amazing as mine. I will definitely try that on my next visit. 

We had a wonderful time over perfected cuisine. The service was just as amazing; very attentive.

**salivating as I'm writing this review...*slurp

Thank you, Amarena!
author: L S.

description: Excellent service, fantastic food! Loved the homemade pasta and ravioli. Perfect for groups!
author: LuLu K.

description:
I've lived in this neighborhood for several years and never tried this place. The food was delicious... definitely 5 stars. But the service was randomly spotty. The hostess was great, the busboy was great, but the waitress was hit or miss. Making my overall rating 3.5 stars.

The food: We had the Pear salad, Spaghetti Vongole, Tagiatelle ai Funghi, Creme Brulee. Every dish was delicious. 

The service: No idea what was with waitress. She seemed annoyed that we didn't order alcohol (Sometimes we're not feeling boozy. Even though it's Sunday night, we have work to do and pasta + wine = nap time). And we never got spoons to facilitate the twirling of our pasta and making eating clams in the shell nearly impossible. Then she took an eternity to bring us the check. After we asked for it twice. We waited for the bill for nearly 30 minutes until finally my boyfriend just went up to the hostess and asked for the bill.

I would eat her again for the food, but perhaps we should come here during happy hour when individualized service won't be such an issue.
author: Dani D.

description: I loved everything I tried here. A little salty but Italian food usually is that way.
author: Paloma R.

description:
Cozy little neighborhood joint that knows its way around the Boot.

We are not huge Italian fanatics, but you can't ignore that all the comp in these SF environs really does demand the best. As such, unless you ARE an Italian fanatic, Amarena will likely give you the best Italian meal you've had in a long time.

First, best advice I can give is pay attention to the specials. From the apps on, they matter. For our visit that meant a nice grilled asparagus and parm app that was a great starter.

For entrees -- go with any special, particularly if it involves fish. Still, the standard seafood pasta is tough to beat, thick with fresh shellfish and rich sauce. Only slight nit is that the house meat lasagna is more of the velvety, smooth prep than the stand up and salute block-o-pasta that many diners may have grown up on. Nothing wrong with it, but just be aware.

House red pours were fairly priced and generous, and the wine list had no complaints it was just that we weren't in a wine drinking, let's knock back a couple bottles mood.

Do have to demand that you finish with some Mousse al Tiramisù and espresso. Just outrageous.

Service was funny, friendly, skilled yet devoid of attitude. I'd go back tomorrow.
author: Jeff T.

description: The food was great, the atmosphere was tight seating and the pricing was so-so. We had the heirloom salad, mussels/clams in wine sauce, boar pasta, veal, a bottle of wine and tiramisu.  The service was excellent.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Seriously the best Northern Italian restaurant in SF. (Full disclosure: I'm Sicilian). We came in with a reservation and were seated right away. The service is impeccable. Our waiter was really friendly and attentive. And has great taste in wine. I let him choose reds for me (San giovese, Zin and then a cab/franc blend) probably the best wines I've had! All were Italian. 

As for the food. Wow. Just wow. 

We started with the burrata and tomatoes. So fresh and delicious followed by gnocchi in Gorgonzola sauce. It was so good I licked the plate. Yea. I know. I knowwwww. 

For entries we had the veal shank with polenta and veal scallopini. 

I think I died! The veal shank was bold, rich and hearty. The polenta a perfect foil to the richness of the meat. I cleaned my plate. 

The scallopini is stuffed. I mean. No words more. Just get it. 

Alright in conclusion awesome food, good wine, great service and totally romantic & cozy place. 

Highly recommend.
author: Timoteo K.

description: Great spot for classic homemade italian food. Homemade ravioli was one of the best dishes I have ever had. Will definitely be back when in SF again.
author: Brandon G.

description:
The food here is delecious and I love that they can make all their pasta gluten free!
Definitely the best gnocchi I have ever eaten before. The burata salad was really good too. The service is great, they made good recommendations and made our pasta vegetarian on request. 

Will definitely go back there!
author: Manasvi S.

description:
We went here for our anniversary, looking for wonderful food and a romantic, quiet atmosphere. Unfortunately we were disappointed!! The food was good but not great, we've definitely had better Italian in the area. The restaurant is small and the tables are realllllly close together. We had loud businessmen next to us and could hear them better then we could hear each other! 

Needless to say it wasn't the romantic atmosphere we were hoping for based other reviews.
author: Kelsey W.

description:
I've dined here numerous times however our most recent visit wasn't as spectacular. Perhaps it was an "off" night. 

To start, service was kind of awkward and felt way too sales-y. We were the only ones in the restaurant and they kept trying to push us to order more. The server seemed disappointed that we ordered a glass of wine each instead of a bottle, didn't order the day's special or want dessert.  

Now the food...the sauce in the mushroom tagiolini dish was quite frankly bland. I've had a similar dish here before (they might have used a different pasta) and I remember enjoying it a lot more then. Hub's bucatini however was fantastic - al dente pasta and had great bacon flavoring in the sauce. 

Still a charming location and restaurant always feels cozy - especially since it was COLD out and felt more like January than October. I'm hoping it was an off night that night because I've always been fond of Amarena and would like to return.
author: Esther A.

description: We went here for our first time with my parents for my husband's 30th birthday. We had one of the best dining experiences we have ever had in SF. The food, wine, ambiance and service was outstanding. The wait staff even overheard us talking about my husband's birthday and surprised him with a dessert that had a lit candle. They even went as far as to turn off the lights in the restaurant when they brought out the dessert and everyone sung happy birthday. It was very special. We had dinner at Harris' steak house the night before and our experience at Amarena put that one to shame. I will be dreaming about that pasta until we return (very soon).
author: Rachelle R.

description:
Had girls night dinner here Friday night, what a cute little place. Started with a bottle of Sauvignon blanc... Great call. They bring out some amazing bread while you wait, I'm not sure what kind it is but it is addicting - be careful.

I had the linguini allo scoglio (linguini with seafood) in a spicy tomato sauce, I could eat this once a week. They give a generous portion of seafood and the sauce has a nice kick. 

One gf got the tagiatelle ai funghi e tartufo and cleaned her plate. She loved this.

Lastly, my roommate wasn't very hungry so she got the baked eggplant dish off the "small plates" section. Again, she loved it.

We will def be back... We were all satisfied without being overly full, Prices were great for the quality & the service was fabulous. Thanks!
author: danielle a.

description: Absolutely wonderful place. Dropped in here on a Sunday night for dinner with a friend and we both thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience. The service here is fantastic as is the food! They serve Italian bread that's crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle with olive oil as an appetizer. I had the lasagna and it melted in my mouth. We were in and out in 45 minutes and I'll certainly be back for the creme brûlée!
author: Abby H.

description:
Really enjoyed this small neighborhood Italian spot in Russian Hill.

Started with the burrata which was really delicious.

I got the gnochi a la gorgonzola which was a nice, homemade pasta dish.  The real star was the butternut squash ravioli that my girlfriend got.  This was hands down the highlight of the evening.

Would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a nice Italian restaurant.
author: Jon F.

description: Great food! Fresh pasta tasted great. Good atmosphere and service. Highly recommend this restaurant!
author: S B.

description:
My girlfriend and I ended up at Amarena by chance, after not realizing that Elephant Sushi is closed on Tuesdays, but I am so happy that we walked in the door.

We were seated right away, it was about 6:30 on a Tuesday, but they gave us a nice table right by the window.  Ultimately, we were greeted by the waiter whose name escapes me but he was phenomenal.  Very attentive but not invasive.  Conversational but not pushy.  Explained the specials, helped us with the wine list, etc.  Ideal service from the start.  

So first off, the bread at this place is absolutely delicious, which sounds ridiculous but it is noticeably better than any other Italian place I've been to.  We also ordered a bottle of wine and even though I usually prefer other beverages, the bottle was pretty solid and not too expensive (~$40).  

We ordered the Gnocco Fritto con Affettati to start and it did not disappoint.  Classical Italian meats (sopressata, prosciutto, mortadella) with fried dough.  The meats were delicious and when combined with the dough (think of a beignet without the sugar) we were off to a great start.  

For dinner, I got the Pappardelle al Cinghiale, pasta with boars meat ragout, which was delicious.  Not too heavy, perfectly seasoned, good, hearty dish.  However, my girlfriend ordered the Ravioli di Zucca.  I was a little upset when she did because it had no meat in it but boy was I wrong.  The butternut squash was so light and flavorful.  It basically melted in my mouth with every bite.  Highly recommend the ravioli to anyone.  

Finally, for all of you dessert fans out there, this place has one you can't miss.  It's called the Salame al Cioccolato.  The description on the menu is "A lovely regional dessert from northern Italy made just for people who enjoy Chocolate" which could not be more fitting.  Basically, this is a soft, dark chocolate mixed with nuts which is flattened and then rolled up like a pastry.  Served with vanilla ice cream and hot fudge it's got the makings of real crowd pleaser.  

Bottom line, this place has fantastic food and service without any exaggerated pricing or snobbishness.  Highly recommend, will definitely be back.
author: Lukas A.

description: Great restaurant with an awesome local vibe. I've been here so many times and order the gnocchi. A go to that won't steer you wrong
author: Alex P.

description: We ordered filet minion and seafood pasta. The meat dish was covered with butter sauce and it was overpowering the overlooked meat. As per the pasta, I think I can make a better favorable one at home. Wouldn't go back to dine again.
author: H S.

description:
My second daughter, Kris (Joy's sister), Uncle John (My Brother), John's daughters (My Nieces)- Beca/Bethany, Joy's plethora of friends, and I celebrated my daughter, Joy's (Age . . . ??-I'm not telling!) birthday at Amerena Saturday, 9/17/2011 on Larkin via Green Street, San Francisco CA USA.

Heads Up! Roasted Portabello Mushroom with Goat Cheese and Linguini Pasta with Seafood were heavenly! FIVE STARS=*****! I will gladly proclaim without hesitation~
author: Shirley M. J.

description:
This review is only for the happy hour.

We heard about the amazing pasta buffet happy hour (i think through sosh) and decided we must try it given that we are 1) carb fiends, 2) general fat kids and 3) done with wedding season. kind of. at least the ones on the beach.

Anyways, the food was decent but there was just 1 pasta dish, 1 salad, 1 weird corn meal bread with gravy (I didn't even try it. my friend got it b/c she thought it was polenta and only had a bite), and a platter of onion bread and a platter of rosemary bread.  The rosemary bread was so stale/hard I couldn't even eat it. But for "free", the pasta and salad were definitely decent.

Long wine list, but only about 1/3 to 1/4 of  wines were available by the glass, which was kind of annoying.  When we first got there around 6:15pm, there were only 10 other people so they were bringing wine to us at the table.  About 30 minutes later as it got more crowded, we started getting some serious attitude from the servers.  The hostess milling around flippantly ignored our orders, and even the servers told us to go to the bar to get our 2nd round of drinks. In the end, we just gave up because it was taking so long.  Getting our bill took 10 more minutes.  What started out as a great evening turned sour fast. We immediately headed to our Russian Hill favorite - cafe meuse - for some delicious crostinis, drinks, and live music. And service WITHOUT the attitude.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Amazing food and hospitable service. The atmosphere is quiet and calm and would be great for dinner w Friends, family, or a date night.  

The butternut squash ravioli offered pillow pockets of light and mellow pasta stuffed with a good amount of puréed squash. 
The ravioli were a definite treat to my palate. The sauce was delicate and light yet offered a savory zip to flow through the whole meal bite after bite. 

A good hidden find in Russian Hill!
author: Roxanne R.

description: We came here for a cozy, authentic dinner and that's exactly what we experienced. The restaurant is very charming, the food was delicious and the service was wonderful!
author: Wendy L.

description: Want to escape to Italy but can't afford the flight or PTO? Then come here. The food is bomb, the wine selection is superb and the vibes are romantic and cozy. The owner is also a gem and a half. Fantastic service-- I'll 100% be going back!
author: Theresa S.

description: Some of the dishes were pretty good and some fell flat.  Ambiance okay as well.  At the price point I won't be returning but had an enjoyable meal.
author: Nikki G.

description:
Service the first time I went here was decent. Second time I went here the waitress was very rude to me and my friend and also said all the tables were reserved however a guy by himself came in right after us and got a table. 

Every pasta from here is super yummy so I will be coming back again but they need some new waitresses.
author: Xbbygirl X.

description: Great Italian food with warm service and cozy dining room. We loved the Amatriciana and Pappardelle with wild boar ragu very much. Will definitely come back.
author: Katya F.

description:
I was very excited to eat here. I'd looked at the menu online and was pumped.

We turned up and instantly I felt uneasy. We were seated next to the loudest group in the place, who as they spoke Italian  and we did not seemed to get all of the attention. 

When finally our server turned up, she was big and ballsy and not hospitable in the slightest. I asked for a diet coke to which she cackled and said they don't have that in Italy (lies, for the record!). I felt unwelcome and uneasy. 

After several more minutes the waitress delivered the food to the loud table next to us, bumping our table and not even apologizing, let alone asking what we would like to eat. 

After about another 10 minutes of being ignored (which is saying something, because the table on the other side of us didn't even have a drinks order taken!) I closed up the tab of a singular beer and left for another local restaurant on Union Street, where the atmosphere wasn't wanky and über-pretentious, but welcoming and inviting. 

Never again Amenera, never again.
author: Benjamin T.

description: Nice low key neighborhood Italian place. It seems to be slightly off the tourist path which is a pleasant surprise given its location  I have been here a few times, after considering various menu items, I always end up getting the butternut squash ravioli, which is delicious.  I also like the polenta and the burrata, although I wish the burrata came with bread or crostini.  It consists just of tomatoes and cheese, which is a little messy and unweildy to share - everyone ends up just eating off of one plate.
author: Nicole G.

description:
3.5 stars - Very courteous staff and charming owner/manager.  I like the neighborhood and vibe of this place.  
It loses 1.5 stars for being so overpriced for what it is.  Which is almost the highest quality Italian food but packed with tons of flavor and fan favorites (cheese, salt, etc.)  I would still recommend this place and/or if I heard that we had to go here for a dinner with friends I would not be bummed. 
You could do much worse in the high scale Italian restaurant scene in SF!
author: Alex A.

description:
Tasty! I had the Insalata di Lipari, which was very flavorful. It was small, but I enjoyed the presentation and flavors. I don't remember the name of my pasta dish, but it was mushroom pasta with truffle oil. Very rich, but I do love truffle oil, so I loved the dish! My boyfriend had the seafood stew, which was similar to cioppino. It was a very small serving for the price ($30).

It seems like the price wasn't right for the serving size, and my other complaint would be that my party of 6 was seated at a small table meant for 4 (with extra chairs pushed on the end). We had made a reservation, and there were other open tables when we arrived. We were also next to the wine rack, and the staff continually reached over us to get wine It was quite cramped. I think we should have been seated somewhere else.

But overall, I enjoyed the food and everyone who helped us was very pleasant.
author: Julie W.

description:
Wow, what an amazing place!  
Giada was a magnificent hostess!  My wife and I went there for our anniversary, and we were not disappointed.  I had the Paccheri dell Alpino (including every drop off sauce I could scrape off the plate with a piece of bread), my wife had the Linguine allo Scoglio, and I have to say we haven't had such a tasty meal since we vacationed in Italy 3 years ago.  For dessert, Salame al Cioccolato topped off a wonderful night.  We're definitely going back, sending our in-laws (SF natives), and anyone else who wants some of the best North Beach has to offer.
author: Robert T.

description:
I love the food and wine selection at Amarena. Special mention to the tiramisu that is delicious. Maybe the acoustic in the restaurant is not the best one BUT Paolo the owner and the entire stuff are super friendly and professional at the same time. Would you like to try a little taste of Italian authentic food?
Ok, so come here and enjoy it. 
You won't regret it.
author: Marco B.

description:
We were visiting from Hawaii...
Walked by on a Thursday night around 7:00pm... Wanted to try, with no reservations ,and Paolo seated us in the perfect spot, made us feel Special,The Waitress, so sorry I forgot her name, was Wonderful as well, she made our Dinner most enjoyable...the Food was First Class,
I had the Lamb, cooked Perfectly, my Wife had the Seafood Linguine... She LOVED it
All in all a perfect evening...Highly recommend this place, we will be back...
author: Brentley G.

description:
Very good Italian restaurant with friendly service and outstanding food.  We came at the last minute and got seated just vefore the 7 pm rush.  The spaghetti with clams was excellent, osso bucco was good, and the arugela salad truly outstanding.  Montepulciano wine was good.  

This is a small restaurant likely with a small kitchen so that there is a wait for courses.  But the service is cheerful and the food quality makes it worthwhile.  We would return again.
author: Ed M.

description:
i went here for valentine's day, as they had a prix fixed meal (and surprisingly, availability when my date decided to make a reservation for somewhere the night before).  i'm giving 4 stars out of 5 because it was a prix-fixed meal.  however, based upon my meal here for the first time, i def want to go back and check out the complete menu.  here's the break-down of the meal:

first course
argula salad w/sliced pears and side of tuna tartare - if anyone knows me, you know i stay away from tartares in general, but this really was delish and added an extra umph to the salad.

second course
dual pasta dish:  butternut squash & gnocchi - the butternut squash was very yummy, and while i'm not a fan of gnocchi, the mushroom truffle sauce was AMAZING!  i actually wanted to lick the sauce off the plate.  :)

third course
a choice between the filet mignon or sea bass - i had the sea bass w/beet risotto...excellent...that's all i can say.  he had the filet mignon and was beyond happy with it.

fourth course
almond chocolate cake w/vanilla ice cream & diced strawberries - really, just one word...YUMMY!!

to end the night, i was given a white rose in celebration of the special day.

the place is small, quaint, and definitely romantic.  it is kind of loud, but my date and i didn't seem too bothered by it.  i'm already looking forward to our next visit here!
author: Kelly T.

description:
Worse italian in Russian Hill.  Italian is the easiest cuisine in the world to prepare, however this place still hasn't got it right.  Its amazing that even in SF crappy restaurants some how manage to survive. 
Save your money for a can of Chef boyaredee
author: Mr. P.

description: This is the best place for Italian food. I came with four friends and we each had a different type of pasta, all of which were amazing. The sauce for each was superb and the service was excellent. The place is smaller so I would make reservations since it filled up quick. Can't wait to come back!
author: Courtney K.

description:
Best homemade pasta my boyfriend and I have had in SF. Cozy ambiance. The gnocchi rocked at $16. 

It's our new go-to neighborhood Italian restaurant.
author: Danielle K.

description:
Man. Went here the night I proposed to my girlfriend, and was taking a risk, because I've never been here before. I couldn't have picked a better spot. Perfect little romantic spot, and the BEST butternut squash Ravioli I have tried in SF, and the 2nd best pasta I've ever had. And server was on point.
This might just be my new Go To Italian spot.
author: Michael F.

description:
Food was good, but there was too much confusion around the items we ordered. We asked them to make gluten free and the waitress kept going back and forth 4 time, and finally replaced our order. Before the owner had to step in to save the day.

But the food was really good. Great Ambiance, in a small neighboorhood
author: Goli M.

description:
I came to Amarena with several close friends on a Saturday night.  I ended up being about 20 minutes late due to parking - nearly impossible on a weekend night!  I had to park far away down Polk Street.  Be sure to leave extra time.

The food was very good, definitely 4-stars.  I had the special of the day - an herb-crusted Chilean Sea Bass with ratatouille.
