The red-wine sangria was also great, and not too overpowering for the fish.  I also had a nice shot of espresso, which was a perfect finish.  I really wanted to try their creme brulee, but sadly was running late for a friend's party so had to skip.

Prices are about average for an Italian restaurant in this neighborhood.

The service was okay, but nothing great.  I always had the impression that our server was a little confused, and a we had to ask a couple times for extra sangria.  Overall, though, nothing egregious.  

The dining room is a little too snug, though.  I like small rooms with am ambiance, but the ambiance is ruined when they try to cram one too many tables and chairs into the room.  

I think with a slightly more attentive wait staff and one table less in the dining room, this would be a solid four star restaurant.  Overall, I'd definitely recommend trying out Amarena.  I can't quite give it four stars, but it's a very good cozy neighborhood Italian restaurant.
author: Greg B.

description:
This review is not going to be super helpful or one of my best. I'll give that disclaimer now. But it's mainly because, according to my receipt, I came here on 2/28/12, and my memory isn't what it used to be.

Anyway, wanted to at least write something as I had a really good experience here. I was meeting a friend (long lost high school friend) in Russian Hill. We debated between a few places but settled on Amarena (being from NJ, we were hankering for some Italian). She had made reservations though we did not need them. Whether it was an odd night (it was Tuesday) or odd time (8pm), I'm not sure, but it was not crowded (sad). We were greeted warmly by the hostess and were given our choice of tables - we chose one by a heater as it was a particularly chilly evening.

Our server was super friendly and accommodating; we took forever to decide what we wanted because were busy catching up. She let us take our time and did not rush us in the least. I ended up getting the beet salad and that night's special - it was a fish risotto dish and very good. My friend got the soup of the day and I believe the tagiatelle, both of which she enjoyed. We had house wine and good conversation. Our waters were kept full and the service was excellent. To note: the happy hour looked fab and is probably worth checking out. I wish I had written this sooner as could have been more detailed on the food, but I definitely would return if I find myself in that neck of the woods again.
author: Allison B.

description:
There is only one word to describe this place: FANTASTICO! What a wonderful restaurant. I have been here many times yet am positively surprised over and over again. 

The romantic atmosphere combined with amazing Italian specialities and food as well as a great wine list make this a very unique gem in the lower Russian Hill neighborhood. The service team consisting of the owner Paolo, Nicole, Gustavo and Dario is absolutely top notch! They are all super friendly, attentive and very diligent in what they do and seem to be at the right place at the right time - always.

Try the Pappardelle al Cinghiale (boar) - absolutely delicious. So are the Pennette allo Scoglio. All is homemade pasta which makes it even more yummy. Their homemade Tiramisu is just top - served in a very special way. How? Go and try it out ;-)

I will definitively be back to this great place!

Grazie Mille - a la proxima!!
author: Roman B.

description:
My friend did her birthday here, and overall the experience was so so.  

I found pricing to be pretty affordable -- majority of pasta entries averaged $15.  Portions are big.  But overall taste was at best 3-star standard (see below).

There were a few hiccups with service, including having to cram our group of 12 into a table for 8 for the first 30 minutes while waiting for the table next to use to leave ... but I can understand it's hard to predict how long tables stay.  The wait staff were not rude, but not particularly nice either -- spoke a bit too loudly to the guests, and did not take point to remember who ordered what, BUT still delivered a overall good meal.

I will also commend wine we had here.  We ordered fairly low priced bottles ($40-45) but 3 were fantastic.

HITS:
--Bruchetta ($9) for 3 -- Tastiest tomatoes, and heaps of it.  
--Wild Boar Pappardelle ($18) -- Everyone's favorite.  I actually didn't order this -- big regret.

ONLY SO SO:
--Calamari ($14) -- Pretty boring and forgettable.
--Salmon Tartare ($?) -- Not bad, but the mayo mixed into the salmon cubes overpowered everything.  Might as well have been chicken salad.
--Lasagna ($14) -- thinnest lasagna we've had -- about 1 inch to the bottom of the dish.  Lots of cheese and meat, but i prefer my lasagna squared and high, Garfield style.
--Mushroom Tagliolini ($18?) -- I read "wild mushrooms" got really excited, but the dish lacked that nutty roasted flavor you can usually expect from such a dish.  This one might as well have been made with canned mushrooms as I couldn't taste it.
author: Kendra W.

description: Super slow. Messed up our order. Waitress needs help. Food was decent, not great. Also gave us different wine then we ordered and tried to charge for it....
author: Max C.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a while and when Elephant Sushi turned us away from dinner, we decided to give Amarena a try. The restaurant was pretty empty at 6pm on a Sunday so we had our pick of tables. We ordered the beef carpaccio and grilled veggie platters to start, both of which were good. Mains: my friend had the chicken, which he said was very tasty; another had the cheese gnocchi which they also said was well done; I had the boar ragu which I scarfed down because it was so tasty and flavorful. The pasta portions were neither small nor huge, and the price is in the mid-range for SF ($20 for the boar ragu). The only con- the table bread left something to be desired.

Overall, a good meal and I'll be back again!
author: Brooke G.

description: I love this hidden Italian restaurant in Nob Hill and it has become my new to-go place. The food is great, and the portions will leave you satisfied. The environment is cozy and romantic, and the servers are very friendly and warm. I also love the fact that they have gluten-free pasta, and they also make changes in the dishes for me, which I appreciate since I have so many food allergies. Definitely a great place!
author: Renata F.

description:
Can I just say the best pasta I've ever had?

In addition to this statement I will also add that this place is very cozy and romantic, hidden a block away from the busy bar scene of Polk St.
Perfect place for a date!
I had the mushroom pasta (sorry, bad with names), boyfriend had the one with the boar.  Both amazingly delicious!  Blew me awaaaay!
author: Dasha B.

description: Quintessential SF! If you are looking for the perfect Italian meal in the perfect Russian Hill location with perfect service and quality, look no further. We had such an enjoyable evening at this place that 5 stars is not enough. Paolo, the owner, is as authentic and affable as they come. We dined on the gnocchi, fried calamari, clams and muscles, squash ravioli, veal shank, salmon and more that I'm forgetting (the wine...hah!). All perfection! Really looking forward to many return trips to this gem.
author: Peter G.

description: Hands down THE best butternut squash ravioli and black truffle gnocchi I've ever tasted. Literally the definition of melts in your mouth. I highly recommend carb loading on pasta and fresh bread here. Also loved the spunky Italian waitress! My only suggestion would be more red wine by the glass options.
author: Alison S.

description: Romantic lil Italian joint in Russian Hill. Came here with my lady for a date nite in the city. Started at the bar with some refreshing sangrias and later got seated at a table. The seating was a lil too close to other tables but the atmosphere, good service & decor completely made up for it. Got a calamari and shrimp dish as appetizer. No lie it was some of the best calamari or shrimp I ever had, period! For our entrees I had the pappardelle with wild boar ragu and my lady got the clam and shrimp linguine... And they were both amazing! Best Italian food Ive had in a while.
author: Guerito L.

description: This place was wonderful! I had been meaning to go for a long time and finally got my chance when my parents were in town. We made a reservation but I think they may have over booked; we ended up waiting for about 40 mins. The owner felt so bad that he brought us out champagne while we waited, it was so sweet! Dinner was great, I highly recommend the butternut squash ravioli- it was delicious. Will definitely be back!
author: Caroline R.

description: Five Star service and delicious food !  Amarena never fails me! Great job to German and the very hospitable host and owner Paolo!
author: Jon Q.

description: Absolute best Italian in the city!!!  We go here at least once a month. They go above and beyond to make sure you have an amazing experience every time.
author: M B.

description:
The service and atmosphere alone may keep me coming back here :) Lovely, attentive waitstaff and cozy, intimate setting made for an enjoyable summer evening.  

That aside, the apps were delish - the burrata (cannot lose) and bruschetta were so well done. Highly recommend starting with each of these.  For my main, I had to try the coveted boar pasta. My only gripe is that I wish there were more boar. It had a deep, rich flavor which I gobbled up.  My fellow diners enjoyed the seafood pasta, it looked and smelled divine and portion size was huge.  

I'll definitely be back to nosh my way through more of the menu.
author: Brianna M.

description: My wife and I came here on a date tonight. I didn't know if I was going to be able to give this place a positive review at first. They seated us 15 minutes after our reservation time and they almost skipped us for some walk-ins. Needless to say it was a bad start. Once we settled in though we had a pleasant experience. The food was proficiently made and the ambiance was more than tolerable. I think the two factors that really made the experience a positive one were: 1) the neighborhood feel, and 2) the excellent service (other than seating near-debacle). As for the neighborhood feel, the restaurant is tucked away in a quiet residential neighborhood, so there's a super relaxed vibe. As for the service, all of the staff that we came in contact with were very personable and all of our food and drinks came out very promptly, as did the bill at the end.
author: Bobby N.

description: Great atmosphere and amazing pasta at a reasonable price.
author: Robbie K.

description: I rarely give 5 stars but this establishment is well worth it! I went with 2 other people on Sunday night. We asked to be seated outside and they accomodated us and everyone else that wanted a table outside. They litterally moved the tables from inside to outside. It was a unusually warm evening. I ordered the Lamb Chops and they were excellent! Flavorful, cooked to perfection! My husband had the  Pappardelle al Cinghiale; what a treat! This dish is delicious, you just have to try it. We are going back here very soon. Great location, friendly staff and so accommodating! Thank you for a wonderful experience!
author: R. B.

description: This review is for their management and logistics, reservation at 9 and unable to even make their 15 min leeway. Food maybe ok but they couldn't even get organized for my friends to taste the food. Sorry but you need to make your reservations in order to keep people happy.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Another overrated and overpriced Italian restaurant where the food is bland and the wait times are glacial. I'm sure the people who write 5 star reviews for this insipid fare have eaten at Macaroni Grill all their lives. 

The time for a party seated at 6 pm to receive their meals and pay their check and walk out the door was 3 hours. The staff is pretty clueless on what the specials are for the day (go figure!), the "italian" waitress asked us to read the menu posted outside to figure those out...Seriously?
author: Nishant J.

description:
Found this cute little Italian restaurant on a Sunday evening after walking up from the wharf. They let us come in a few minutes before opening so we could rest our weary feet. We ordered a bottle of white wine to start us off, and then had two of the salads. The beet salad was a tasty combination of sweet and savory. The bread that started off the meal was a hit with my mom who worked in a bakery for a few years. 

For an entree, I ordered the butternut ravioli and, as other reviewers have said, it is not overly sweet- and the pasta itself is exquisitely fresh. My mom loved her lasagna and my husband's stuffed veal cutlet was perfectly seared. My dad's comment on the clam pasta?"It was okay".

Save room though, because you are going to want to order the tiramisu. They pour a demitasse of hot fresh espresso over your creamy ricotta and sponge cake.... It was heavenly. 

My only regret was that I looked like such a tourist when I walked into the restaurant in my tennis shoes and fleece... Most diners were dressy casual. 

Perfect spot for a date or nice dinner with friends. If possible, I would rate this a 4.5.
author: Sarah A.

description: The pasta was delicious! Really delicious! And the seafood was good except for the calamari which was fishy which unfortunately threw the whole dish off. The service was downright awful. I ordered a glass of wine to have with my meal and it came out after I was done. An older couple at the table next to me said they had been there many times and usually liked it a lot but thought both the service and the food was subpar on this visit. I asked speak to manager or owner but the server said that the owner wasn't there and apologized for the service saying that he was new...
author: Amy Y.

description:
Service and food amazing!

I ordered the porcini mushroom and truffle sauce with pasta. The pasta was cooked to perfection and the sauce for all you truffle fans was delicious! 

My friend ordered the tagliatelle with wild boar ragout. I am not big on gamey meats but the ragout wasn't too gamey at all. The sauce was succulent!

We paired our meals with a bottle of Vigneti Massa 'Derthona'. It was my friend's suggestion as he is quite the oenologist and a native Italian speaker. Definitely try the wine as well!
author: Kristina P.

description:
What a cute neighborhood Italian restaurant buried in the midst of Russian Hill/Nob Hill residences! 

The key, however, is the all-you-can-eat buffet happy hour that occurs every other Thursday (check the website for the next one)! All you do is buy one alcoholic beverage (or more) and you're entitled to a lovely Italian buffet! 

The restaurant opens at 5:30pm and the buffet starts at 6pm. Come early, as the front dining area reserved for the happy hour is small and fills up easily by 6:30pm.

I was able to sample some garlic bread, salad, gnocchi, and other pastas while I enjoyed a glass of malbec and caught up with a girlfriend.

Amarena is a great restaurant if you're looking to have an intimate Italian dinner.
author: Mansi A.

description:
Hands down BEST Italian in the city. Now I understand thats a mouth full and considering this place isn't even in North Beach! Oh My Goodness! But lets face it, most of North Beach is tourist central with mediocre Italian food trying to be passed as family or original recipes. 

I'm here to let you know there is still hope! I've come here on a few occasions, twice on dates and the other times because it was so dam good it made me forget I was on a bad date! The pasta is all homemade and authentic. the staff is always friendly and are always happy to seat you, even if they are about to close and no one else is in the restaurant. 

The house red wine is always a winner and affordable option unless you bring your own bottle. There pasta's are my favorite, but I've also had a lamb dish there with some sort of blueberry heaven sauce. But I think it was a special because I haven't seen it on the menu in awhile. 

They also have Happy Hour! And I believe Tuesday is some sort of pasta deal day.
author: Carlynn A.

description:
I cant believe Ive lived literally two doors down from Amarena for six months and finally ate here for the first time last week! I'm totally sold based on excellent service and high quality food. Plus the interior has a very homey feel with brick walls, small European town style windows, and everyone on staff with Italian accents.

Also, definitely a neighborhood gem. One of those places that's always busy yet there's never too much of a wait. People don't tend to make reservations to go here so there's always tons of slots available on opentable.

~~SERVICE~~
Like I mentioned - fantastic. We had a 7:30pm reservation on a Thursday night and half my party was an hour late (they are from oakland and didn't build in time for parking). The owner kept updating us, trying to hold a table for us, and just did a really great job not making us feel forgotten. If I had realized early enough my friends were driving in, he would've even had a parking spot for us (maybe one of those spots restaurants have saved for loading?). I think it definitely helped that I am a neighbor though - the owner visibly sparked up the moment I mentioned this, introduced himself, and was super friendly ( not that he wasn't friendly before).

BEST part about the service: that night the chefs spread deal (on Thursdays you can get one drink and help yourself to an Italian buffet) was ending at 8 rather than 9pm and when the owner mentioned this he could see our disappointment. So even though only half my party present and none of us had ordered drinks, he let us help ourselves to the buffet and just sit on the side to eat our food! He even promised to set aside some food from the buffet for our friends when they arrived (this promise was later kept)!

Even better part: when the last two girls finally arrived we had to wait a while for our table (not their fault AT ALL we had been telling them for an hour "our friends will be here any minute!" and they were crazy busy all along). Just as we were on the brink of starving to death, the owner came by with glasses of CHAMPAGNE, ON THE HOUSE!! For all of us. What a fantastic surprise! And he had the most adorable Italian accent.

~~CHEFS SPREAD~~
There was focaccia bread (buttery, soft, yet good firm texture), salad (simple with greens and a vinaigrette dressing, nicely done), penne with meat sauce (a softer pasta, which I like, with tangy and tasty meat sauce), rice with sausage (probably the most bland item. The rice was dry, the sausage more like cut up slices of cheap hot dogs), and meatballs (fantastic! Tender meat, fresh and flavorful sauce).

~~DINNER MENU~~
* Gnocchi - 4 stars
Very very soft, tasty, well made gnocchi. The cheese (blue? Gorgonzola?) was very strong and added a lot of flavor. It was super tasty and super fatty - I took half home and when it cooled in the fridge, the sauce became a completely solid lump! A very tasty lump - nothing a microwave can't fix.

* Homemade Ravioli - 4 stars
(Stuffed with Butternut squash in a brown butter Sauce and Vegetarian Ragu - $15)
Also fantastic. Great flavor, perfectly textured pasta that was thin yet held the contents well.

* Salads
Tried a bite of my friends' salads, a beet one and another. Both were really good, simple, light.
author: Ziyan C.

description: My favorite Italian spot in the city. It's very Italian and by that I mean the service isn't great and very little frills. The food makes up for it though. Order the Tiramisu for desert, they pour a shot of espresso in it that just ends the meal on a great note. Very fair prices. Make a reservation though because there isn't a great waiting spot outside.
author: Kyle F.

description: We called to say we were late for an 8:30 reservation. The owner said it was "no problem" so we came anyway.  We arrived and were told we could be seated in "90 minutes." The owner continued to make offensive and racist comments to our party, at which point we left.
author: Robert M.

description:
Had a great dinner here with friends last night. Will be back with my wife again soon. The pasta with bacon and red sauce was excellent. We were also impressed with the calamari and friends appetizer (there was shrimp and something else in there, as described on the menu) - it was subtly flavored and perfectly prepared. Just the right amount of crispness, not soggy, and hot but not too hot.

Overall, the ambiance and service is very good. It was a little loud, but there's not much they can do about that.
author: Jason G.

description:
Nothing special pretty much sums it up.  

Started with the arugula salad, which was ok.  The bread served with salad was ehh.

For main course I had the bucatini pasta dish which had too much sauce, was not very impressive.  My father had roasted chicken which he liked, my mother the vongole/clams which she said were so/so.  My nephew had fruttie di mare pasta which he really liked.  His friend the osso buco which he also liked.

I'd say hit or miss depending on what is ordered.  I will not be rushing back to Amarena, too many other Italian options in the vicinity.
author: Robert M.

description:
Let me start by saying this was the perfect meal. There were 3 of us. We had:
. 2 Barbabietole e Spinaci salad as appetizer
. 2 Rack of Lamb and the Mahi Mahi special
. Bottle of Montepulciano
. Shared 3 desserts- gelato, creme brûlée and Tiramiso
. Two ports and one cappucino
. Total tab with 20% tip was $280

Each dish or drink was perfect. The flavors blended exquisitely. I have not ever had such a Great and SATISFYING meal. The restaurant is unpretentious for the quality and execution of its dishes. Kudos to the chef!I thank my friends Robert and Iris who recommended this restaurant!
author: Dennis H.

description:
This is one of the cutest little authentic and affordable Italian spots we've been to in SF. Fantastic wine list, great menu choices and lovely atmosphere. 
We had the burrata caprese which was delicious to start with, and for a main course we had the seafood linguine which was fresh, good sized portion and very flavorful. My partner had a sausage based pasta which was good, albeit a little too rich. The chocolate salame dessert was nothing to write home about, I'd skip that, but it was a creative idea.
Great spot for a girls night or a romantic dinner. Ask for a window table if you want something a little more romantic.
author: Jess S.

description: I had the MOST amazing dinner with my family last night. Our waitress was amazing, I think her name was "jada". I have some serious egg allergies and they were able to make me the most AMAZING gnocchi seafood pasta. I will come back 1m times. :))
author: Christine L.

description:
Excellent pasta place and date spot.  I went here for a girls night with my friends, and we had:
1. boar pasta 
2. thick hollow spaghetti (mine)
3. half rotisserie chicken
4. wild mushroom pasta

The boar pasta came with papparedelle and was the best, in my opinion. If you get there around 7pm, you can usually get a table, since they fill up a lot later at night.  Their sangria is bombbbbbb.
author: Terry K.

description:
I really enjoyed this place.  First, they have a wonderful selection of wine.  Second, their portions are very generous for the prices.
I ordered a burrata dish to start, followed by the squash ravioli, and finished with cake for dessert. 
I think all the staff is Italian.  Atmosphere was cozy.  Is it my favorite Italian place?  Nope.  
BUT .  I would say this is a neighborhood gem.
author: S G.

description:
Great food, even better service.  This is the best kind of neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Close quarters, yet still feeling private, relaxed and intimate.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and the servers are very friendly.

Have been twice in the last month; you know it's good when the first time you vist you say, "I want to be a regular here."
author: Reviewer H.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Amarena. The restaurant is so cute and romantic! The service is amazing... Everyone is so nice. The food is delicious! I can't remember the name of the dish I get... But it's the mushroom pasta one and its amazingggg! Really filling!!! I've gotten the butternut squash ravioli before... Also really yummy however the serving size isn't that big and I was still hungry afterwards. Nonetheless I highly recommend this place!
author: Kelly W.

description:
Since that this place, as many other REAL Italian places, is totally underrated I decided it deserve a review. I live close by and every time I have been at Amarena I had a good dining experiences. The atmosphere is relaxed, but at the same time not too casual and the food is always fresh and tasty.

They have a great selection of Italian wines and a good variety of meat and fish dishes in the menu.  The always have a "Special dish of the day", so you can enjoy the best seasonal choices of the chef.

The service is friendly but very well mannered: Paolo and Simona know how to make you dine comfortable.
author: Alessio M.

description:
Thursday night happy hours here will always be a win in my book! Amazing italian appetizers, complimentary with the purchase of a glass of wine. Its a small venue that is constantly crowded, so I would recommend coming at 6PM or earlier to grab a table if you are only there for appetizers. 

The Italian slow dining pace leads a lot of yelpers who come here for dinner to complain about the service. If you are looking for a quick bite- avoid this place on Thursday nights. I have not been on the weekend, but I can imagine the same might go for weekend nights. This is a traditional Italian restaurant- they aren't focused on rushing, and you shouldn't be either! If you're looking to take a break after a long day at work, have a good glass of wine with a friend or date, and a pleasant italian dining experience - make a reservation, show up early - and enjoy.
author: Carolyn G.

description: Not as good as it used to be. $70 for a cucumber salad ($9 with three pieces of cucumber and two tomatoes) two pastas and only one glass of wine. Not a good value. Too bad since it's such a cute place.
author: Liz K.

description: The food was not cheap, but excellent. We shared an appetizer, and all had a pasta dish for dinner. Everything was awesome. The wine was also a little on the high side, but very good. Overall, an expensive meal that we all enjoyed.
author: Bill M.

description: My parents picked this spot and it did not disappoint. Service was awesome. Food is priced well and the proportions are just right. Sangria was delicious. I'd bring people here for sure. Perfecto!
author: Matthew A.

description: Finally... after almost giving up on Italian foods that are as good as in Italy or Tokyo (where I am from) in SF, I FOUND ONE. This little gem called Amarena serves the fine Northern Italian cuisine that is mouth-watering and beautifully plated. I talked to the sweet madre of the owner who sat next to me who only spoke Italian... I was in heaven, the experience could not get any more Italian. The truffle mushroom were getting shaved onto my noodle as I chatted away with the lovely folks of the Cibi molto buono and Italia. How generous. The foods and warm and attentive service were all excellent. Honestly, this is my #1 Italian restaurant in SF. And that's coming from a Tokyoite who still has not found her favorite Japanese restaurant in the Bay Area, after 6 years, yet. Oh well, I at least have one Italian restaurant I really like.
author: Mihoko S.

description: Classic example of overpriced uninteresting Italian. No real pepper on table, shit papery white bread, super greasy pasta dish, couldn't finish. Lacked freshness. Lacked authenticity.
author: Ann L.

description:
Came here last Sunday when my boyfriend's parents took us out for boyfriend brother's birthday. This place was recommended by my bf's brother's roommates/friends. Its a small little restaurant tucked on a corner in the mist of the SF streets near Union Square. 

With no reservations we were sat comfortably in their corner tables with shining (literally) views of the streets of the City. Our server was the biggest sweetheart with her absolutely sexy, husky French accent. She chilled our champagne for us as we our table socialized and studied the menu. 

Our table shared the small plate features of their beef carpaccio on top of with capers and arugola (Carpaccio di Manzo; Bruschetta  della Casa;  and mozzarella cheese on top of tomato carpaccio (Burrata alla Caprese). Fitting for the five of us, these dishes were accurate portion without overwhelming flavors and definitely a pleaser for first-timers and small eats before our entrees. 

To eat, I was excited to try their spinach gnocchi with mushroom in a (very) creamy gorgonzola sauce (Gnocchi con Funghie e Gorgonzola). Since I am around pasta on a daily basis for my job, I was taken to great heights of indulging my palate with pairing this dish with Primitivo. The Primitivo is a great pairing in bringing forth the sage in the dish. This is so helping me in my life, since it is teaching me to understand food. And it is so worth the time and effort to pair and discover why food is so enjoyable.

For dessert, of course, I had their creme brule (Crema Catalana) paired with the Moscato. It was good. However, I have had better. But that is only because Creme Brule is one of the foods, I contend with others to find the best and my own personal stamp of the best Creme Brule I have ever tasted. At least it didn't taste like some custard pudding - it tasted exactly how it is suppose to. 

Enjoyable experience, good company, and great service. I definitely recommend Amarena for dates and small groups (max 6 people).
author: Jamie L.

description:
Great local restaurant! I went here with a few friends for dinner and was very pleased with our experience. This is the type of place that makes you enjoy the local mom and pop Italian restaurants and the pride they take in their menu. It's slightly off the beaten path which keeps the local feeling as opposed to anything touristy. The food was really good, service was helpful and prompt. The restaurant was quiet enough to have a decent conversation and small but not cramped at all. 

I can't think of anything particular that would make me give this place a 5 star but I can't think of anything wrong with it and I look forward to going back for more!
author: Lauren B.

description:
I'm glad Allegro Romano was closed for a private party...Friday and Saturday. Bastards. 

After my date and I were rejected at Allegro Romano we walked on over to Amarena. 

Amarena is a great place for a date (see pictures). My date and I came here for our "last dinner before the holidays" meal and it was awesome. 

The place is dark and very trendy. It's lit mostly by candles and dim track lighting. 

The waitress was very funny and friendly. 

We started off with an Arugula salad which was good. 

For my entree I had the gnocchi with sausage. It was a solid B. My date ordered the ravioli with ricotta and I would say that was a B+/A-.  

For dessert we had the tiramisu. It was about a  "B" in my estimation. 

For two people we spent about $45 (with no wine).

I think it's a  great local restaurant and I would definitely think about coming back. 

DO NOT think of driving here. You will NOT find parking. I don't care how lucky you think you are. Just don't.
author: Carlos A.

description: Authentic Italian food and only a block away from home. The restaurant gives off a bit of an uppity vibe even for SF. I asked if they had spaghetti and meatballs (don't judge me) and the waiter gave me the look of death. Nevertheless, I went with the orecchiette and it was delicious! We also ordered the burrata to share and it was beyond amazing!
author: H K.

description:
HAPPY HOUR REVIEW ONLY:

Thursdays, starting @ 5:30pm, enjoy a free buffet with the purchase of a drink at the bar.  The buffet yesterday included perfectly al dente pasta, polenta, arborio rice and kalamata olives, focaccia, spinach salad.  Plus they replenish the food when it runs out!  The house wine was $7 (sangria was $8.00 or 8.50 I think) and although they charged tax on drinks, the buffet makes it still a good deal.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
It's not bad..........it's just that I have had a lot better.  

Service was a little slow, she must be new, took a while before we got our menu, water, bread.  

Rustic Italian dishes without any bells and whistles.  We started out with the tuna tartar appetizer and it was bland, definitely lower grade tuna as it was very chewy.   For my entree,  I had the pappardelle with wild boar.  I've had fresh made pastas before and this place just didn't wow me.  It was underseasoned, borderline bland, and the pappardelle was clumped together.  The wild boar was bland and the overall dish just didn't work for me.  

My friend had the osso bucco and he didn't seem to enjoy it that much neither as they no longer serve it with pasta.........instead it was with, I believe, polenta.   

This may sound weird but the service was attentive yet bad.  The owner kinda knew the waiter was overwhelmed and came by to check up on us.
author: jason g.

description: This restaurant is amazing!!! The food is just fabulous! I ordered burrata-tomatoes as my starter....best thing I've ever had!!!! For my main course i just ask the lady the best pasta platter she had without even looking at the menu.... Wasn't disappointed at all!!!! A must place to go!!! 12 out of 10 rating!!!!! Guys bring your wife there she cannot be disappointed!!!
author: David F.

description: This is a very nice restaurant - come and check it out. I believe you will love it too.
author: Thom C.

description: Seafood stew gave me food poisoning. Then I called to let them know about it, and they denied it was them even though I ate the same food as my gf that day excluding that one dish, and she was fine.
author: Alexei I.

description: Fanastic food.  Well priced.  great pasta.  Homemade and fresh.  Great spot.
author: Jordan S.

description:
It's been a while since I last ate at Amarena, after I moved out of the neighborhood, but when I lived there, it was hands down my favorite place to have delicious homemade Italian food.

I've only had a few items there, because when I find something I like, I stick with it.

Roasted beet salad -- Being Russian, I love beets, and this dish highlights these root veggies well.

Pappardelle with the Wild Boar ragu -- So fresh and delicious, I never thought I would eat boar until I ate it here.

Gnocchi con Funghi e Gorgonzola -- handmade gnocchi with rich sauce and better than I've had any other place.

Cioccolatto dessert -- homemade and unique, just light enough after a good meal.

The homemade focaccia is warm and we always ask for seconds and thirds. Their wines are good and go well with the dishes. 

If it's crowded, it's nice to sit at the bar and have a glass of prosecco while you say hello to Paolo, the owner.
author: Diana V.

description: This place is incredible! Amazing food, great atmosphere, and friendly staff! This is my go-to dinner spot in SF.
author: Adrea B.

description:
Since this is my neighborhood, finding last minute neighborhood gems falls to me. (A tall order I might add!) Unfortunately I feel like there are a lot of places that are "just okay". Perhaps because they are inconsistant or closed, or dead. This place fell into that. 

Monday night: Atmosphere kinda dead. We looped around the block and decided to go here anyway. 

We ordered the burratta and arugula salad followed by Osso Bucco and the special: Sole. The fish was salty, really salty, and I like salt. I had expected something light and fluffy. It was really heavy. The Osso Bucco was kinda average and pretty fatty. 

The menu was also problematic for Jewish companion. There was shellfish, pork, prosciutto, wild boar etc in almost every dish.
author: Danielle V.

description: Amarena is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. It's so cozy and romantic and the food is amazing. The cuisine is authentic northern Italian. The owner Paolo is very friendly and really cares about his customers. We celebrated here after our wedding and it was a perfect meal! The dishes are delicious. I especially like the butternut squash ravioli, the lamb with blueberry reduction, and the pappardelle with local wild boar. Also be sure to try the excellent tiramisu. All the pasta is made from scratch.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
We so much wanted to like this place---but this review is fair and accurate---so please read. First off--service and atmosphere are great !!!! Seriously----the place has the front of the house in total order,

On to the kitchen. Running out of the osso bucco @ 8:00 on a Friday night is very poor planning. The appetizer I ordered (shrimp and calamari) was easily the worst I ever had. They didn't even devein the shrimp--yuck.

I got another veal dish----it was tough and overdone. My wife got the fish--petrale sole---portion was generous but the bed of zucchini under it was over-cooked. Need I continue?

Bottom line--its a great local place--but the food is far from good. Pass this one by if you want well prepared, excellent tasting food......
author: Chris O.

description:
The fact that this place has less than an average of 4 stars is an injustice.  The osso bucco is fantastic, the zucchini appetizer is amazing, and the chef somehow always manages to find the most perfect, freshest possible baby arugula, for both the beet and pear salads.  You will also find the pappardelle and lasagna well-executed.

My husband and I come here a lot, and we are often disappointed in finding ourselves too full for the tiramisu, which is also fabulous-- good quality, honestly presented mascarpone-based zabaglione, crisp ladyfingers, and a fresh shot of espresso poured on top.  None of this dry cake bullshit with whipped cream that you see at other places.

The Amarena waitstaff is very earnest and kind, and genuinely want to provide great service and recommendations.  Sometimes they get overwhelmed on Friday and Saturday nights, but I don't hold that against them, because they are so lovely otherwise.  Many of them are also at least trilingual (Italian, Spanish, English), which is fun for my polyglot of an aunt when she's in town.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Our waitress was very friendly and had a lovely accent. My dinner companion and I shared the Burrata alla Caprese. It's not really tomato season and the mozzarella was a bit too mushy for my taste, but definitely above average. I had the salmon tartar special as my main dish. It  needed a bit more acid to cut through the fishiness, I thought. My friend seemed to have enjoyed his pasta dish.

All in all, it's a decent neighborhood place, but I've been to much better.
author: Alice W.

description: Overpriced place. Mediocre food. There is one particular server (slim a w goatee) who is kind of creepy. He kept checking out the girls running by with a creepy looking smile. Food portions are a joke. Seating is crowded. Service is so so. I wouldn't recommend it to friends.
author: vik c.

description:
The carpaccio and calamari appetizers were very meh. Edible, but somewhat flavorless, plain, and boring. The wildboar papardelle was good, very flavorful and well-balanced. The mushroom pasta with truffle oil was extraordinary, the best I've ever had. The truffle and mushroom flavors were so fragrant and delicious, though the dish is a bit rich.

Service was TERRIBLE. First of all, 7 of our party of 8 arrived at 6pm on a Sunday, and it was not busy at all. The waitress appeared to have a hard time understanding English, and we had to repeat our orders several times. She also kept rushing us to order when our 8th person hadn't arrived. The bus boy/manager were kind of rough-handed and would splash water when re-filing, or hit the glass when setting down entree plates. Also, my bread plate was dirty when I sat down, as was someone else's water glass. The waitress also dropped dessert forks carelessly on the dessert plate with a clash.

Then it really started to go downhill when everybody else had already gotten their entrees, and the owner/manager asked me what I ordered, and then went back to the kitchen to check, and told me they'd just put the baked eggplant in the oven. So I was like snore, this is gonna take forever. When it finally arrived it was somewhat undercooked if you like eggplant to be very tender. Otherwise it was not bad with the sauce.

Now the highlight of the exceedingly terrible service was when one of us tried to flag the owner/manager down to ask for the check, and he waved and said excuse me several times, and the owner/manager just flat out kept walking past him and ignored him! We persisted on the way back, and then he replied grumpily "I know!", and shuffled angrily back toward the kitchen and proceeded to yell at the bus boy about something. 10 more minutes went by, during which time a couple that had sat down some time ago walked out b/c nobody went over to take their order, and the owner/manager yelled some more at the bus boy and waitress and then hovered over our party and pointed down at us angrily, motioning that we wanted our check.

It was the most uncomfortable dining experience I've had in a long time, and it was all the more unfortunate that tip was automatically tacked on.
author: Hera N.

description:
Yeeeellllllppppp!  Can you hear me yelping?  This restaurant is ridiculously awesome!
Managed to make it to San Francisco twice over the last couple of months and could move here just for the food.  We stumbled into this restaurant the first visit and the 2nd time, I knew to make reservations.
Favorite wines although I suspect they have no bad wines on the list!
* Super Tuscan Le Fonti Fontissimo 03 (Toscana)
* Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Avignonesi 07 (Umbria)
* Montefalco Rosso Antonelli 07 (Umbria)

I have to admit my very own bruschetta is killer but their Bruschetta della Casa at $ 8.95 is Diced Organic Heirlooms Tomatoes, Fresh Red Onions in a Balsamic Vinegar and Extra Virgin Olive Oil Dressing over a Toasted Garlic Bread and is simply to DIE FOR!!!!  It makes my eyes roll into the back of my head and then.... And then...  I get to take a sip of their most wonderful Super Tuscan and I'm transported to heaven.

So soo savory is their Gnocchi con Funghi e Gorgonzola is a steal at $14.95.  A homemade Potato Dumplings with Mushroom in Gorgonzola Sauce - perfectly cooked with just the right amount of gorgonzola.

Another favorite is the Pappardelle al Cinghiale @ $ 17.95 - a homemade Pappardelle with Grounded local Wild Boar meat, Mushrooms in a Tomato Sauce.  I've had this in Orvieto, Italy and if I close my eyes, I can easily imagine sitting in Orvieto it is that authentic!!!

Holy Moly--their Salmone alla Capocaccia at $24.95 is nothing short of perfection on a plate.  Can you tell I'm in love with this restaurant?  Roasted Wild Salmon, Organic Cherry Tomatoes, Calamata Olive, Capers, Fresh Red Onion in a Light Extra Virgin Olive Oil Dressing

Last, I tasted this from my husband's plate - the Agnello alla Milanese and thoroughly enjoyed it.  It is pounded Racks of Lamb, breaded and lightly pan-fried served with saute' spinach.

This will be my default Italian restaurant on every visit back to San Francisco and I'll recommend it to all my friends.  Did I say... they all speak Italian?  

Service - Fantastic!!  Prices are crazy reasonable for San Francisco!!
author: Ginger H.

description:
Italian happy hour!! A taste of Italy in Russian Hill, the interior has a Venetian feel, servers speak in Italian sometimes, and they have a true Italian happy hour on Thursdays, with basic yet stellar food. Large wine list and great sangria!

Just a warning: they may kick you off your table if it gets crowded in the front room (they try to keep the hh in the front room and dinner in the back). They kicked us off our table to let incoming customers have a seat. Maybe that's the Italian way?
author: Lana L.

description: Parking is brutal here but the food is good! they gave me a really nice table even though I felt a bit under-dressed
author: Kevin F.

description:
i made an OpenTable reservation for this place and my friend and I were seated immediately upon arrival. The place was quaint, but not too small. I felt like I was in Italy during my entire experience. This place is a nice change to the usual spots on Polk, and located just a block away from all the Polk hustle and bustle. 

My friend and I ordered the house red wine which was spectacular. Probably one of the best red table wines I've had in a long time. We started with the meatball appetizer which was outstanding. Homemade meatballs with fresh marinara... amazing! My friend and I split the linguine dish with clams, mussels, calamari and shrimp. Since we were splitting the dish, they waitress brought out 2 separate plates with the dish already split on each plate-- nice touch and no extra cost for splitting!

Our meal was perfect, absolutely no complaints. One of my new favorites in the Polk Gulch area.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Amarena always gets a little neglected because it's that block, uphill, away from Polk. When it was Baldoria it was incredible, but I still like it a lot as Amarena.

These guys really actually seem to care about food, and they act that way from the beginning to the end of the meal. The wine list is pretty varied and the food is really solid. The burrata is creamy--but don't forget to ask for extra bread as it doesn't come over any.

Their pastas are definitely key. The three mushroom pasta is particularly good with lots of truffle oil, it just needs salt sometimes. They have a nice pomodoro sauce which is an exercise is subtlety.
author: Paul C.

description:
I live around the corner and had somehow had not stopped in for over a year, because a friend had said it was average; I am now kicking myself!! As an American with Italian parents, I will say this place is VERY good, and I was thoroughly impressed. 

I really liked the bread, wine selection was great, and pasta dished were al dente and up to par with what you could expect in Italy. Simple and fresh. 

We had burrata, linguine alle vongole, orrechiete w greens/sausage, and parpadelle with truffle oil/mushrooms....all were fantastic.

For dessert, we had the chocolate salami. I was not wowed by this dessert, but everything else was so good, hence my review.

Major plus that some of the waiters and host speak Italian; I got to practice my broken Italian :)
author: Jordana C.

description:
Amarena is another hidden gem in Russian Hill. This is one of the better Italian restaurants that I have been to in San Francisco. There was a small-ish group of us out to celebrate a birthday. The restaurant was very busy and I wondered if the service would be as good as the restaurant is handsome (Amarena has an understated beauty). Anyway, the restaurant staff was superb. They were very attentive to our group. Their customer service was on point, top-notch. 

Now on to the food. We ordered lots of small plates for the table which were very tasty especially the burrata cheese with roast vegetables. For my main dish, I had osso bucco with polenta; it's the dish that I use to grade restaurants. Amarena did not disappoint with my choice of entree. Nor did it fall down in the area of desserts. The tiramisu was delightful and the interesting presentation of having a mini-carafe of fresh, hot espresso to pour over it is memorable. I already want to return to Amarena.
author: Jen A.

description: A solid 4 stars. One out our favorite neighborhood locations. Friendly, quirky and yummy! Great for casual date night. I love the red trees outside. One night when it was very hot in SF they pulled the tables out to the sidewalk. It felt like we were Europe. Not pretentious.
author: Kelly D.

description:
I made a reservation for this place 2 weeks prior to my actual reservation, and they called me 1 hour before my reservation time to confirm if I was going to be there for happy hour or dinner.  Considering this was a group reservation of about 5 people, I was kind of annoyed that they waited until the hour before to ask me to confirm.  My friends and I didn't know there was a difference between happy hour vs. dinner since none of us have ever been there, but apparently for happy hour is just standing around the bar with a free buffet with a purchase of a drink, whereas dinner, you get a table.  They were also very pushy on the phone. We ended up getting the happy hour deal.

Luckily their happy hour deal is pretty awesome considering for just the purchase of one drink, you get unlimited access to this buffet table.  The food on the table was just meh, but it's practically free!  Buffet includes some pasta, salad, bread, rice, etc.  Nothing special.  Another downer is that there is basically no where to eat your food if you can't snag a spot along the bar.  How do they expect you to hold a drink + hold your plate of food and eat?  First world problems, I know.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
**This review is for their Thursday night Happy Hour**

Whoa what a spread! I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in to this romantic, hidden gem in Russian Hill.  The decor is warm and rustic, but the music was actually pretty loud. They offer a traditional (free) Italian aperitivo on Thursday nights and the spread included a better then average Penne Bolognese, Salad (spinach, tomato, light dressing), warm focaccia bread, and a rice side. It's unlimited as long as you purchase drinks. We ordered a bottle of wine, and sat for at least two hours.

All in all, great atmosphere, better then average food, excellent wine list, and FREE snacks on Thursday nights. I'll definitely to back to enjoy the full menu.
author: Jessica A.

description: Not worth going to. Italian is so commonplace. Don't waste your money on this place. The environment is bland. We had leaves and flies falling on us all night. Nothing to write home about on the food.
author: Ryan M.

description: Neighborhood secret with some of the best pasta around... Gnocchi and Butternut Squash Ravioli keep us coming back... And the waitstaff are so attentive and often hilariously friendly.
author: Christopher B.

description: Found this nice corner restaurant while in San Fran for business. Loved the atmosphere. We were lucky enough to have the owner wait in us and he treated us right! Food was delish.
author: Jessica K.

description: Solid neighborhood Italian restaurant. I ordered the Lasagna and it was cooked to perfection. We also had tomato, cucumber and onion salad that was fresh and spiced just right. We also ordered the ravioli with butter sauce and they were just the right amount of rich, and the pasta was cooked perfectly. Nice restaurant and very good service.
author: Jim D.

description: I came here with my boyfriend and it was great! Really good food and a perfect date spot. I had the butternut squash pasta and it was pretty bomb. Pretty affordable for the quality of food, I will definitely be going back!
author: Sarah F.

description: First time to the restaurant.  Food was actually quite good... Carpaccio, cucumber salad, veal and pasta.   The only complaint was the speed of the meal. The waitress pushed hard to go from one plate to the next.  Second plate came out even before the apps was completed!  We were looking to slow things down but it was over before ever had the chance. In and out in less then 45 min.  I recommend if you eat here... Be diligent in NOT ordering until you are absolutely ready.
author: Tara S.

description:
Amazing food. I lived in Florence for 6 months and I can honestly say that the food and service here parallels some of the best dining experiences I had in Italy. 

I went in on a Friday with my boyfriend after being snootily turned down by the hostess at Frascati, which is located right around the corner. They had a pretty full house as well, but they were able to sit us at the bar, where they even let us open the bottle of wine we brought. The staff were mostly Italian and super friendly and outgoing. You get the vibe that it is a fun place to work, which makes it all the more enjoyable. 

After we had some delicious apps and drinks at the bar (get the burrata- it's amazing), the manager came over and asked if we would like to be seated at a table. Even though there were other walk-ins waiting, he still made it a priority to seat us first. Once we were seated, I ordered the butternut squash ravioli, which was absolutely fabulous and my boyfriend ordered the Ragu, which was also a winner. 

Overall, super friendly staff, really nice atmosphere, and outstanding food! Great place to take the parents, a hot date, or a group of friends.
author: Ashley L.

description: great lil italian place in russian hill.  great for a date night, quiet atmosphere
author: Lynda C.

description: Really good Italian food in the neighborhood.  Not too expensive- most entrees under $20, although you can pay $35 for the Osso Bucco.  Our appetizers were good, especially the fruitti del mar (sp).  Calamari and shrimps breaded and fried perfectly.  Awesome.  The tomatoes and onions in oil over toast was just ok - the tomatoes were slightly under ripe, and I personally didn't enjoy the portabella mushroom appetizer - mushrooms were huge but bland, and the presentation was off; it just looked kind of unappetizing.  My gnocchi was cooked perfectly, but the gorgonzola sauce could have used a bit more kick to help out the inherent blandness of potato and pasta.  The carbonara I tried was outstanding, as was the squash ravioli.  The lasagna looked great.  Service was outstanding, and the wine selection was fine.  A nice place, perfect for a date that won't break the bank.  Don't bring young kids - it's too small and cramped inside.  The only issue was parking.  Just none.  20 minutes of driving around resulted in a "kinda" parking space 6 blocks away, and with these hills, that's no joke.  Don't ever drive there - cab or rideshare.
author: Ken P.

description: Delicious from start to finish. Great taste for price point. Best Italian I've had in San Francisco. A must go. Dessert was also amazing.
author: Matt E.

description: Best neighborhood restaurant I've been to in a while!  We live a block away, and despite having lived on Green Street for 5 years, we've NEVER been here.  We had been to every other restaurant within several blocks, but for no good reason, we never came here.  It is tiny, lively, a little noisy if you're sitting next to a table of four really loud, drunk people, but the atmosphere is generally very quaint.  Our server was very accommodating, as she offered to make a dish for my husband that was not on the menu.  Veal scaloppini with a little mozzarella were super tasty.  The appetizer salads are ok, and the frittura mista was good.  We'll be back for a Friday night dinner, or for one of their weekday happy hours.
author: Spice O.

description:
The food and service is Paramount!
It is the best Italian food in San Francisco.
author: Jon G.

description:
I'm sad that I feel this way about this cute local haunt. I'm not usually a stickler for service and I keep an open mind, but the girl forgot to put the order in for our main course. We waited 30 minutes before we said anything. When we did, the girl was argumentative and pushed back - it was surprising and frustrating. Honestly, she should have just made things right, not argued with us and put the order in, albeit late.  She said she was going to cover the meal (although that wasn't our intent) but we ended up paying for it. Totally fine, just the whole situation was ridic.

The food was great and I wish I could say I'm 100% certain going back, but there's a good chance I won't and I won't recommend anyone going here.
author: Miche W.

description: Very good neighborhood Italian restaurant. Can get busy on weekend nights, so make sure you make a reservation.
author: Scoot S.

description: I've dined here multiple times and have always had a fantastic experience. I really like the ambiance, a charming intimate vibe with great music. Food wise, it's spectacular...my absolute favorite is the Butternut Squash Raviolis. Highly recommended.
author: Frances B.

description:
I recommend the Papperadelle with Wild Boar. NIce thick home made noodles with tomato based sauce. It went fairly well with the Barberra we brought with us (only $15 corkage). Perfect portion for me but a bit on the small side if you are a hungry boy. Another pasta dish that I recommend is the butternut squash ravioli. Definitely on the small side in terms of portions but truly one of Amarena's more unique pasta dishes. My friend who ordered the Spaghetti Bolognese was terribly disappointed.  He said it was a sloppy assembled mess that tasted like mushed up meatballs with over cooked noodles. 
The procuitto with mozzarella and mushroom appetizer failed to impress but the salame chocolate dessert (fried chocolate cookie log) was very impressive. 

If I lived in the area I would probably frequent Amarena more often but it was nothing too unique that will make me trek out to Russian Hill for round 2.
author: Debbie C.

description:
This place is amazing. It is a hidden secret in San Fran. The atmosphere makes you feel like your in Italy. 
the food is truly amazing !!!
Paulo really appreciates each customer and is so welcoming. 
It is such a romantic fun place. 
Happy hours are a blast
Don't miss out go immediately
author: Alex F.

description: Had a great evening at Amarena. We had the carpaccio, the pappardelle with wild boar ragu, and one of the specials of the day. Everything tasted fresh and authentic. I love Italian food and Amarena did not dissapoint. The owner was also extremely nice to us. We had difficulty finding a parking spot anywhere near the restaurant so the owner let us park in front of his garage across the street!
author: Laurent L.

description: This is a Russian Hill neighborhood gem. Was just there last night and had the gnocchi. It was perfect. All the appetizers are good and the burrata is out of sight! I've never had a bad dish here. Great wine selection, wonderful service and a true family feel.
author: Tracey K.

description:
Best italian restaurant in the city if not the best italian food I have ever had. Period.
Great selection of starters: pepata di cozze and vongole my favourite!
Are u craving for pasta?? Go there and u will spend hours just to decide which one to get, simply mind blowing! I got Pizzacari, buckwheat noodle with cheese, potatoes, cabbage and my friend gnocci with gorgonzola sauce. We couldn't stop eating!! We saw a Ossobuco with polenta dish in the table next to ours and we HAD  to order it too, it was just too good to be missed!! We finished our regal dinner with a chocolate souffle..and we had to order a second one because we were literally licking the plate!
Wine list is pretty amazing too. Wide selection of wines from basically every Italian region, I can tell that the owner is an expert and the waiting staff is well trained. Our waitress guided us through the all meal. Charming, professional, well knowledge.
What else?!!! Oh yes, they found us a parking spot!!
I love Amarena!!! I'm considering to sell my kitchen and go to Amarena every day of my life!! :)
author: Ashley W.

description: Delicious food, amazing service, perfect atmosphere. My new favorite date night spot.
author: Sarah B.

description: The best pasta I have had in a long long time! Small restaurant, the best attention you can get, and the food it's incredible! Gnocchi Gorgonzola hmmmm spectacular! About the waitresses...kind, nice, and joyful. Coming back here for sure!!! You should too!!
author: Guillermina A.

description:
You definitely need a reservation here if you want to eat on a Friday night.  Luckily we had one but still waited 30 minutes.  Our waitress was great but some of the other service was a bit spotty, we had to ask twice to have our wine bottle brought from the bar to our table.  I will say they rectified each little hiccup to our satisfaction.  

The food was very good and portions are generous.  Standouts included the cured meats with fried dough (just writing this makes me want to go get that immediately), burrata with tomatoes and butternut squash ravioli.  Dessert menu was so-so and didn't tempt any of us.  

I hear they have a great Happy Hour on Wednesdays so I'm going to check that out next.  They also have cute outdoor tables perfect for a glass of wine and people watching.
author: Lisa K.

description:
The people and the company make the restaurant, sometimes the food doesn't.

This place is really charming and romantic.  They have excellent and impeccable service. It's well lit. Romantic. And really a great place to have good conversation with friends.  The company was so great, that I barely noticed our unfortunate mediocre meal.

- Souffle' of Polenta: This was the highlight for me on the food. But I love any form of polenta, so when its served with a creamy cheese sauce.. I'm a happy camper.
- Pappardelle al Cinghiale: Pasta with wild boar meat. I wanted something hearty, and this was the item that everyone raved about, but for me, it was just a bit bland.
- Ravioli di Zucca: It was ok. Nothing fab. Just ok.
- Pasta w/ mushrooms: This item just released that lovely-ness of truffles, so it was the best of the entrees.  
- The filet: My friend seemed to eat it. But again, wasn't crazy.

I loved this place for the staff and the bottles of wine we drank. That made the experience memorable, but as for food. I would head over to Nob Hill Cafe any day.

**3/23/11: Update! The restaurant contacted me to follow up on the dishes.  He expressed his apologies, and invited me to come back and try this place again. Would consider it again if I'm in the area.
author: Natalie G.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in Nob Hill/Russian Hill, without a doubt. I always take my out of town friends/family here when they visit. I've lived in the city for four years now and have yet to find a place I like better. You can always get a reservation, the staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable, and the food is incredible. The pastas are all fresh, my favorites are the butternut squash ravioli and the Paccheri dell'Alpino. You can't go wrong here!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Intimate is the first thing that comes to mind when recalling my experience at Amarena. 

It's an adorable little itallian gem, nestled within a residential part of Russian Hill. The moment I walked in, the dimly lit, warm atmosphere (including the friendly staff) lulled me into a comfort - and I hadn't even started on the pasta! We took a window seat and ordered sangria to start, which was tangy and delicious. My mouth waters everytime I think of what came next: I ordered the "tagliatelle with sautéed mushrooms and white truffle oil," amazing. They were very generous with the truffle oil, which was evident in the enticing aroma. Yum!

Definitely a good spot for a date. A little pricey, but the ambience makes up for it.
author: Nicole S.

description: We were looking for a last minute reservation for a party of 4 on Saturday night. I thought the food was solid, but a little expensive for what they were actually plating. I had the tagilatelle with mushrooms and truffle oil. The dish definitely smelled like truffle oil but the bites were inconsistent with the flavoring. It was a pretty good, light dish, but didn't find it anything special. I found the waitress extremely unhelpful with selecting menu options, when asking for advice between two dishes she described the type of pasta they were and merely said "they're very different." I understand the dishes are different, I want to know what those differences are and what she recommends. Oh well, lots of options for Italian in the area, Amarena isn't a bad one, but not a gem either.
author: Stephen S.

description: Loved the parpadelli with local wild boar! Also, my brother ordered the special which was filet mignon with a gorgonzola mushroom wine reduction over top. He had the best meal at the table! We went last weekend to celebrate my dad's birthday. Great service and had such a good time! Will definately be going back. Also had a great wine by the bottle selection. :)
author: Ally V.

description:
Cosy, little italian restaurant with friendly staff. Pretty good red wines and the lasagna was also a winner. 

Be sure ro make a reservation since this place is pretty popular and seeting is limited. If you do happen to wait, the bar is a welcoming spot for an apatizer.
author: Stephen V.

description: Came here on Thursday for date night and had a great time. The waitress was funny and super helpful in ordering food and wine! The boar pasta and seafood linguine were outstanding along with the spicy cucumber salad. You can't go wrong! Finish your meal with a nice cup of cappuccino!
author: Viki P.

description:
This place is like your piece of crap boyfriend who is excellent in bed, so good in bed, that you just never break up with him. 

Yea, I said it. The service here is really slow, and slightly forgetful, and the tables are so close together that our neighbors had to move glasses to get our bodies past, but who cares when the food is so freakin' good!

The food is so delicious that if I ever had to choose a last meal, this chef would be in my top three choices.  The only way I know how to tell you how good this food is that I would never ever want to be without a gem like this place!
author: Vanessa y.

description: After waiting outside in the cold at the Nob hill cafe for 45 mins and seeing the hostess seated smaller groups who came after us , we were so upset that we left.  That was a bad recommendation from Fairmont hotel.  Walked back to hotel and they recommended another Italian restaurant on Larkins.  This restaurant had no wait at 9:05pm and the pasta are so delicious that three of us finished our plates.  This is an awesome Italian restaurant with reasonable prices of food.  You will not be disappointed .
author: Amanda L.

description:
Amarena, was, in one hyphenated word (thanks Yelp) A-OK.

We had reservations for 8:30 on a Tuesday, arrived by 8:15 and were seated promptly because the restaurant was only about 25% (I'm being generous) full.  Not surprising for a Tuesday night.

The bus boy kindly seated us when we walked in, then the waitress made us feel rushed immediately upon being seated - asked us what our name was because she wanted to make sure we had a reservation.  Slightly annoying.

We're two 26 year olds trying to enjoy good food, but are conscious of our wallets and what we're trying to save for in the future.  We went with the house wine (white and red) which were a-ok for the price.

We started with two appetizers - the bruschetta (tasty, and sooo basil-y - yum!) and the calamari (never a big fan, but this was actually lightly fried and pretty good - as good as fried calamari can be). 

After two glasses of wine, two pretty decent appetizers, and an awkward conversation about the past, we decided to surpass dinner and go get drinks elsewhere.  

Perhaps due to the prices of their 'small plates', their terrible table bread, their imposing waitress, or maybe just because of the company involved -this restaurant was just A-OK.  

I think I'll give it another shot for their Happy Hour on Thursday nights, as I feel like my mind and heart were elsewhere during the entire experience.
author: Alexis B.

description: The parking in this neighborhood is awful. We had to park four up-hill blocks away. They are terribly over priced for what you get. I had a "spicey cucumber salad". It was three chunks of cucumber and two slices of tomato (no spice) with balsamic for $9. Their cost about 50 cents. Very ordinary. Carbonara was flavorful but $19.95 for a bowl of pasta. Thin slices of veal with cheese for $33. They are very over priced for the neighborhood. The bread was stale and the desserts so Unexciting that we all passed. The house wine was pleasant at $9 per glass ( this wine is available by the bottle at Cosco). Certainly not worth a trip back.
author: Karen S.

description:
I've had several good meals at Amarena -- and while the dining room has felt as though it's been sorely in need of a cleaning during each of my visits -- the meals and the service were at the least, adequate, and at their best, excellent. One problem I've had with them, however, is that back in 2004 I booked a table with them via OpenTable.com. At the time, I must have checked the opt-in box for promotional e-mails from the restaurant, and Amarena does not maintain a properly functioning "opt-out" feature for their promotional e-mails so I have been unable to stop their admittedly infrequent spam from populating my inbox for the past 8 years.
Yes. 
For 8 years. 
For 8 years, I have been begging Amarena to take my name off of their e-mail distribution list, and for 8 years, they have been paying lip-service to my requests without actually honoring them. 
Honestly, I have been bad mouthing this place for 8 years because of this, and I've been withholding my patronage from Amarena (in favor of other walkable, local choices like Frascati, luella, Allegro or Seven Hills) simply because they maintain a promotional e-mail list without a properly functioning "opt-out" feature. I just received another e-mail from them today, and rather than do what I've done in the past and follow their opt-out instructions, I'm hoping that some negative feedback on Yelp will get them to act on this matter and stop spamming their unwilling customers.

[edit: _the very next day_] --- and it worked, because I received a message from someone at Amarena less than 24 hours after posting this review, and he was incredibly contrite and accommodating about this whole affair. There will be a little "wait-and-see" until we manage to correspond to confirm that a) my name has been removed from their customer e-mail database and b) his e-mail distribution provider updates their "opt-out" procedures to be in compliance with federal Can-Spam laws -- after which time, no one will be able to read this review, because I will have deleted it by then. In the meantime, I will be having dinner at the restaurant at some point this week (not a "comp," at my own expense) in order to meet the manager face-to-face and put this unpleasantness behind us. So if you found this tale compelling, you may want to make a reservation at Amarena this week and see if you're there to see the sparks fly (or the backs get slapped and flesh pressed, as the situation may go)

Kudos to the management at Amarena for taking a contrite and conciliatory path toward resolving this situation. My next updated review will be written strictly with regard to the food, the service, the experience and the value.

[edit: the following year...] Never received another e-mail from them after that last incident, and was delighted to put this admittedly very "first world problem" in my rear view mirror. A dozen ex-girlfriends have read this review and mused, "yup, that's him, and -- yes -- he's still single." Since my episode with the restaurant's promotional machinery, I've eaten there twice and had magnificent dining experiences both times. Huzzah! to them for being a neighborhood treat, and for brightening up the hill.
author: West R.

description: Got a bottle of barbarello wine, so good! And the pasta with boar meat was amazing. The dessert was not so great. They said the ice cream was gelato, when it was obviously just a scoop of Dreyers.
author: Mischa S.

description:
This is only a review for their 5-9 happy hour on Thursday nights.
Just order minimum one drink, either wine or sangria and there's free food all night. They usually have rocket salad with a balsamic vinaigrette (which I love), focaccia, pastas and meatballs. 

Sometimes we end up getting an entire bottle of wine because the food is so good!

Graziemille!!
author: Heidi L.

description:
I went in on an early weekday, and it was not busy, so the service was good.

I ordered the pasta special, which was a noodle dish in a creamy sauce with mushrooms and sausage slices. The sauce was plain, and I have a feeling that the dish would have been better if the sauce was better.

I wasn't really impressed with the dish, but I'd be willing to try this place again.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Amarena had come highly recommended by a fellow food lover. I jumped on Yelp of course to read what others were saying and really wasn't sure what to expect with all the mixed reviews.

We had a great experience! The appetizers, small dishes and entrees were all delicious. Luckily, my friends don't mind sharing so I was able to taste a few other things on the menu. We couldn't pass on dessert even though we were all a little stuffed and I'm glad we packed it in because it was unbelievably good! 

I say don't rely on the reviews alone to form your decision, give it a whirl you'll be glad you did!
author: Leanne S.

description:
This review is for Thursday night happy hour only.  I don't usually hang in the neighborhood since I hail from the opposite side of this part of the city.  But, coming here for their Thursday night happy hour was well worth the trek.  

Parking is a bit of a pain so be prepared to parking space stalk.  This place does fill up reallly fast.  We got there at 6:20, just in time to secure one of the last 4 person tables in the restaurant.  No one seems to leave once they park themselves at a table.  We were probably the first group to leave and it was already 8:15.  

You only need to order one (I swear there is no catch!) drink to take advantage of their awesome tapas deal.  For a mere $8.50 you can get a glass of wine or sangria and all you can eat Italian fare, think classy Italian buffet.  Salad, focaccia, pasta, meatballs, shellfish ... oh my!  

The food is probably not 4-star worthy, but for the amount of food you get and the price, it just can't be beat.  I tried really hard not to overstuff myself, but be warned - it's pretty easy to do that here.
author: Jean A.

description:
I dined here solo on a Sunday night right after opening time. Based on this single, personal, idiosyncratic circumstance I am going to be handing down my decisive final judgement on this restaurant, because that appears to be how everyone has always reviewed everything for the entire history of everdom.

I got two dishes: the cherry tomato soup and the wild boar pappardelle. I can't claim a very refined palate, but I think the soup was exceptionally good. Another possibility is that it was a rather generic soup and I was tricked by the atmosphere of the place into thinking it was superb. The difference between these two cases is less important than you might suspect.

I love eating wild boar: doing so makes me feel like I'm doing a service to society, seeing as how those boars are *wild* and clearly up to no good. The wild boar pasta was tasty. I ate it all. The sauce splashed around a bit, as sauce is wont to do.

The bread that came with the meal was great. That said, I am a great lover of all kinds of breads and if you are more particular in your yeasty preferences it might not be totally perfect for you. It was on the crusty side, not particularly buttery or anything, but warm and good for dipping in olive oil. I suspect foodie types will like it?

The service and atmosphere were delightful! I was delighted. My waitress was super-friendly, and charmingly dealt with my own personal awkwardness. Since I got there early, it was pretty quiet and I could hear the staff all chatting to one another in Italian. I didn't understand a word of it, but as I looked out the window at the setting sun I've gotta admit I was imagining myself somewhere in Italy, eating dinner and peacing out.
author: Greg P.

description: What a great little neighborhood gem. Fantastic service, delicious house made pasta and a nice Italian wine list. The appetizer of eggplant with tomato sauce was the star of the meal. Adore this spot!
author: Brooke S.

description: Very darling restaurant.  Loved the atmosphere.  The food was very good.  Wanted to try the porcini gnocchi but they didn't have them that evening so I tried the gorgonzola with raddichio gnocchi.  Very nice sauce, the gnocchi's were a bit heavy but very good.  The lamb entree was another we tried and it was very good as well.  We also had the burrata appetizer which was delicious.  And the bruschetta was was wonderful.  We also had the butternut soup.  Nice flavor but oversalted!!  Would definitely return.  Really enjoyed the location and ambiance.
author: Patti A.

description:
Cute little cozy restaurant in Russian Hill but parking is a b*tch! You probably don't need to make reservations since there were many open tables even on a Friday nite.

Our waiter was friendly and greeted all his tables with the same line "Welcome! Ready for your special dinner at Amarena?" and then took our order. 

He suggested the calamari ripieni (baked calamari filled with shrimp and crab) over the calamari fritti for our appetizer. Unfortuantely I think we should have just gone with the basic fried calamari.

While I don't think the food is memorable, I would suggest trying the linguine nere (squid ink linguine) or maybe one of their daily specials.  Oh and tonite's daily specials all seemed to have wild boar in it so maybe that's the catch of the day ;) 

For dessert we tried the tiramisu and panne cotta. Again nothing great but still good.

To end the evening, our waiter brought each of us a complimentary glass of champage -- very nice! Just for that I would give them 3.5 stars but unfortunately that's not an option so the rating is a solid 3+.
author: Helen Y.

description: Such a great experience at Amarena on saturday night with my wife.  Food was fantastic(mozzarella tomato salad, cucumber spicy salad, bucarelli, and wild boar papparedelle). Atmosphere was great.  Service was impeccable- owner Palo even took the time to come speak with us after seating us.  Seeing owner ship with such effort and buy in was fantastic- he obviously cared about the restaurant and the customers happiness.  Wine was a little expensive but everything else overshadowed that by so much that its hardly worth mentioning.  Great job Amarena.
author: Alex S.

description:
Overall, a disappointment. Pretentious, arrogant, and overpriced are three adjectives I would use to describe this restaurant (and this is as a Russian Hill resident, immune to expected snobbery). 

Disorganized service -- we waited 25 minutes after making reservations, even though there were clearly two available tables in the back. The hostess was flustered and overworked, and the staff kept knocking over people as they rushed to take orders.

Average menu items - for the average price of $17, the entrees were nothing special and rather dissapointing. The most generic order on our table, the Shrimp Penne Pasta, ended up being the best, and the rest of our orders largely left us hungry, although not wanting more...

Attitude - the waitresses, along with having a fake Italian accent (IMO!!), had an incredible attitude when it came to the menu and our selections.
