I always drive by this place and thought it might be fun to try it and get a chance to practice speaking Italian. I sat at the bar as I was dining solo. I ordered sparkling water and they gave me not a glass, but a big bottle of Pellegrino for like $5.95. 

The waiter said the mushroom soup was fantastic so I ordered it and when it came, it was lukewarm.  And I could see it just sitting there as I was at the bar - near the kitchen pick-up area.

I had the seafood pasta which was just OK.  The waiters spoke English and Spanish. No Italian.

I may go back. I may not.
author: tom t.

description:
oh Amarena! You are just too adorable.

A couple gf's and I were strolling through our neighborhood looking for a relaxed place to celebrate a promotion, and we came across Amarena. We couldn't have chosen a more perfect restaurant for the occasion!

From the soft, hearty bread to the delicious entrees, to our charming servers... we were delighted w/ our dining experience! 

We were looking to kick things off w/ an Italian red and spoke with the sommelier who suggested a medium bodied, Nero D'Avola, Vendemmia '07. Their sommelier was right on the money, 'cuz I was completely taken away by how utterly amazing it ended up being! I even swiped the cork to ensure that I wouldn't forget this prized red's name!

Next came our selected app: Calamari w/ shrimp & zucchini w/ a sweet red sauce that had a hint of tang. Oofa. That plus the bread already had us stuffed!

And for the mains... my friend and I ordered the Butternut Squash Ravioli that came w/ diced veggies sprinkled on top. The pasta tasted fresh and the squash nice and sweet. I tried a bite of the crispy Polenta crust and a smidgen of mushroom, which quickly received my "MMM!" of approval.

Overall, dinner & wine was a total hit and the cozy, welcoming vibe provided by the staff and the space was just what we needed. It even made us feel like it was the end of a work week, since it was that chill! Though I do my best to bolt once it's time for a restaurant to close up shop, Amarena didn't rush us one bit and even brought out complimentary Moscato d'Asti (which I might add, is phenom!). Well shooooot. That's just the recipe to make this girl wanna stay awhile longer.

Before ducking back out into the chilly weather, we learned that they have a 6-9 pm Happy Hour on Thursdays w/ a live band, FREE buffet and drinks specials!! My roommate and I already set a date to go & check it out.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Was a nice little Italian restaurant. Went during the middle of the week and the place was pretty empty. There was one other table and what seemed like a couple regulars just drinking at the front/bar area with the bar tender or owner. The wine list is good and the food is well done as well. I wouldn't say the food is amazing in any way but it does not leave you dissatisfied so can't complain. The staff let us eat in peace and was not overbearing. I probably won't be back since the city has so many different restaurants, but if you are looking for good food and in the area Amarena is a nice place to stop and eat
author: Sebastien D.

description:
I like any place where the menu is one page of food and two pages of wine...

I've been to Amarena twice now and both times was warmed by the unpretentious, friendly service and cozy atmosphere.  Last time I came with a larger group (8 people) and we ordered several bottles of wine  - our waiter was inordinately please we picked one wine from his home region of Italy.  Not the typical reaction.

I would agree with other reviewers that the food is not the draw.  It's good solid fare, tasty but not amazing.  The draw, however, is the feeling I get when I walk in the door, like the people inside are genuinely pleased I picked their place and are excited about providing me with a wonderful evening.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Such a date place!  Decent Italian food.  They had a few things I'd never seen on a menu before (riceballs?), but go here for a romantic atmosphere.  I went with a friend and I felt weird cause there were all sort of other couples touching, making eyes, sweet talking to each other.  Next thing I know I'm looking at my buddy thinking wow he looks damn good tonight...........maybe I should just hold his hand for a second.  So I did.

He freaked out.  I blame it on the restaurant.
author: Ke-Bear Z.

description: I stumbled upon this quaint little eatery after a couple very unsuccesful attemps at getting in at other Russian Hill restaurants with some friends of mine.  I was initially drawn to the elegant, cozy atmosphere and, after tasting the delicious glass of wine we ordered while we waited, began to eagerly await my meal.  We were seated relatively quickly and had a friendly waitress who knew the menu like the back of her hand.  All three pastas that we ordered were just as scrumptious as the wine, and the appetizers and desserts were divine.  My only problem with the place is that it is so tucked away that I forget to go there more often!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Why can't we do half stars?  I'd say is is a 3.5 star place.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  They had some yummy looking Sangria (which I didn't notice until I'd already gotten my wine - the table behind me was raving about it.)

As for the food - I enjoyed the bread - the crust was crunchy and the center was soft (it almost looked a touch undercooked).  We split the cauliflower soup which was pretty much exactly what you'd expect.  We also split the sautéed calimari - it was a little tough but came with a wonderful sauce- and the oven roasted potatoes (essentially giant oven cooked French fries).  For an entree, we split the cod which was a huge portion, but again nothing unexpected.  

The vibe was nice.  I'd go back, but only if I was in the area.
author: She-Ra ..

description: I told my friends to go to amarena four people they had a good time they all like the pleace i am glad they had a good time i think i am going back next time it just every time i think about the first time  but second time i had fun
author: Yvette H.

description:
One of the top Russian Hill restaurants for sure. This is my favorite spot for a last-minute dinner. We rarely *can't* get a table. (Look on Restaurant.com for dining certificates to make dinner a bit cheaper)
The setting is intimate, the service is attentive, the owner is friendly, the wine list never fails (check out the '01 Amarone), and the food is great.

12/06 - Update 
They've changed the menu a bit -- the restaurant overall seems to have a bit more sophistication and polish.  One downside is that the delicious chicken raviolis are gone :(
There was Wild Boar Tagliatelle on the menu last night -- a few at our table got it and raved about it! Our waitress, in a charming Italian accent, said the boar was so good because they hunted it themselves. Whaaa?? She insisted, and brought us photos.  Sure enough, they did hunt themselves a wild boar and serve it to us.   I saw the photographic evidence to prove it! How often do you run across that?! Wow.
author: Heather C.

description: Friendly staff. Good location. Tasty but a little overpriced and not enough food!
author: Mary S.

description:
Hey I like this place.  One of the coziest atmospheres I've found in the city.  Very quaint and local-feeling... makes me want to pack up and move to Hyde Street.

I honestly don't really remember what I had so obviously the food isn't exactly TDF, but the place has charm and that makes it worth a visit.
author: Derek B.

description:
Great little Italian find-
I went with a group of about 15 girls and we were all seated together no problem so that was a plus cause its not that large of a restaurant. 
I loved my pasta dish (gnocchi of some kind) however others mentioned that the portions were small- I don't remember noticing that but heads up if you go!
author: Janae L.

description:
I loved my experience at this little neighborhood gem. My friend just moved into an apartment on the block and after a night of drinking wine at her apartment, we stumbled into Amarena for dinner. The place was comfortably full, most of the tables were filled but we were able to be seated right away.  We were greeted by smiles and friendliness.  The ambiance is lovely...you forget you are in SF, the layout is really neat, very old world...in a good way. The lighting makes everyone look slightly better.
We ordered wine, a delicious bottle of Nero D'Avola and settled in.  The food was amazing! I had the salmon tar tar, and the petrale sole.  Everything I had was absolutely delicious.  That was the case for the rest of our party too...everyone was happy with their food and the wine was so good that a second bottle was soon at the table. 
Overall, last night was amazing, thanks to good friends and the lovely folks at Amarena.
It may a bit too expensive for regular weeknight dinners, but the prices are definitely reasonable for weekend nights or special occasions.

The neighborhood is lucky to have Amarena on the corner.   
I will be back very soon.
author: Nilu r.

description:
A cute cozy corner restaurant in the midst of all the other terrific restaurants in the Hyde St. neigborhood.  I keep walking pass this restuarant so finally ate here with my two friends last night.  We were greeted by a live band when we walked in but luckily seated in the dining room next door.  

We started out with the appetizer special salmon tartar and arugula salad.  I had the lamp chop rubbed with italian herbs - so moist & tender.  One of my friend had the spaghetti with meatballs in a fresh tomato sauce - sounds simple/easy but it was delicious!   The other one had the crab and scallop filled ravioli with a creamy white sauce - very rich & yummy.   

Apparently every other Thursdays for Happy Hour (till 6:30PM) beside the live band they provide FREE food with your drinks!  I am definitely checking that out in two weeks.  Oh, try the sangria - woo hoo!
author: Lily W.

description:
I ordered the spinach ravioli with white sauce here and oh man, it melted in my mouth.  The sauce was to die for, highly recommended.

I also liked the staff here.  Our waitress was down to earth, and honest (which is refreshing).  My friend ordered the eggplant something and our waitress was straight up like "Look, I'll be honest, I wouldn't order that.  two customers have sent it back this week, just pass."  Ok, they get a star knocked off b/c apparently that dish blew, but I give them 4 stars b/c the food we actually ended up getting was great, and the waitress was cool and honest about it.
author: Jo G.

description:
I love going here!  The waiters are cute! The homemade pastas are tasty and the sangrias are awesome!

I like the tree too!

Favorite dish: the squid ink linguine!

Why the four?  The space.  I wish sometimes it was bigger.
author: C M.

description:
Amarena is an excellent little neighborhood Italian spot. Less expensive than nearby Frascati, it still manages to rank as one of my favorite Italian places in San Francisco.

On one occasion, we arrived relatively early on a weekday, and, as others have noted, the place was not busy at all (it seems to liven up as the evening goes on). We sat outside, near a pretty tree with red lights. 

Now, the food. Ravioli Di Zucca --  pumpkin ravioli in a butter and sage sauce -- is superb at $15. Balanced, well-prepared, with each flavor popping out in a understated way. Amarena features several tasty gnocci dishes (note: I am a major gnocci fan, so take that into consideration). The Sugo Di Agnello -- gnocci in bolognese sauce -- is the stand-out for me. For another pasta dish, the Spaghetti Pizzaiola was excellent, with a delicious basil taste that was certainly worth the $11.

Service was classy and timely. Sitting outside in this Russian Hill location is a treat; the interior is inviting, although not particularly notable. Needless to say, parking is difficult in Russian Hill, so plan accordingly if you want to try out this enjoyable restaurant.
author: Matti L.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant. Our meal was absolutely delicious. I had the fresh pasta with mushrooms and truffle oil- ridiculously good and our waitress was adorable and fun!  I will definitely go back.
author: Willow M.

description:
Food: Good, but not amazing. However, the service tells the real story.
 
Service: I think the service is best described as "European"... We had a reservation for 3 at 8:30 on a Thursday, but weren't seated for 35 minutes. Once we were seated, the waiter was generally inattentive and mostly out of sight. My one friend quipped that "European service deserves a European tip" (aka, none). I felt this was fair, but we tipped a nominal 15% and left. I'm not sure what that 15% bought me, so I won't be back.
author: Jory M.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  Period.  

The food is outstanding, the ambiance is fantastic and the owner and waitstaff are wonderful.  Everytime I have been, there are Italians eating there--a clear ringing endorsement.
author: Tamara C.

description:
My First experience at this restaurant was quite amazing - Food was stellar and so was the service. The second time however was disappointing. First - I really have have beefs with restaurants that cannot provide a good wine list - I mean - we live in California and have access to great wine - why cant more restaurants invest and serve yummy wines - instead  of mediocre chiantis and sangioveses - If you are dining at this restaurant -  I suggest you bring your own wine and pay the corkage fee - you probably will be happier.

Our entrees - gnocchis  - were something else as well. They were quite mushy and overcooked - we sent this back to the kitchen with our server giving attitude " Gnocchis are supposed to be mushy and melt in your mouth" - What ever happened to the customer is always right? Luckily the owner was quite gracious and offered to serve our dishes with a different pasta - 

I do however admit that this restaurant is very cute - and wins a lot of points with its ambiance.

Oh well maybe it was an off night - since the first time we went there the food was pretty good.
author: Christian S.

description:
I actually found this place on open table since I was trying Saturday morning to make a group dinner reservation for that night. Such a cute neighborhood spot with good food! They were also really nice about accommodating my reservation where the number of people increased twice. I got the salmon which I'd definitely recommend. I forget what everyone else in the group got, except for that someone got the lasagna and raved about it. The waitress and hostess were also appropriately friendly. 
I'd say this place is good for a group of up to 10... otherwise you probably have too many people.
author: Caitlin B.

description:
I LOVE AMARENA!!!!  I lived in the neighborhood for over a year before I actually went for dinner (despite drooling at the menu outside on numerous occasions!!) - but once I finally went I was hooked!  Amarena had just been written up in the city paper restaurant review section - and the description of the gnocchi alone inspired me to go that night!  The restaurant itself is adorable - nice mellow colors with soft lighting and beautiful artwork by an italian artist.  And it has a cozy little bar - which is nice if you just want to stop in for a glass of wine and an appetizer - with friendly service and no pretensiousness.  

Ok - let's talk about the food.  I usually like to start with Bruschetta - as it's nice and refreshing - and Amarena seems to accomplish the perfect balance - between delicious heirloom tomatoes, red onions, extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The Beef Carpaccio is also delicious - and I love how they serve it with arugola in a nice olive oil/lemon/balsamic dressing (make sure you sqeeze the lemon and mix up the carpaccio - as the italians say this "cooks" the beef).  Last time I was there they had Cherry Tomato Soup as the special and it was delicious!  The Involtino di Calamari is also very tasty - and you will definitely want to dip your bread in the lobster bisque sauce.     

As far as pasta - I'm always a sucker for gnocchi - and it's delicioso here!  The Gnocchi con Funghi e Gorgonzola is as good (and as rich) as it sounds!  I actually love gnocchi with red sauce - so I usually ask for this (off the menu) and they are very accomodating with a light tomato and basil sauce (yummm)!!! And the gnocchi dumplings are so light and fluffy that they are addictive (and difficult for me to share!).  The other pasta dish that I love is the Pappardelle con Cinghiale (wild boar). This dish reminds me of eating at a trattoria in Tuscany - and apparently the owner (Paolo) goes down to the central coast to hunt the wild boar so it's as fresh as can be!!! I've also had the Tagliatelle al Pesto con Gamberi (shrimp) and the pesto is amazing.  I asked the chef for his secret and he wouldn't say - but it's delicious - save some bread for dipping in the sauce!

If I'm in the mood for fish i usually go for the Wild Salmon - served with cherry tomatoes, olive oil and capers. And if I want a bit of meat the Agnello (lamb) is fantastic! And the lamb comes with roasted potatoes that are cooked to perfection.  I've never tried the breaded pork - but every time I go it looks delicious (and huge) - served with a nice side of arugola with cherry tomatoes.   

For dessert - I LOVE the chocolate souffle - make sure you leave room - and time for this as it takes a while to prepare.  The gelato is also one of my favorites - served with wild cherries - which is where the name 'Amarena' comes from.  

The owner Paolo is adorable and always very gracious and welcoming.  He loves to start you off with a glass of prosecco - and then you can take it from there! He is from Milano - and so is the chef - and the waitstaff are usually from Italy - making each visit a very authentic Italian experience.  The last time I was there I actually overheard to women leaving who said "We don't have to go to Italy to have authentic Italian food now that we found this place!"  

One last thing - they have happy hour every Thursday night - which is nice because they always put out a spread of food - including pasta, insalata, homemade onion focaccia (delicious), and other various foods.  All you need to do is order a glass of wine and enjoy!!!
author: carla a.

description: Service was very friendly. Nice ambiance, albeit a little bit loud maybe. I had an arugula salad and the butternut squash ravioli, both of which were very good. I'll come again if I'm in the area
author: Khan P.

description:
I tired this place for the first time a few years ago and back then it was great.  The pasta was al dente and the sauces were amazing.  One of my favorites was a plate of just pasta and sauteed tomatoes - yummm.....

But I went back recently and the food was blahhhhh...pasta was overcooked and the sauces were boring.

I'm hoping it was just an off night for the place.
author: Lev E.

description: I've lived in the neighborhood for six years.  Been inside three times.  Probably won't go back.  The food was fine, but the two times I ate there, I walked out thinking there's much better value at several restaurants within two blocks. (Luella, Frascati, Pesce).  I like the color of the paint and the lighting.
author: Trick C.

description:
Horrible Valentines day experience as other patrons will also attest to. First, we had a reservation at 8:30 and weren't seated until 9. They were way understaffed. To be honest, they had 25 tables with couples at each table (50) and only one waiter! On top of that, the waiter wasn't very polite or apologetic about the several delays. He didn't even acknowledge our presence for 20 minutes after we had sat down - no water, no bread, not even a "hello i'm your waiter". After an hour and a half of being at the restaurant, we got our appetizers. It was already 10pm and several guests had already got up and left before being served the main dish, and we did as well. No wonder they had to change the name. Food wasn't anything special, I couldn't tell really I ate so much bread when it finally arrived.

The individual below me obviously had a very different experience, or was heavily inebriated.
author: Hrach S.

description: I visited Amarena with a group of friends recently, and had a nice experience (aside from the fact that it was very difficult to park in this neighborhood).  Fortunately, the restaurant was completely understanding about the fact that we were thirty minutes late as a result of how long it took us to actually park the car.  They welcomed us with open arms and a great attitude.  i proceeded to have a fantastic glass of Pinot Noir, a delicious plate of carpaccio, and homemade lasagne.  The portion was so large and delicious that I took it home for lunch the next day (and I hardly ever eat takeout leftovers!  It was just as good the next day.
author: Ashley C.

description: What a great place. Definitely recommend for a date. The wait staff was incredibly nice, and the food was top notch. Would love to go here again!
author: Will B.

description: Busier night, couple big parties in there at the time. Had a reservation but took about 30 min for a couple of us to get seated. Some free wine and great food made up for it though
author: Jamie L.

description: Just had dinner here again.  My previous post still stands.  Excellent food with authentic tastes.  The staff is great and they are so nice, attentive and they make you feel at home.   I really appreciate that!  The owner is hilarious and he makes sure you are getting the best service.  I will be back soon!
author: Monica T.

description:
I just returned from Amarena where my roommate had his B-day bash.

I live 3 blocks away and always thought this place was a Spanish tapas joint...No you did-ant. Amarena is hard core Italiano. 

9 People, too many bottles of wine and 3 courses later I'm perfectly content.

This neighborhood haunt is great for the semi-formal event, but a casual dinner for two is also acceptable. 

Good service from the time you walk through the door. 

Two dining rooms with an interesting decor. Tuscan plaster glaze the walls with warm tones. The first room is designed like a little ally you would find in Florence or Venice complete with clothes lines. Sounds weird but it works. Tall expansive ceilings and great windows.

The food arrived promptly and piping hot. I ordered the butternut squash ravioli with a yummy butter sauce. Small cubes of squash with fresh basil  piled over 5 handmade pillows of goodness. The other plates appeared equally delectable  and everyone said they enjoyed their meals. The lamb lolly pops looked most appealing.

Tutti bella
author: Johnny H.

description:
My Saturday girls' night out dinner at Amarena was the best dining experience in recent memory. I say experience because it wasn't limited to just the food. My friends and I showed up without a reservation, en route to Luella, and decided instead to try something new. After a 15 minute wait, we were seated at the bar. 

We started off with drinks and then the crispy polenta (La Polenta di Amarena), which was delicious. The creamy mushroom sauce did wonders. My Ravioli di Zucca was the freshest pasta I've ever had. I'm used to leaving Italian restaurants having fallen deep into a food-induced comatose state. But no unbuttoning of the jeans was necessary, as my 5 pieces of butternut squash-stuffed ravioli came in a bed of diced veggies. The Gnocchi con Funghi e Gorgonzola was delish (a bit on the heavy side), and came with a cream sauce similar to that of the polenta. And the sea bass special was the biggest hunk of fish I've yet to see on a plate.

But back to the experience. What's great about sitting at the bar, is that you get to chat with the waiters and the restaurant owner. And Paolo was as nice as could be. Dessert.. the tiramisu was good - I was sold at mascarpone cream. But then dear Paolo gave us each a flute of dessert wine on the house. There's not much that can divert my attention from dessert, but the Muscat d'Asti did the trick. 

4 stars for the food, +1 star for the awesome service.
author: Erika C.

description:
Dear boyfriend, 

Thank you for a great night at Amarena.  There were five courses for Valentines day.  The first, a salad, was a little overdressed, but still pretty good.  There was some sort of white vegetable on it that looked like an onion, but tasted like a radish.  The second course we shared, which was a polenta shaped heart.  The heart shape was a tad over the top, but the polenta was delicious nonetheless.  

The third course was two separate pasta dishes.  There was a pasta dish with a lobster sauce.  I asked for no lobster sauce and it accidentally came with it, but who cares.  The other pasta, a spinach like thick nooodle was outstanding.  

The entree was eggplant parmesan, that was not over or under cooked, but just right with a cheese topping.  Mmmmmm.  

The dessert was a chocolate treat, some sort of soft chocolate with a slightly biscotti inside.  Very unusual, never seen anything like it, very happy with Amarena.

Thank you wonderful boyfriend!
author: Joanna S.

description:
Great neighborhood place... Paolo and the gang will always sort you out... Romantic date - let 'em know... Just got fired, promoted, or lost your monthly bus pass, let 'em know... 
Linguine neri is to die for... They take Squid Ink (google it) and infuse the pasta with it... Yummy... I'm borderline OCD so I just always order this dish but everyone I know has a favorite dish and they're all over the menu so experiment... Prices are amazing as well... 
Oh! Almost forgot the crabstuffed squid... To. Die. For.
author: Raul L.

description:
It happened.  After years of saying, we should try that place, I arrived for an early Thursday evening supper.  Did you know they have a nice happy hour every other Thursday with simple pasta and salad and a jazz band?t 

Despite those freebies, we decided to sit and enjoy a full meal.

My friend lives across the  street and has been going for years.  I met Paolo, the owner who sat with us for a while and made conversation.  And while, he didn't sit with anyone else, I saw that he  visited every table and checked to make sure everyone in his place was having a great time.

The wine list is very good, excellent bottles  ---but I do wish there had been a wider range of prosecco.  We had the tomato salad, the eggplant, the ravioli and the chocolate cake for dessert.  Simple and delicious!!!!!!!!!!

Amarena is a great relaxing evening.  A good date place too.  Next time, I'll try the outdoor seating.
author: Debster C.

description: This was a total hidden gem in Russian Hill. One block off Polk I didn't even know this place existed. The 3.5 stars on Yelp threw me off a little, and I was unsure about this place, but I needed a table for 7 people the night before the SF Marathon and they were able to take my reservation (so good for groups only if you make a reservation far in advance or are comfortable eating early). We needed to eat early, so we booked 5:30pm (which as it turned out was the time they opened). The host saw us waiting outside in the cold at 5:20pm and opened the restaurant and sat us early so we could get out of the cold. So nice! We had amazing service, so friendly, prompt (my water never went empty) and truly Italian! I think our server said she was from Rimini, Italy! Then the food came out, the bread was fantastic (I had five pieces!).  The bruschetta was delightful, super fresh tomatoes and basil, yum! My homemade bucatini was delish and I tried my husband's gorgonzola cream sauce gnocchi, I think it was the best gnocchi I have ever eaten, and I LOVE gnocchi, so this really blew me away. Plus the restaurant is so cute! It's small though, so I would definitely recommend making a reservation or getting there before 6pm. Overall, I had a marvelous experience at this little neighborhood delight!
author: Becky C.

description: City of Dreams throws a Gala every year at the Bentley Reserve in downtown San Francisco Financial district. Where over 800 guest attend to support and donate. This year we had "Amarena" cater the event serving an appetizer focaccia bread, Yummmmmm...  Everyone at the event was raving about the uniqueness of the taste, how delightful the catering company was and how we have to have them back next year. Personally, Amarena is one of my favorite local spots to have dinner or Thursday night gathers, the atmosphere and hospitality is superb. I would just like to thank Amarena for above and beyond service and we can't wait to have you back next year.
author: Alexis V.

description:
This is a romantic little spot off the beaten path.  The owner Paolo is a great host and you will spend hours just lingering over the great food and wine with conversations that will last for hours.  Its usually quiet and candle lit for just the right amount of ambiance.  They offer great italian food with a touch of love....

As cheesy as it is its a great date spot and make sure you say hi to the owner and get to know him well!
author: Harry H.

description:
What a charming neighborhood restaurant!!! I came here with my boyfriend for dinner one night. We sat at the perfect table...looking out to the tree-lined street lit up with red holiday lights. Very romantic!

We started with the bruschetta with diced tomatoes & garlic and calamari which was quite yummy. We even enjoyed a complimentary glass of wine from Paolo, the manager. Thanks Paolo! Our entrees came and my boyfriend had this fabulous and rich Crab & Lobster stuffed ravioli. Soooo sweet and savory, I wanted it for myself. Our server suggested that I try their traditional Spaghetti with bolognese sauce. That was also verrry good. The service was impeccable....very attentive and friendly. Our new friend even gave me a hug afterward! haha I will definitely come here again. 

Especially since they offer a Happy Hour every other Thursday with a FREE Italian buffet, wine, and sangria! Gotta love it. 

P.S. Parking is extremely difficult around Russian Hill (of course). Take a cab.
author: Anne E.

description:
Great cozy Italian restaurant!!! 

They bake their own bread!! nice touch! 
Their burrata is out of this world, best I ever had! 
Their prosciutto: outstanding!! 
Also had their porcini risotto (seasonal) : awesome!!! 
Their signature dish (papardelle wild boar): excellent! 
And their chocolate dessert: Salame: delicious!! 

And the owner Paolo is super nice and attentive! 

Definitely I will be back!!!
author: Xavier C.

description:
I should admit that proximity gives this place a big bump up.  It is so nice to walk a block from home and into this warm, inviting, neighborhood comfort zone.  

Service is attentive and excellent.  Feels like you are being served by an old friend.  My waitress accidentally dipped a corner of a napkin in my untouched wine glass when putting down the bread.   With a huge smile she apologized and said she would get me a new glass.  When I protested and said it was really no problem, she grabbed it away and brought me a new one with a look that could only mean "I am going to drink that other one."  Couldn't blame her, it was amazing - "Amarento" or something.

Uncrowded, unhurried and relaxing.  

Get the gnocchi.  Its fantastic.
author: Brad C.

description:
In a city with many, many Italian restaurants - mostly situation in touristy North Beach (with all the fun strip clubs to go along with the feel) - there are too many tourist trap places and not enough good authentic places.

That is not Amarena. 

The atmosphere reminded me of the restaurants in Italy that I have been to - okay, in Florence. The waitresses were from Italy, the owner is from Milano, and the food had that authentic taste.

Amarena is authentic Italian. The gnocchis were perfect, the lamb bolognese had the perfect mix to the gnocchis, the Ceaser was wonderfully great, the various appetizers - including the pizza - were delightfully delicatble. For dessert, we tried the slama chocolate and tiramisu: both were great and satisfied the sweet tooth.  

The wait staff was very, very good. Our waitress was Laura, and she was attentive to all our needs, and even offered to turn down the music for the baby. She was on top of our needs, and kept an eye on us while she had other tables to take care of. 

Can't speak on the parking situation - puhleeze, it's SF and it's a cab city - but I know I definitely will come back here again, in the near future.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Do you have any restaurants close to your house or work that you walk by almost every single day and you always say to yourself..."I really should try this place".  Not necessarily for any particular reason or maybe it is because you saw it on Yelp but more importantly you say those simple words to yourself every time.  Well, this is THAT place for me.  
So, I finally made the decision and marched my little but down there in hopes of a fantastic meal with my man.  The place was full but we were still able to be seated right away without a reservation with friendly smiles and a welcoming atmosphere.  1star.  We were able to take our time but order right away when we were ready instead of feeling like we were forgotten in the corner(by the window by the way.. always fun).  1star.  Appetizer came right out, Calamari wrapped in bacon.. Now, I personally think everything should be wrapped in bacon which is what made this little dish a nice way to get the taste buds jumping for joy.  
And now, our main course.  I had the wild boar parpadelle  and my man had the sole with a side of potatoes.  Both were great.  The boar was sweet and filling in a savory way and the sole was buttery and with the side of potatoes it was the perfect combo.  1star.  Finally, I have to give the 4th star due to the sense of humor everyone had.  Anyone who is willing to laugh at dumb jokes we might crack and be open and friendly gets a star in my book.  
Definitely worth checking out for a relaxing relatively romantic dinner in a low key friendly environment.
author: Kylie L.

description: The wild boar is absolutely delicious - as well as the butternut ravioli. As for the desserts my party ordered the tiramisu was preferred over any of the others.  We had our children with us and the hostess and waitstaff were very friendly and accommodating. Can't wait to go back.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
3 stars for the warm and cozy atmosphere (although you may feel that you are dining with the people at the next table).

4 stars for the warm greeting we got when we arrived and the extremely friendly service we enjoyed throughout our meal.

3 stars for the food which was good, but not great.  the beet & spinach salad with ricotta dressing lacked seasoning and flavor.  the eggplant parm is not fried (that's a good thing) but was oozing oil.  the salmon entree was very good.

0 stars for not dealing with our reservation correctly, causing open table to send us a nastygram.

if this place was just a few blocks from home, i might revisit.  but, it isn't - and so i probably won't.
author: Bette K.

description:
After driving around indefinitely for parking and engaging in unforgivable road-range moments, we finally found parking and were ready to be turned down by the nearby restaurants because of no prior reservations.  Exhausted and hungry, we chanced upon the inviting and warm light from Amarena and thought we'd be lucky to find a seat here.  The place was cozy and not crowded and just had that neighborhood restaurant feel to it.  It's one of those places where you get together with close friends, have a good meal, and enjoy the rest of the evening. 

Appetizers:  Lamb Chops. Shrimp with Something
Entrees:  Ravioli stuffed with Crab, Veal pasta

Service was so-so, but I think the fact that it wasn't busy and the ambiance was relaxed wins plenty of points from me.
author: Ginni S.

description:
It's the kind of place where you're torn between sharing a bite with those you are dining with because you want them to know just how awesome the dish is VERSUS keeping it all for yourself because it's just that good.

*this applies to the pasta dishes.  Feel free to share the cesear salad--or better yet, don't order it, unless you enjoy fishy tasting-goo covered lettuce.  . . .ok it wasn't that bad.  but it certainly wasn't good.

Why 4 stars you ask?  Because the service is ridiculous.  SLOW doesn't begin to describe it.  The place was barely 1/4 full.  And the waiters were busy chatting it up with their friends at the bar, hence the 20 minute wait for ONE glass of wine.

Moral of the story:  food's awesome, I'd go back for the food.  But service is annoyingly clueless.
author: Judgey Von Judge O.

description:
Simply a warm, wonderful restaurant.  Paolo, the owner, doesn't cease to care about the guests.  If there's a problem with service, mention it, and it gets fixed.

Most importantly, the food is wonderful.  I've eaten here at least a dozen times, and I've only had the most delicious servings.
author: Adam E.

description: Yummy food, friendly service and decent prices for a nice meal in San Francisco. I've come here on a double date and with a group of 8; both times it was great! The only knock I had against it was the portion sizes were a little small, but that depended dish to dish. Definitely would come back here again!
author: Laura C.

description:
You feel right at home in this neighborhood gem - thanks to Paolo (the owner).  The ambiance is warm and inviting for both intimate dinners, a casual get together or host larger parties/events.  

I have to second Xavier C.  the burrata (creamy mozzarella) with the house cold cuts and home made bread are just sooo good.  Try the Tortino di Zucchine (baked zucchini layered with tomato sauce and cheeses) ... and there is barely any room for the main courses.

The pasta is homemade.  I particularly like the Pappardelle al Cinghiale (ribbon thin pasta with a wild boar and mushroom ragu),  Paccheri con Ricotta  e Spinaci (baked tube pasta filled with cheese and spinach)  and the Ravioli di Zucca (ravioli stuffed with butternut squash).    I know ordering the Sogliola alla Mugnaia (sole filets in butter sauce) is boring but it's really good.

I've organized two large dinners there and Paolo made both events so special.  He stepped in to adjust menus based on guest preferences and was hands-on all throughout each evening to check on everyone and surprised us with special treats.

Always a terrific experience here.
author: Mic D.

description: First the food was not bad.  However, we had reservations here for Valentine's Dinner.  We had looked over the menu and felt good about this place.  Wasn't cheap, but wasn't $$$$$ either.  WELL, we feel ripped off like the other couples sitting near us.  First, NO MENU for this evening.  You had a choice of Steak, Fish or Vegetarian.  They did not show the price for dinner on the menu they gave us - or as a matter of fact - gave anyone else.  It included the appetizer, main course & dessert.  When we got the check we almost fainted.  The bill was for $85 per person + $3 for a can of Coke.  The service was not great.  They did give a long stem rose to each couple.  But, a $200 dinner where the food was not hot, we were hungry when we left, and we had not cocktails or wine.  This was a definite case of BAIT & SWITCH.  Even when we left we looked at the menu outside and nothing about the $85 per person for not great food.  If the meal was fabulous, then maybe, but it was slightly adequate.  IN GOOD FAITH, I CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT OR IT'S STAFF!  I feel completely ripped off and I'm hungry and it hasn't been an hour since the meal.  Very disappointing!
author: Herb B.

description:
I was lucky enough to have a great dinner where with my brother and his girlfriend in late December (I know, I'm way late. Shameful) The atmosphere and service were on par with the excellence of the food. Our waitress was the sweetest young girl who had only been in America for about 6 months, she told us. She was really polite and very helpful with wine selections and Italian pronunciations as well. 
Due to the lateness of the review, I can only recall what I had for dinner and that our wine was a Barberra. I have the pesto with prawns and cherry tomatoes. Its simplicity was its shining moment. The pesto was without a doubt the best restaurant pesto I've had. I make a mean traditional basil pesto from a family recipe, so I have high standards, and this was wonderful. The prawns were cooked perfectly and the dish as a whole was superb. 
I highly recommend checking out this little spot, I dare say you won't be disappointed!
author: Jessica D.

description:
Their delicious bruscetta with a decent glass of Sangiovese didn't hurt to start things off. 

Inviting candles and wood made an inviting atmosphere like most have said though the poorly sponged walls didn't add points to my scorecard. The servers were good and friendly enough, but I could see trouble with a full house - we went on MLK day and it wasn't too busy. Your best bet is to get a glass of wine in your hand right away.

We both had specials for our entrees. They were solid and good but not extraordinary. The riosotto was done fairly well and I am pretty picky about this dish. My girlfriend's eggplant ravioli had a wonderful sauce and we were enjoying our meal enough to go for more wine. They have a small but complementary wine list, but stick their wines by the glass are fitting enough. 

For dessert they were out of the tiramisu which was frustrating. We settled for a profiterole, but it was nothing special - the cappacunio was more satisfying. Overall our experience was enjoyable ... and it's on most dining awards lists if you want some miles. I would go back again.

And yes, to ensure a good starting mood, walk or cab it to this neighborhood.
author: Dave R.

description:
My boyfriend took me here on our first date.  It can definitely possess that romantic atmosphere, but at the same time, I have gone here with friends and family as well.  So...basically it's perfect for all occasions!  I absolutely love this place!  It's a very small place, but I enjoy that because it makes me feel right at home.  

The food is sooo good!  Omg, and the bread they serve you is amazing!  It tastes like your mom spent all day making bread from scratch...or i guess you could just say it tastes like homemade bread.  The service is good too.  They don't stand right over your shoulder, but if you need something, they gladly assist you.  They also don't rush you out--both times I have had to ask for the bill--nice to know that you can stay as long as you'd like.
author: Danielle J.

description:
So I had been wanting to try this place for a while. It is adorable from the street with its twinkling lights. But I was hesitant due to some of the complaints on Yelp about the service. I took a chance though, and I am glad I did.

My parents came in to SF this past weekend, and wanted to meet me for dinner. They felt like Italian. When I heard that, I kind of panicked because I come from an Italian family, and I know that they would be judgemental about the food. I have never been too impressed by any Italian restaurants around here, so I was at a loss. I made a reservation at Amarena and kept my fingers crossed.

I arrived shortly after my parents did. They were at the wine bar speaking with the manager. They were all smiles and laughs. I started to have a good feeling. My parents introduced me to him (Pauly), and he got me a glass of wine. My dad and I then made a reference to Pauly Walnuts (From the Sopranos if you live under a rock). Laughs all around. Dad then explained to me that Pauly had shown him pictures of the wild boars they hunt, and said I should look too. Pauly recommended the pictures for after dinner. My mom agreed, since they are are not cute, they are dead. Ewww. But, dad got a kick out of it, so that's good.

Anyhoo, after a nice conversation with Pauly, we were seated. We had great service all night long. We had a very nice girl serving us, who was understanding when my overzealous Sicilian father somehow broke the candle on our table, and humored him when he tried to make lame jokes. Ahhh, I love my dad. Pauly kept coming back to check on us all night to make sure were were comfortable. He recommened a great wine for my dad to go with his steak. Which leads me into the food...

It is pretty solid. As I mentioned, I am Italian, and both of my parents and my grandparents make excellent sauces. So when it comes to pasta sauces, I am discriminating. The sauces were good. Not excellent, but good. Not enough flavor for me overall, but I was happy. The gnocchi I had was very tender - great consistency, and the bruschetta was fresh tasting. Dad had a steak dish, and he pretty much licked his plate clean. Mom had a spaghetti dish, and she ate most of it, but it didn't knock her socks off. We also had calamari. It was kind of rubbery, but tasty. The scallops we had garnered mixed reviews. I liked them, but mom did not. Note that they come raw in the middle (I don't think mom picked up on the word "seared"). Oh, and the bread is soft and chewy...just the way I like it. Overall, we were happy and too stuffed for dessert.

I guess I just want to say that the service we had was way above average. Even though they were very busy with a wedding party and a bustling Saturday night crowd, we never ever felt neglected...in fact, we felt special and well taken care of. When Pauly saw us get up to leave, he asked if we needed a cab, and ran outside to flag one down for us. 

All in all, we had a great time, and I will definitely be back!
author: Baby Bear G.

description:
I really like this place.  I like how it has this cool - "I know I am good but will still give you committed service and will treat you like you live upstairs' feeling.

I like how I can be totally high maintenance and ask that the 3 dishes we ordered be split evenly between the 2 of us and you still are so pleasantly accommodating and friendly.  Sigh...  now if only everyone could be this way.... (thank you waitress Kristal!)

So we had late reservations - 9pm on a Tuesday night - and we both arrived late.  Fine - okay - that's just how I roll...  fine - shoot me - I don't care - I was coming from somewhere else - sorry.  But Amereta didn't give me grief at all.  That's when you know you are dealing with some italianos...  bella italia.

So we share: cherry tomato soup (in 2 separate bowls - cause they are cool like that) with a handful of roasted and split cherry tomatoes floating around in the dish.  The bruchetta, authentic in the way the sliced onions added depth and texture.  And the penne arribiatta - which was actually the main reason for going here tonight.  Note: there was tomato in all three dishes - which I have to admit , and also mentioned during dinner - reminded me of the fresh tomatoes we tasted in Napoli last fall - omg so flavorful.

And they have this live music thing every other Thursday that I def need to make sure I check out - last time met up with people so late that I missed all this fun stuff they talk about - but shiat - next time I will be early even.  I promise.
author: BeatsEats K.

description: We went here for a birthday party with a party of 8. The portion here is very small and average. When we polled everyone about their food, only one person was happy with their food. The others felt the food was either too plain or bland. To add insult, the portions were too small. There were girls in our group and they even complained. The other negative part was that we were told to give up our table since there was another party behind us. The host was very polite about it but still, this was a birthday party and we were still dining. Overall, the place had decent service, is quaint and charming, but overall, not good enough to come back to.
author: nik t.

description: I have driven by Amarena several times and it looked crowded/interesting so I decided to order take-out from Amarena tonight. I ordered the Calamari and Gnocchi and picked it up 15 minutes later. The girl on the phone was very pleasant and helpful... When I got home, I realized that the calamari had (i) breaded and fried veggies/ tempura and shrimp tempura & (ii) no sauce. I called Amarena about the sauce and they told me that the calamari is usually served with a red sauce but that they skipped it on the take-out order because they didn't have small containers.... The gnocchi (which is what I usually judge Italian restaurants by) was delicious as was the calamari but Amarena, get some small sauce containers please!!
author: Viv A.

description:
Great food! The flavors of every dish we ordered were amazing; with each flavor peeking out and not drowned by a predominate or overpowering flavor.
Service was "phony" polite and did not create a personal and warm environment. Too bad, because I am sure the chef was doing all he could do to create an amazing dining experience.
author: Fred H.

description:
Amarena makes me happy.  It honestly does.  I live in the neighborhood and it truly can be classified as a "neighborhood gem".  Don't get me wrong, this hood is stocked to the brim with some fabulous places to eat, but something about Amarena makes you feel at home.  Frascati and Luella down the street are nothing to shake a stick at, but when I go to those places I feel required to dress real fancy and check my bank account balance before leaving the house.  At Amarena I'm more comfortable in the low lit, but cozy atmosphere, and, although not cheap, it doesn't break the bank.
Have the caprese - or whatever it is with their fresh mozzarella, it is the freshest, most delicious mozz i have ever had, and I have been to Italy!
author: Brigid R.

description: The food was really good, but the service was below average.  A number of things happened: 1/ the waiter/waitress served 2 (out of 3) of us water, 2/ our food came last and we ordered before the 4 tables around us (and the restaurant wasnt busy), 3/ the waitress did fresh ground pepper for the tables around us and blew us off and told us to use the table pepper, 4/ she brought us the wrong check and 5/ didnt offer us water throughout the meal.  Very dissapointed and unlikely to go back.
author: Michael A.

description: Horrible service! Everything took much longer than necessary. We had to remind the server about receiving a dessert menu several times.. I was looking forward to drinking an espresso with their chocolate desert, but the dessert didn't come out long after I finished my espresso. When I cancelled my order, the server rolled her eyes at me and asked me if I wanted to take it to go. People sitting next to us had a similar, maybe worse experience. Food was okay, not that good.
author: Alexi P.

description: I really enjoyed dinner at this neighborhood Italian restaurant. The owner came outside and helped me find a parking spot (it was crowded), they took my jacket, and we were all made to feel very welcome. The food was delicious.
author: David S.

description: Butternut squash ravioli is great.  We've been here several times and alwasy enjoy our meal.  It is a great neighborhood spot.
author: Cadie B.

description: A little off the hustle and bustle of Polk street, Amerena is A-OK.  A small bar - four seats - perfect for a casual glass of wine and an appetizer.  Service was attentive and not overbearing.  Atmosphere is inviting, but not overpowering.
author: J T.

description:
My take, the apps are really good, the entrees are just ok, and the desserts, not so much.

The service is very friendly.

In other words, your basic neighborhood joint.  Not worth a journey, but if you happen to be there, its ok to stop by.
author: Happy C.

description:
After dining at Amarena I wrote a brief review and gave them three stars.  The owner wrote me personally and asked for another chance.  He really seemed to genuinely care about my happiness as his customer and wanted a shot at trying again.  You have to respect that!

So, I'm upgrading my star count from three to four because even though my palate favors Southern Italian cuisine and this is a Northern Italian restaurant and menu, the food was good when I went and I am especially impressed the owner took the time and trouble to ask for another shot at making me happy.

I will give Amarena another shot and soon.  You should, too.
author: Drexel B.

description:
The food was OK, but nothing special. Certainly better than Olive Garden, but not by all that much. The place and the service was great. But if you're looking for good Italian food, I would not recommend it. Pesce, just a few blocks down on Polk, has much better on offer, esp. seafood.

The 3 of us went there last Saturday evening. Here's what we ordered and what I think of them each:
Gnocchi con Funghi e Gorgonzola -     $ 15.00 
   (less than average. too much cream, not crunchy at all, bland)
Pennette allo Scoglio -     $ 17.00
   (average. too much of the seafood was calamari, and it was not good calamari. pasta was supposed to be homemade, but I don't think mine was.)
Salmone alla Capocaccia -     $ 24.00
   (Average)

I was rather underwhelmed by the food, but enjoyed the service and the ambiance. One bright spot - the bread! It was rich, flavourful rosemary focaccia bread. Of course, I stuffed myself with it. I had actually tried them once a year or two before. I ordered a risotto dish, which was also barely ok. Thought I'd give the place another try, but meh, not going back there again.
author: j c.

description: Quiet Quaint neighborhood restaurant. Excellent fresh high quality italian ingrediants. Friendly staff and owner Palo.
author: Michael R.

description: Since I moved over to this hood recently, alot of my buddies have urged me to try this place out. So glad I did! I went in with a friend for a light dinner and some wine. I was really impressed with the service and quality of food. Also, their pasta menu was half off after 8 or at least when we went in. Our server was so pleasant and I really think she was italian, so that made it even better. I have been hearing alot about their Thursday happy hours, so hopefully I will make it in one day. Overall, a wonderful experience and can't wait to go back.
author: Shantel V.

description: Amarena is an decent restaurant.  It's a little pricey for what it is, but I the prices are pretty standard for Russian Hill.  It definately of neighborhood type of restaurant.  My wife had the parpedelli.  The pasta is very fresh and delicious.  The only problem is the sauce seemed liked it lacked elegance or flavor. The place has a small plate part of the menu. A really great choice if you don't know what to get. I really like this in restaurants because I can try more dishes without having to come back another time. I had the meatballs and the polenta.  The meat in the meatballs was too lean.  I've made Italian meatballs before from a cooking class and I would say it was 50% goose fat. These however, were too lean. The flavor very bland and the sauce kept it from being a bad dish.  It was nice tomato sauce with good seasoning.  The polenta was the only better than average dish.  The polenta was moist and had just the right texture.  Not too much cream but not dry either.  The sauce reminded me of a buttermilk gravy sauce.  It was not sophisticated or worth the Russian Hill prices.  Granted I would come back but only if other restaurants were booked near by.  Suggestions for Amerena, add more salt and spices to the papardelli sauce, add more fat to the meatballs, and be more creative with the polenta sauce.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Definitely merits 3.5 stars, but since that's not an option, I think it's only fair to round up.

Finally ventured here on one exceptionally rainy + gloomy night, after passing it frequently for almost a year. It was nearly empty, which was great, because we got our pick of the cozy window tables.

Food was good, not great - and wines by the glass are limited, but serviceable. Tried the arugula salad (not special, but the generous shaved parm helped), the chanterelle soup of the day (a bit too rich to finish with tasty garlic/butter croutons), and split the butternut squash ravioli (a bland "brown butter" sauce and very "al dente" diced vegetables, but fresh + flavorful filling made up for it).

Service was friendly + authentic. I'll stop by for the happy hour special - and would consider going back otherwise - if only due to proximity.
author: Allie H.

description: Maybe this place doesn't have the nicest decor, tables or silverware, but the food is great.  Very impressed with their fillet mignon and deserts.  Not too expensive. Highly recommend.
author: B K.

description: Not only was the quaint ambiance excellent, but the staff and the owner were extremely friendly and personable! had an amazing thursday happy hour with friends...savoring the cocktails and tasty food!
author: dorothy g.

description:
What a blast.  Have you been to this place on a Thursday night?  They have something called "Italian Happy Hour".  Apparently, this is all the rage in Italy, but it is the only one I know of in the city.  They provide the band (rotates a Cuban band and Jazz), a free buffet of pasta (usually a red sauce and a pesto), salad, and bruchette.

I have been there a few Thursdays now, enjoyed their wine selection and awesome sangria to compliment the food and music.  I have mingled with local professionals, dancing people there for the band, and the wonderful community of Italians the scene draws.  A good time.

Thursday nights are definitely not a replacement of their normal fare.  I live in the neighborhood and eat there quite often.  I like their squash ravioli, beet salad, and trams but most of their menu is pretty good.  Their fish, risotto, and steak are top notch.  It isn't a shell fish place, so why not order something like their chicken parmigiana?  Much better.

Go there.  Paolo the owner is present most nights and his character is part of the experience.  Tell him Christi sent you.  Wink.  He'll treat you like a star!
author: Christi G.

description:
As I am reading the other reviews for this restaurant, I am realizing why I was not terribly impressed with this restaurant. I went there last night with a party of about 12 people to celebrate a friend's birthday, and the only options were from a set menu that included only three entree options, three appetizers and one dessert. The appetizers we had were the bruschetta, which was AMAZING and exactly the way it is in Rome, a salad with fennel, spinach and something else (I can't remember) which was also excellent, and friend polenta sticks with mushroom sauce, which were ok but nothing great.
I also have to note that the bread they put on the table in a basket is some of the best bread I have ever had in my life. I usually don't snack on bread in restaurants,  but this bread was so good that I ate three pieces!!
Our entrees, however, were not such a bit hit with everyone. My salmon turned out to be really good. It came with a sauce with capers, tomatoes and olives and there were potatoes on the side. It was sooooo good! The only problem was that I thought that the portion was just a little bit too small. I realize that the food at Amarena is high quality and that it is nice restaurant, but the amount of salmon in the serving was basically a miniature little strip of fish. 
My friends hated the chicken. They said it was so dry that they could barely eat it.. In fact, one friend asked the waiter if she could please have any sort of sauce over her chicken so that she would be able to eat it. Friends who ordered the rack of lamb complained that the cuts of meat were bad, and that the portions were too small.
For dessert, we had coffee, which was good, and the cioccolato dessert, which was very interesting. I am nt a big fan of chocolate, but this dessert was good and not overly chocolatey.
I think I will have definitely have to return to Amarena to try out the pastas...
author: Daniela A.

description: Really enjoyed my experience here! Got a little worried when I first walked into the restaurant and felt a wall of oppressive heat (so much so that I was thankful that we had to wait a minute for our table so we could stand outside in the fresh air) But that was quickly resolved - we were seated in the second adjoining room which made a huge difference being a little further away from the kitchen! Service was friendly and attentive. We ordered an appetizer with calamari, zucchini and prawns and I think it was the best prawns I've ever tasted! Everything was delicious and light with just the right amount of crunch. For entrees, I had the crabmeat-filled ravioli and my boyfriend had the petrale sole and a half-order of pasta. I loved the flavor and presentation of everything! Didn't have time to stay for dessert, but will next time.
author: Barbara K.

description: I wanted to like this place - it's a nice walk from our place, it's a small corner place and everyone was friendly.  No dice.  The appetizers were solid (carpaccio and polenta), but the entrees really missed.   My Spaghetti Emilliana (basically Bolognese) was too salty and the two fried meatballs it came with were moon rocks (dry as could be).  Lisa's seafood risotto was ok, but nothing special.  The risotto seemed like it had been cooked hours ago and the calamari should have been called sea-leather.  Bummer.
author: Graham M.

description: For such a darling place, I was sadly disappointed.  The food looked good, but it was cold, the shrimp were overcooked, and the pasta had way too much sauce.  In the future, I would rather cook Bertolli at home for a cheaper price and spend the rest on a good wine.
author: Angela D.

description: Extremely cute place especially for dates. I would give my experience 4 stars but just because of their music taste I'll give the 5 stars. They played deep house, lounge easy to ear music when we were there. Not super expensive but still not cheap. And seafood was good as well. (and I'm picky with seafood.)
author: Kerem S.

description:
Horrible service!! okay food! that's the short review. 

The long review: we had reservations and we waited like 20 minutes when we got there when there was like 2 open tables. It took forever to order and get our food and when our waitress came to give us the food she said that " sorry it was just sitting in the back for a while". That's great to hear, then I was siked to eat this meal. She never came back to check on us until long after we finished our meal. We ordered dessert (which was the mistake) and a coffee. She brought both out and asked if we wanted cream, we said yes. The cream never came and she noticed when she came back 30 minutes later with the bill.We said we didn't want the coffee seeing as how we got it for the dessert and she said she'd take it off. She comes back after charging my card and she added another coffee instead of deducting one. So I walk up and point it out and she doesn't the math in front of me and comes up with the same thing. I couldn't believe she really thought that it would be more after taking money off the bill. At this point me and my girlfriend were super over this place. The waitress never said sorry for anything and never apologized. So i signed the bill and we grabbed our things and we opened the door, our waitress ran up and gave us prosecco at the door for "being great". At that point it was super too little too late. How are we going to enjoy the prosecco at the door? We left extremely disappointed. We'd never go back.
author: Mike L.

description:
Wow.  Big hype and little return.  Do yourself a favor.  Head to the Ferry Plaza/Market Hall/Insert your favorite gourmet pasta place here....buy a pound of ravoli filled with whatever you like, another 1/2 pint of sauce, a $15 chainti, and do it yourself.  Both your stomach and wallet will be satisfyed.

Saturday night dinner here was a waste.  Ravoli's were mush; salad was loaded with red onions, which overpowered everything else.  Soup was bland.  And our waitress must have been auditioning for the absent-minded watiress remake.  Should it take 20 minutes for the wine to arrive?  Should it take 20 minutes for the bill to be paid?
author: Thad M.

description: I came here last night for happy hour with a few friends. Live jazz and of course pasta buffet yum! Had a chianti and white sparkling wine, the service was good and prices were decent. Very lively closer to 630-700 ish and they a couple outdoor tables as well. Very cute place!!!
author: Julie F.

description: Cozy cute neighborhood Italian.  Super fresh ingredients, beautiful presentation.  A nice big menu with interesting things like crab-stuffed baby artichoke with red pepper coulis, or fresh paparadelle with goat cheese, peas and pesto, or four types of fresh gnocchi, or fresh snapper with perfectly cooked veggies.  Apparently, same as Baldoria -- just changed the name.
author: Melanie C.

description: Um, did I visit the same restaurant that so many fellow Yelpers raved about?  I wanted to believe that I, too, would find Amarena to be charming and romantic--especially since I was going there on a crucial 4th date.  However, Amarena was nothing more than mediocre.  The atmosphere was on the cheesy side, and so was my food, come to think of it.  And when they blared not 1, but 3 Andrea Bocelli songs back-to-back from the restaurant's speakers, I knew this date was going downhill.  You won't have a bad experience at Amarena, but I doubt you'll have a memorable one there either.
author: Emily G.

description: I dined here last night and a wonderful experience.  Maybe they have had service issues in the past but the service we received last night was stellar.  From our phone call to make last minute reservations to our meal, we received top notch attention.  (I actually got off the phone and said "wow that was a really sweet gal who just took our reservation.")  Our server could not have been better and when we ran out of wine, a different sever asked it we would like another glass.  She was a doll and despite the fact that we weren't even her table customers, she but brought more vino immediately.  Generous pours of excellent vino here :) .  Great pasta dishes, creative & tasty small plates, really enjoyed their osso bucco.  I love what they have done with the space, it has a  warm and comfy ambiance.
author: Cat K.

description:
I can fairly give Amarena 2 stars.  I've been there 4x.  The first three were great.  I took friends. I took family.  So on the 5th, I took friends and family...and wish I didn't.  I'm not sure if they changed chefs, but my most recent visit was horrible.  The only highlights were the soft bread and good wine.  The eggplant appetizer was rubbery and absolutely bland, and the heaping cheese mess on top didn't do much to mask the bitterness.  Our table of four had the butternut squash ravioli and the veal ossobuco.  The butternut squash ravioli was completely bland and soaking in butter.  The Weight Watchers butternut squash ravioli that I had last week was better.  As for the ossobuco, there was no meat to be found. Only a large bone with some skin swimming in a pasta with gravy.  My fellow diners (my parents) who are small town folks that are impressed with the likes of Olive Garden said it was the worst Italian they've ever had.  

I'm sorry, Amarena.  I really loved the gnocchi and spaghetti the last few times I've visited, but after the other night, I won't be back.
author: Mrsdubyah W.

description:
Went there for the Thursday "happy hour".
The food served for the stand-up "happy hour" looked very mediocre, so we decided to sit down.
We were quite uncomfortable with the guy who served us (so dry! not a smile, almost not a sign of life) and with the food we ordered.
The only good note is the owner, a very friendly and solar person, who goes around to smile and make friends with customers.
We are not going back.
author: Peppe R.

description: Yet another reason to love Russian Hill! I've walked past this place probably 1,000 times and never bothered to stop in to dine. But when a hungry Sunday night left me with a lack of motivation and creativity, I decided to pop in. I was pleasantly surprised, both by the quality of the food and the service. The bread is fabulous...warm and doughy, and the ambiance is what you would expect out of a neighborhood Italian restaurant. I'm a big fan and look forward to coming back again and again.
author: Kristen D.

description:
Bad, bad, bad, bad, bad. What more can I say? The food and the service were borderline terrible. The bread tasted burnt although it wasn't. The appetizer had tomatoes that were white on the inside. The main course was salty. The waitress came by once after we ordered. 

Never again!
author: Mark L.

description: Critical Update! They overcharged my partner's credit card by $10! Sneaky crooks!
author: Halley B.

description:
very random....i always saw this place living on nob hill/polk street area, but never bothered to think about eating there...until one night all the restaurants we wanted to check out on Hyde were packed with long waits, so we stopped in and...it was pretty good.  

The prices are reasonable, and the squid ink pasta is very good.  The only bummer is our table was right next to the bathrooms (like, you can hear the flushing.)
author: Nana S.

description: I really enjoyed this place. Perfect place to catch up and hang out with a group of friends. Such a great happy hour!  When you order a drink you get to enjoy the all you can eat, go back as many times as you want, pasta bar. The pasta bar is all homemade goods that are nicely displayed and you just help yourself. The atmosphere is cute and intimite. There is seating both inside and out. The food is good the wine is great.
author: Leslie C.

description: Yes yes this place has problems with their service. BUT their food is quite delicious and their ambiance is really pleasant and romantic! In addition, they offered my favorite dish as their special when I dined there for my birthday... locally raised cinghiale! At first, my friends and I were thinking "where in the SF Bay Area is boar locally raised." The waitress explained that they were hunted about 3 hours away from the city and that the man that hunted and shot THE boar I was eating was sitting at the table next to me!  How awesome is that? So rustic.
author: Lauren Y.

description: Food and service very inconsistent here. Not worth the risk, because more often bad than good.  Too bad because it's in a perfect location for a good neighborhood restaurant, but the staff - and the owners - do not act like good neighbors.
author: S H.

description: Oh my god this place is so good! And oh my god it's right on my block I guess that means, oh my god I'm coming here every day. Seriously this place is SO good!! I wish I could live here, it's super cute and charming, perfect for an intimate date. I had the pumpkin ravioli which is a must try, it's one of the best things I've ever had. Others in my party had the famed gnocchi (mmmmm) and the tagliatini (MMMMMMM.) The desserts are yum too. I heart this place.
author: Cathy T.

description: I came here on a first date last night and I loved it. I can't wait to go back. I shared several dishes with my date, most of them were good. We really liked the calamari, prawn, zucchini appetizer, it was very tender and the spicy marinara was perfecto! I also liked the cucumber, tomato and red onion salad. My penne pasta sauce was a little salty though and the cesar salad was just alright. We had a bottle of Chianti, the waiters were very good at keeping our glasses full, the wine was good. Finished off dinner with Chocolate salame dessert, which was nutty and decadent, great with our coffees. yum yum... :)
author: Lorraine B.

description: Very fun restaurant with a huge neighborhood following.  While the food was 3 stars, when the owner is able to throw such a nice happy hour in this cozy Nob Hill spot you get an extra star.  A nice fun place for a drink or dinner.
author: Laurence H.

description:
2nd time here & am sooooooo in love with the ambience/setting, the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce &  now their their tiramisu!!!!!!  wow!!! their tiramisu is way up there with local & schuberts!!!! 

great customer service.  loved our server & the owner.  our server was really sweet & cute.   & we got to meet paolo the owner who was really nice, cool, down to earth & obviously passionate about his food & restaurant as he invited us to check out happy hour every other thursday (they have it today).  he was sooo cool he gave us both a lil treat.......a glass of their moscato d'asti (which we both really loved)  a nice refreshing dessert wine (w/ some bubbles) to end our meal.  that  was awesome & a really nice beautiful dining experience on a wednesday evening.
author: Cindi N.

description: I had been enjoying the food at amarena for several years, food and service are consistent . Try the ossobuco or the butternut squash ravioli.........they were delish..........What else to say, it is the most romantic restaurant in the neighborhood
author: Giu G.

description: Even though I had a reservation at 7:30 and we didn't get seated until 8:15 (and I am super picky about restaurants adhering to reservation times), I still give this place 4 stars because the food was just so wonderful. I had freshly made ravioli and the most delicate cream sauce. Reasonably priced and amazing.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Went there for the Thursday happy hour and I must say its a great deal!  Just one drink will buy you appetizers for free!  The food though, was just ok, nothing special.  For an Italian restaurant, I always expect the utmost freshness, but this wasn't it.  The flavor was pretty good and pretty  basic.  The restaurant itself was adorable, so cute and quaint which makes me sad that the food wasn't as comparable.
author: Cara D.

description: After a couple visits to Amarena, I have to say it's one of my favorite restaurants. I adore the cozy, romantic decor and the twinkle lights outside. It's just a great little neighborhood gem - the kind of place that makes me appreciate living in San Francisco and having such hidden treasures right around the corner. The food is not only beautifully presented, but so good that you want to savor every bite. And prices are pretty low, allowing for a memorable meal that won't break the bank.
author: Cindy R.

description:
The moral of my Amarena story is, "If you have high expectations based on Yelp and friend's reviews, never, never visit on New Year's Eve for a prix fixe meal." The short of it is, the procioutto appetizer was bland and ravoli with wild board bolognese lukewarm.  The food uneven ... I tried my GF's octopus appetizer, and then an extra plate that was brought to the table after the kitchen sent out a two salad dishes with wilted greens (with apologies of course); while my GF's octopus was delicious and left me wanting, the second go around dropped me flat on the ground. Sometimes experiencing food is like seeing a highly rated film, you give into the reviews and set your expectations high, but you may at times be disappointed ... very disappointed ... Unfortunately, this was our night of disappointment with Amarena. Even our friends who live around the corner from Amarena, know the owner, and have dined there frequently, were left unsatisfied.  

It might have been better to settle for a cup of espresso and the Salame al Cioccolato, and then call it a night.

So, the moral of the story, never set your expectations high for NYE prix fixe dinner. Don't worry Amarena, you might have me for a second kiss, as I do wish to try that gnocchi with sausage everyone is all a chatter 'bout.
author: Jaime R.

description: Really cute, cozy Italian restaurant in Russian Hill.  The food was good, from appetizer to dessert.  We had a bottle of champagne and a bottle of red (that was recommended by our server), both of which were very nice! But what stood out the most to me was the service - it was by far the best service I have had in a very long time. Parking is definitely tough in this neighborhood, especially on weekends, so I would recommend taking a cab.
author: Shannon E.

description:
If Allen Stewart Konigsberg can be Woody Allen and Cornelius Crane Chase can become Chevy Chase, then why can't Baldoria become Amarena? (I know, you're loving those names...try this place: http://home.tiscali.be/patrick.verboven/The-House-of-Lists/pseudonym.html)... Something about a rose, something something...
Everything about this place exudes warmth - from the waitstaff (which reminded me of that SNL sketch where the waiters all start licking Kirstie Alley, remember?) to the food which is decadent Italian at its best to the wine which is a small list but very tastefully selected.  I would recommend the gnocchi - tasty and delicious.
author: Anjali K.

description: Calamari appetizer is tasty enough but on the lighter side of fried food.  the wine selection is good in that it has some cheaper bottles ranging from $30 all the way up to $100.  the owner was a sweatheart for setting up our bday party.  order spinach ravioli!!  yum!
author: Susan K.

description:
sizes were big! 

homemade pasta with veal shank - not a big pasta lover but this was MMM!! 

went on an empty day, owner and server were very friendly. server definitely not hard to look at. gave us free desserts!

had their carppacio, nothing extraordinary but good. solid. 

bread- very homemad-y feeling.  super condensed and has a great crust. could not stop eating it.  

didn't have wine, so wouldn't know about what everyone dislikes the place for.
author: Hannah W.

description:
another Sunday night, and POURING rain...but...we still somehow manage to get out of the warmth, and into the cold.

at first, we were thinking of going to Frascati...but the rain started to really come down...and Amarena was literally right in front of us.

as we walked in, we were greeted by the hostess/waitress who was very kind.  she took our umbrellas and asked us if we had reservations.  (hmmm...no...but...there's no one in here!)  although we didn't set reservations, we were seated right then and there (heehee). 

the bread was served right away, and hot (yummy).  between the 2 of us, we ordered:  Barbabietole e spinaci, Penne Arrabbiata, Salmone all Capocaccia, and a bottle of San Pellegrino.  The food was good.  Not great or bad...but good!  Looove the service!  i asked if they had hot sauce and the chef MADE some for me (it wasn't really spicy...but that deserves an 'A' for effort)!

Overall, we had great service, good food...and the whole restaurant to ourselves!  no complaints here!
author: Nancy T.

description: Well, I recently had one of the best experiences at Amarena since it opened as Baldoria years back.  The service was attentive, the staff friendly, and the food was fabulous.   Owner Paolo always takes care of his patrons with a warm welcome and true Italian charm.  We had the portobello special, and taglioni with boar ragu which were both excellent!  The bread was delightful and accompanied with olive oil.  We got a chianti that was recommended and it was delicious.  Decor is darling..romantic, and perfect for a date or small intimate group dining experience.
author: Lisa D.

description:
