Giving Amarena 5 stars is based on a multi-level review. The food, (pasta for me) is great, always fresh, consistent, and if I am not mistaken, hand made in house. 

The wait staff at times can be a bit overworked, due to the droves of people that come in for the Thursday night specials, but other than that, always perform well. Now, this is not to be compared to some sort of high end place like the french laundry or epic steakhouse, etc. This is a great Italian pasta spot. As for the steak and the fish they serve, I have had both, and they are both good. But the idea for me is not to go here for meat or fish when their specialty is pasta. 

To wrap up, its a great place, with decent prices, to grab a plate of pasta with some friends, or to take a girl on a date... it has always been reliable for me... the only thing that isn't is the parking, but that is my own problem.
author: James S.

description: This is a nice cozy place that seemed to look like it could be difficult to get quick seating if you don't have reservations.  Suprisingly, my friend and I were able to get a table immediately.  I'm pretty big on lamb, so I had the 'Agnello in crosta di erbe'  It had less of the gamey taste which is really good in my opinion - I like subtle flavors, especially with a glass of red wine.  I enjoyed my time there and will definitely be back when I get the chance.
author: Josh G.

description: Cozy, friendly, pasta dishes are very reliable...
author: Mick G.

description:
This place is one of my favorite italian restaurants in town.  Its a small, quaint and personal place- definitely a great date place.  My date and I arrived early but didnt mind the wait- our host was friendly, and invited us to drinks and conversation.  We got the window table- which I recommend-  lighting was cozy, noise level quite faint- with soft italian music...or was that in my head...
For starters- I we shared the calamari fritti- which came with  a italian tartar sauce.  It was crispy, light and not at all oily! I followed with the Osso bucco with tagliolini and wild mushroom sauce- to me this is italian comfort food at its best...my date had the Ravioli di Pollo (Chicken ravioli)- pasta cooked to the right consistency the with the delectable filling tasted fresh and neatly spiced.  The sauce was precise- just enough to soak with the fresh bread in a basket.  For dessert we shared the chocolate cake- it was a layered (3) cake each with a different consistency- definitely the choice for chocolate lovers...
We decided to continue with the champagne we started off when we got there.
I would definitely come back- maybe for their happy hour on wednesdays...but a quick mention to our attendant- Lara- definitely kept eye on our meal times- there was not waiting for the next course!
author: Arissa C.

description:
Whoever cares to read my reviews would have deduced that I have a strong revulsion toward Italian food.  It's not because it's so carb-ey.  I love my carbs.  It's just that the food is invariably bland and hence forgettable. 

It appears that I was the outlier - everybody else seems to like Italian food.  Or maybe, only maybe, I have not dined at the right places.  Yet. 

So I thought Amarena, situated in San Francisco's North Beach (which by default means 40 minutes of searching for that parking spot about 15 blocks away) with 4-Yelpstar average, would cure my dislike toward Italian food.

Unfortunately, not so.  $38 pre-fix menu got us bruschetta and polenta appetizers, which I could not care less about, and a choice of salmon, chicken breast, lamb chops or a vegetarian entree.  Since it is not my policy to eat either cooked salmon or chicken breast, and I am an antivegetarian, lamb chops seemed to be the most obvious choice.  

Until the said dish were presented in the form of a tiny morsel of overcooked lamb chops.  I could've forgiven the tiny-ness, but what got me was the overcooked stage the chops were in.  Unforgivable. 

OK.... the search for the perfect Italian food continues.
author: Ange L.

description: I ate at Amarena on a girls weekend in S.F. it was the perfect "locals" type of spot, providing a good mix of ambiance and deliciousness.  I had their version of BUCATINI ALLLA MATRICIANA and it was fantastic! I have never had a pasta dish that tasted this good.  I highly recommend you visit this place and the owner Paolo is a charmer.
author: David A.

description:
So it sounds like they may have missed the mark on NYE. 

However, I will say that I have dropped into this little neighborhood joint five or six times over the course of the past two months and have been very pleased every time.

The place is run like a European restaurant, without the stringent but reliable standard operating procedures of most American restaurants (probably since the owner and majority of the staff are straight from Italy). Waiters never look too stressed, even if the place is slammed, which makes them great for conversation and recommendations, but not so good if you're in a huge rush. 

It's ideal for a European style dinner: take your time with every course and sit for long enough to sip on a coffee and regain enough of an appetite for dessert. 

Every other Thursday they have a killer happy hour with a free pasta bar with snacks and live jazz. A little trio of kids that are probably seventeen or eighteen set up in there and play surprisingly proficient standards and set a perfect mood to convert it into a sort of impromptu wine bar. 

To the disgruntled NYE'rs out there, give it another shot sometime. Didn't everyone already know that New Year's Eve is universally not as great as it is cracked up to be?
author: Jake C.

description: If you've been to Italy, you know that nothing about dinner there is quick. That in mind, this place is heaven. Go for the spinach ravioli and the bruschetta(because it comes with fresh mozzarella).
author: Katie T.

description:
I once wrote a review that suggested the service wasn't that great - but have since been back to Amarena and LOVE it. The food is delish and their happy hour on Thursdays - hands down one of the best in the city. I almost don't want anyone else to hear about it! 
This is a great spot for friends or for a date as the food and wine are a-maze.
author: Quinn N.

description:
oh how i wish yelp offered half stars.  this is a def 3 1/2 star establishment. went here on christmas with the hubs.  didn't have any time to plan something big for the holiday, and so i was surprised i was able to book a reservation last minute here.  

4-5 stars for ambiance.  with the red lights strung in the trees outside and the cozy interior, kind of makes you want to snuggle up with your dreamboat.  

apps: we ordered the polenta, mushroom and gorgonzola (ehhh, so so - too rich for my taste) and calamari (yum yummmmm).  

i went with the special: pappardelle and boar.  hubs went with the spaghetti bolagnese.  both were very good.  our only complaint was that the sauces were both overly salted.  like bring me chapstick and water.

for dessert, we got the creme brulee and some kind of chocolate molten thing with ice cream.  the brulee was pretty good but the chocolate thing was aMAzing.  

the waiters were nice and attentive (not overly in your face but there when you need them).  although the waiter did press a pet peeve button when he corrected my pronunciation of "pappardelle".  come on!  but he was legit italian.

we'll definitely come back, probably to try the jazz night happy hour they have every other thursday.
author: Christina K.

description: Went here for the first time with my brother. Have been wanting to go for awhile and we were able to get a reservation 20 minutes prior to dinner. The ambiance is charming, the presentation of the food is great, and the service is very good. Unfortunately the food was good, not great. Wine by the glass was okay. Will go back to give it a second chance.
author: B K.

description: This cozy neighborhood trattoria in Russian Hill may serve up some of the city's best gnocchi, but after meeting a friend for a bottle of wine the other night, it may just be my new neighborhood watering hole.  With the increasing number of sceney-bars popping up all over the city, it's nice to have a place where you can belly up to a bar rich in atmosphere, yet lacking pretense.
author: Katie C.

description:
i really enjoyed this little neighborhood restaurant!  

the food was good.  the wine was good.  the waiter was hot . a great combination for a delicious sunday night.  it was more expensive then my usual restaurant choices - but i wouldn't say over the top.
author: jessie h.

description: It's hard to find parking around there but the gnocchi and home made pasta are truely one of the best in town. (Personal favorite probably goes to the calamari-ink linguini with seafood) Chicken was not very good, service is kinda slow, but with a glass of wine in hand and good conversation with friends over dinner, this place provides intimate setting/ambience in the quite part of the neighborhood (Russian Hill?) away from the busy streets. And if pasta is what you are going for, this is definitely one of the places you don't want to miss.
author: Angela H.

description: I've been to Amarena once and had the pasta with duck in it.  I was expecting actual pieces of duck, but instead it was ground.  But, the dish was really good.  It is a nice intimate setting, and I went during the late evening close to closing time.  Not sure how crowded it usually is, but I definitely would like to go back to try out some of the other dishes.
author: Clarence K.

description: Killer tagliatelle with duck ragu, buratta with arugula salad and the wine list is exemplary! Amarena is a cozy romantic place that is great for a group as well. 8 of us were promptly seated and served by a sweet and very informed waitress. The whole experience from the appetizer to the dessert was fabulous. I can't say enough about the fresh pastas and rich sauces. It was a delight to the senses - especially my palate. I had the pleasure of nibbling on the polenta - excellent, the osso bucco - tender and flavorful, and the angel hair tossed with vegetables in a light olive oil sauce. Delectable.
author: Stacy T.

description: THE most romantic evenings I have ever had have been at Amarena.  Paulo and his gorgeous staff will spoil the hell out of you and the food is an angel's kiss.
author: Ashwina L.

description: liked the named Baldoria better, but what can you do?  THe place is a bit small and cozy. Maybe too cozy. The food is always just right and snug candlelit setting makes for a laidback but romantic night. FOr me it's always a sure thing.
author: angela g.

description: I tried the crab and scallop ravioli with delicious sauces which was very tasty. The place had a great, softly-lit ambiance for a date. The prices weren't bad for Italian food, but it seems like you could get the same quality cheaper at Antica (but without the sexy mood.)
author: Shannon R.

description: I used to always pass this place on my way home from a night out in cabs and couldn't commit to memory the name (usually a LONG night). The lights are so inviting outside! Luckily I passed it during the day and came in for dinner. It's a quaint place with OK food, but the atmosphere is so nice.
author: Carson H.

description: Amarena is wondeful!!  I love the location, love the ambiance & the food and staff were GREAT...full of flavor and personality.  I stumbled upon Amarena and I'm for sure going back...great find!!
author: richard c.

description: Best Italian food I've had in SF! The pasta itself was so amazing- homemade, really fresh. The bread was also really good- also homemade and served warm. It's a nice cozy environment and was not very crowded when I was there. My boyfriend and I each had one of the specials. I had the green bean and zuchini pasta which was really simple but perfectly executed. My boyfriend had the pumpkin raviolis and they were sooo good! Slightly sweet with a hint of vanilla I think. Sadly parking in the neighborhood is really difficult and it's not close to BART...
author: Sarah H.

description: Delicious food!!! I recommend the Ink Squid Linguini and Pumpkin Ravioli. Cozy ambiance for an intimate dinner with friends or a date. Great selection of wines.
author: Jane R.

description: One star for the very friendly service... our server couldn't have been nicer. One star for the delicious homemade pasta... the tagliolini with mushrooms, zuchini, sun dried tomatoes and olive oil was excellent. One star for the dessert.... the gelato was superb. The drawbacks were the appetizer and salad.... both the eggplant and mixed greens were ho-hum... I'm told the eggplant wasn't a traditional version... and the greens were very boring. As for atmosphere,  it's dark and cozy, making it largely a date place... however,  there were a few groups sprinkled amongst the couples.
author: a p.

description: Great Italian food, very friendly if a bit goofy service. The entrees are fantastic but reasonably priced ($20-$25).
author: Gabor C.

description: This is such a cute place.  When I came here to meet friends, I went to the bar to wait.  The servers/ bartenders are so nice and friendly.  They even gave me free bruschetta to nibble on while I waited for my girlfriends.  We were seated quickly, which was nice.  I ordered the ravioli which was freshly made, and delightful.  The tiramisu here is really good too.  What I like about this spot is that it's quaint, intimate, and fun at the same time.  Great date place, and also a fun place to go with a small group of friends.  They even have happy hour there every other Thursday (ask them and they'll put you on their evite list), where they offer free pasta!
author: Sarah F.

description:
another great italian place to add to the list.  

i had a horrible day at work and upon arriving at amarena, wanted to do nothing more than drink.  heavily.  

upon sitting down, however, i felt less stressed and more relaxed.  a warm setting, comfy seating and very friendly, down-to-earth servers.  a reminder that there are things in life besides the jobbie.    

they have a very large selection of italian wines by the bottle - i was clueless and was given a great and reasonably priced recommendation.  

the bread came out warm and was homemade.    

spinach salad was an excellent pick along with the tagliolini.  my dining mates got the crab ravioli.  everything was fresh, homemade.  food arrived quickly.  we sat for a few hours dining and went on our way.  all 4 of us talked about it for the rest of the evening.  

highly recommend.  highly.
author: Kristin K.

description: Great food, great ambience, great service. The risotto was delicious! Had a wonderful tomato salad that is pictured.
author: Pamela B.

description: One star for fabulous atmosphere. One star for very reasonable prices. One star for the friendly service. One star for the solid Italian cuisine (the veggie pasta was definitely tasty). Minus one star because some things (the salads, for example) were just okay, as was my friend's entree. Great place for a date. As others have noted, parking sucks and so does public transportation in this part of town.
author: SL N.

description: Don't get the ravioli unless you absolutely LOVE sweet potatoes and sugar. My boyfriend had the chicken that was good, but for the price of the items around 20 a dish they are VERY SMALL. Their meals are more like small plates, and i'm not some big huge eater, I'm a small girl, but I thought they were way too small. atmosphere and service was good, but food, ehh
author: sarah b.

description: Amerena is a very cute and cozy. I've only been there once, but the food and wine was outstanding.  The service is fair, very friendly and prompt. Overall, Amarena is a gem located in the middle of a residential area that is nicely decorated, and a great place to go out on a date or the such!
author: Polina B.

description: This little place is a perfect spot for locals.  Last night wasn't the first time I have been there but the first time that I ordered the Carpaccio.  It was the best that I have ever had.  The beef was thick and full of flavor, wrapped up in a huge roll with arugula and capers.  My mouth is still watering.  My friend ordered the Pappardelle with Wild Boar.  The dish was fantastic.  The wine list is extensive and the atmosphere is perfect.  I will be going back soon.
author: Karen S.

description: This place is great. The food is yummy and the service is good. Yes, sometimes they are a little slow but they are super friendly and the owner goes out of his way to talk to you and make sure everything is right.
author: Melissa N.

description: Amarena is a great date restaurant, and is equally fun with friends.  The menu features a few standard and a few unusual Italian dishes, a good wine list, and really excellent desserts.  The staff is both professional and personal and the atmosphere is intimate and relaxed.  The food is consistently good, and its presentation is beautiful.  My personal favorite dish is the Gnocchi con Funghi e Gorgonzola, but in about five visits everything has been wonderful.  In addition, they have outdoor seating on a quiet, mostly residential street when the weather permits it.  Sometimes the service is a little awkward or slow, and some of the portions are very small, but overall Amarena is a very good restaurant.
author: Megan S.

description: place is cozy and has a nice ambience for a date.  food is standard italian fare with no big standouts.
author: Helen T.

description:
Amarena is better than most SF Italian restaurants--and that's the Serie A league of Italian restaurants in America.  

The ambiance is excellent--two nicely understated rooms in what was once a corner grocery store on Larkin at Green.  The owner greets you warmly, and the service is good (but I know that some people have had trouble with it).  We went recently on a Sat. nite but got served promptly and the waiter was always checking back with us.

The menu is not extensive: mainly fish and pasta.  But they do their dishes nicely.  I favor the seafood mix--calamari, shrimps, mussels, octupus, and tuna--on black ink squid noodles (really done well and tasty).  My wife likes the spinach gnochi and they always surprise with their tastiness.  The other seafood dishes are generally good as are the various pastas.  The salads are tasty but nothing special.  Same with the desserts.

The wine list is extensive.  BTW the prices are very reasonable for this kind of restaurant.  Many customers are Russian Hill yuppies but don't hold that against Amarena--they are just trying to make a living.

One huge negative: parking is non-existant within at least a mile.  The last time we went, we only got a space because we saw a guy on Hyde Street take out his car keys and we followed him for three blocks until he got to his car and pulled out.  You can also take a cable car there but that is cornball tourist.  The best bet is to take a 47 on Van Ness and walk about 5 blocks to the restaurant.  Maybe they really need those Russian Hill yuppies to make a living here!
author: Murray S.

description: Some of the best food I've had in a long time. The ambiance is great, it's a small dim lit place in the middle of Russian hill. I highly recommend it.
author: John Q.

description:
This is such a great place!!!! The recipes are out of this world. The food is so yummy and fresh!!!!  I feel like I am back in Italy everytime I go. Not only is the food kick ass.. Paulo is Priceless!!
He has pured his heart and soul into Amarena!  You feel like part of his family. Being that Amarena is more of a local place you will always find friendly people inside. I have many times gone alone to dine and  I always meet new people. I always go the the happy hours which are just a blast.  The wine list is great and the dessert is to die for. ... 
So IF you are planning on dining alone... or going a romantic date.. joining 10 friends... this is the place for you. 
the prices i think are to low !!!! The food is just so good . 
so i hope to see you there...
author: maria k.

description:
One of my favorite spots for Italian in the city. Nice romantic ambiance, good wine selection, and friendly service. 

Not really a seen or be seen place but good date spot. Parking can be a beeatch so make a reservation, go early, and if you luck out with a spot, have a glass of wine at the bar and chat up the friendly staff or the owner who always seems to be there.

The daily specials I have tried so far have been killer. I think they must only do specials based on what they can actually get really fresh. In fact, best Caprese salad I've had outside Italy. Too bad its not on the regular menu.

The osso buco was a real standout, but have yet to have anything bad. They also rewarded us with a complimentary glass of dessert wine for being honest about the fact that we were not charged for wine. Was tempted to give 5 stars but service has been a little slow at times. Certainly does not warrant missing out on this place though.
author: Pete L.

description: My last visit was not as satisfying as any of the other times I dined.  I ordered the osso buco, which is one of their specialties.  I was very disappointed in the presentation and the preparation.  It was the last part of the tail served on a large bed of linguini which was covered in a tasteless, cream like sauce.  I was shocked that the waiter even brought it to the table.  I should have returned it, but I feared if that came out of the kitchen, all hope was lost.  If I had not been there on other occasions, two stars would be generous for that experience.
author: irwin s.

description: We went early on a Wednesday, for an anniversary celebration.  There were only a few customers at 7 PM, but the place was packed before we left.  We had reservations but we're not sure that mattered because nobody took our names or crossed us off in any little books.  Both the food and wine were delightful -- we ordered steamed clams and mussels, papardelle with ground wild boar and tomato sauce, and the osso buco over palenta, splitting all the dishes between us.  We drank a Mastrobono Riserva 2003, $65 -- the same bottle is advertised on the internet for $50, so that was a good deal.  That made a filling meal for two.  The atmosphere is high-end bistro, a bit loud with close seating but linen tablecloths and attentive service.  Our waiter up-sold us a bit (we gave $65 as our upper limit for wine and he hit it, smack on) but when we teased him about that he comped us two glasses of prosecco.  Near the end of our meal, we asked the couple alongside us what their dish was and they said "It's tonight's special," the first time we heard of any such specials.
author: Andi O.

description: i was here for the happy hour that takes place every other thurs. order a drink (wine/$9) and you can have all you can eat pasta/salad. the spinach salad was delish and the pasta, perfect. we were all full so i have no complaints! times are tough and i'm glad my friends recommended this place! what a DEAL!
author: Linda T.

description: As a person who lives just doors away, i had been planning to try this restaurant since moving into the neighbourhood.   I was delighted when last minute, on Dec. 30th, I was able to secure a reservation for 4 for New Years eve off Open Table.  The experience was a disaster.  When we arrived, there was a crowd at the front door.  We had a 7.30 reservation.  There was no one greeting people as they arrived or indeed taking any control over the ever increasing flow into the restaurant.   Almost 50 minutes after arriving we were finally seated having waited very graciously.  The food was absolutely appalling, a bland starter of procioutto was served to the table, this was sadly the best part of the mean.  I had the risotto which was luke warm and semi hard from old age with was tastless and tough.  Main course was the Oso bucco which I could have sewed to the sole of my shoe and run a marathon on, it was the fattiest most disgusting piece of meat I'd every been served in a restaurant.  I could barely even cut it and it went untouched as did the same course with everone else at the table.  At that point the bill was placed on our table without the desert that came with the 'fixe prix' let alone asking us if everything was ok or if we wanted coffee.  Upon coffee enquiry we were informed by the Manager that the machine was broken and there was another party waiting despite the fact we hadn't even finished our meal or drinks and had been seated so late.  He was rude and pushy and for this lovely experience we all left $115 per head lighter.   I eat out most nights of the week and the area has so many great places, I was hoping to add Amarena to the list but frankly the whole night left me with little cheer.  We all left hungry and upset.  Save your hard earned $$$ for a place that at the very least treats its customers with a bit of respect.
author: eva j.

description: My girlfriend and I have been going to Amarena for awhile now and the quality of the dishes has really declined. We were hoping that we had a couple off nights, but its just been consistently sub par. We really liked this place but won't be going back anymore.
author: Bubba M.

description: A good find in the neighbourhood! The appetizer we had was from the daily specials list, and it was delicious. Good size portion entrees. Service was exceptional!
author: V V.

description: Very friendly and helpful staff.  I had the petrale sole which was delicious and they have excellent desserts.  This would be moving towards 5 stars if the wine was not so overpriced.
author: Matt B.

description: My friend invited me and my boyfriend to have a late dinner with him here and we had an amazing time. Paolo, the owner, served us some of the best Italian wine and food we've had in the city. Every bite was delicious! We had the bruschetta, seafood risotto, seafood ravioli, spinch & gorgonzola gnocchi with shitake mushrooms, handmade pasta with duck, prosciutto pizza, and this fantastic chocolate dessert that is one of their specialties. Parking was a bit hard to find in the neighborhood and if it weren't for a "parking agreement" with a neighbor, I would have circled for at least half and hour. The large party in the back room got a bit rowdy so the neighbors called the cops over, but Paolo was really nice and settled the situation. The restaurant is definitely great for parties, but you just have to keep the noise down after 11pm. I would recommend this restaurant over any other place in North Beach. And everyday from 5:30-7:00 pm there is an "APERITIVO HOUR"- they have a free Italian antipasti buffet!
author: Connie C.

description: Some friends were in town recently and we stopped by Amarena for dinner, after we were told an hour wait at Sushi Groove.  We should have turned around when we saw that we would be the only table in the entire restaurant at 7pm on a Thursday, but oh well, we learned our lesson.  To start with, I think the waitress was on drugs, which would have been fine with me if she could have shut up for two seconds and let us order our food, or get back to our own conversation.  But for some reason she thought we wanted to hear a 15 minute monologue on why she liked the floating candles on the wall.  Then when we asked her for wine recommendations and told her what we were ordering, her response was, and I'm not even kidding here, "All the wines go with everything on the menu."  I mean, that's a good goal to have, but really, come on.  She also suggested those baked calamari seafood appetizer things a reviewer below disliked, and I have to agree.  The calamari was totally overcooked, and the "seafood" it was stuffed with was indistinguishable.  The sauce, however was pretty good.  A salad my friend ordered never came, and our entrees were all pretty unremarkable.  The same vegetables were offered on every plate, which is alright, but makes me think the chef suffers from a lack of imagination.  I ordered the chicken marsala with chicken sausage and although it tasted pretty good, the sausage was shaped exactly like a McDonald's hashbrown patty which kind of grossed me out.  Another table did come in while we were there and they seemed to be having a good time.  They must not have had our waitress.  All in all, the food was okay, but with all the choices in the neighborhood we won't be back.
author: Jen T.

description: Cozy intimate neighborhood restaurant. Pasta is fresh, tasty, service is pretty good. Portions are just okay. Great for groups, we had 10 there for New Years. Friendly staff, good wine selection. Overall authentic italian food at a moderate price. Paulo the manager is very  friendly manager, and very accomodating. My wife loved a particular dish served there, one time we found out they no longer offered the dish. Although not on the menu, he offered to make it for us. Usually when I went with my wife and her friends he would offer them a complementary cocktail. Very cool nugget in Russian Hill. Nice place to impress your date if you are single.
author: S S.

description: The best so far in the city for Italian!   I am a Concierge and have been to many restaurants for research purposes (hard job I know).  I was given an invite by the wonderful Paolo (manager and owner) while at work one day and decided to go in on a Thurs night on a wim.  I was hungry and wanted to miss rush hour traffic.  Honestly, I didn't expect too much ince most Italian food is mediocre and too heavy for my taste.  I was in for a huge surprise.  I was presented five different dishes from the gorgonzola gnocchi (multiple orgasm on a plate) to the Rare lamb shank.  I ate meat and went against my  vegetarian code and boy was it worth it.  Sorry!   But, if I saw this lamb suckling off of its mother in a barn, I may have even shot it myself if I knew it would deliver this taste.  It was amazing.  Seriously, try this place out.  I lived for twenty years in Europe and have been to many great Italian restaurants in both Italy and North Beach.  After dining here, I could swear I have never had it better anywhere else!
author: Jill S.

description: Ugh!  Are you guys kidding? The food here is awful! I could have made better pasta using safeway select jar sauce. I went with a group of 8 and everyone was disappointed.  Don't waste your Saturday night here and by all means don't come for a special occasion!
author: Lauren F.

description: The butternut squash ravioli melts in your mouth! It is soooo good!!! The charming, handsome waiter will make you forget the slow service when he calls you bella. A great place for a girls night!
author: Charlotte P.

description: My husband and I ate at this restaurant 2 months ago, and it was fantastic.  We went last night with family and friends, and it was the worst.  The owner is in Italy on vacation, and the staff he left, were drinking alcohol on the job, and practically falling all over each other.  The head waiter gave a hug and a feel to the hostess that was inappropriate.  Our food was served stone cold, and the pasta was undercooked.  I was so emabarrassed in front of friends and family, what a shame for such a cute location.
author: deborah d.

description: This is the most adorable restaurant on earth!  I adore the owner Paolo and his entire courteous and wonderful staff.  They are all from Milan and the food tastes straight out of Italy.  It is by far one of the most authentic Italian restaurants San Francisco has to offer.  The wine list is remarkable and from A-Z everything on the menu is a delight!  My current favorite was the "homemade" lasagne.  It had a light red sauce and was less cheesy then the traditional American recipe.  I also enjoyed the halibut immensely.  All of the pasta's are house made and the produce is garden fresh...I cannot say enough positive remarks about this restaurant and about Paolo.  I feel like I am going to see an old friend every time I dine at Amarena, which by the way means cherry in Italian and he named it after his mama's cherry trees back home ...How cute is that.  you must do yourselves a favor and go!  I guarantee you will find a new/old favorite Italian restaurant!!!
author: Michele K.

description: amarena is a cute little neighborhood restaurant - i liked the service and ambiance.  i went for dinner with a bunch of friends and everyone enjoyed their meal.  i had the crab and scallop raviolis with walnut sauce.  while i didnt care for the sauce, the portion size was just right and the raviolis were light and tasty.  we also started with polenta and bruschetta.  i liked the polenta much better than the bruschetta.  my only complaint with the menu was that it was too much pasta, and not enough other choices (meat, fish, etc.).  while i do enjoy italian food, i dont usually get pasta but i didnt find other options that were appealing to me.  amarena was good, just not sure if i would rush to go back.
author: Carolyn B.

description: Amarena is one of those "hidden gem" neighborhood restaurants that is actually so good you want to bring your friends there, too.  The decor is stylish yet cozy, and the service is friendly, smooth, and personable.  And the food - well, even our friend who spent several years attending grad school in Italy loved the food at Amarena!  It is obvious that they put a lot of love into everything...homemade pastas, fresh warm bread, perfectly balanced and nuanced sauces - everything hit just the right notes.  Some nights they have live music, which makes it a fun party - other nights, it's quiet and cozy, with a romantic glow.  I highly recommend it, whatever your mood, because the food is always delectable and reasonably priced, to boot!
author: Morticia C.

description: Like this place.  Nice,  quiet, un-pretentious Italian place with cool nooks and tables for two - good date place.
author: William M.

description:
great little place off the beaten path.

everything was wonderful. out waitress was cute as a button and her energy made the white table cloth joint seem much more relaxed. the food was excellent. the calamari was just lightly battered and served with a WARM spicy marinara sauce. the papperdelle was good and the crab ravioli was creamy. it's a little starch heaven. 

the only thing bad was parking. but fear not, there's a lot on polk and pacific, 4 blocks away, and at $6 for the night, you can't beat that.
author: Gina S.

description: I love the feel of this place. Larkin around here  is a quiet street in comparison to Hyde and - especially - Polk. This helps to give it more of a "neighbourhood" feel than some of the places on those two latter streets. Each time of been, the food has been good, and the wine list is relatively well stocked.
author: Colin M.

description: About 9 months ago I found Amarena - When i walked into the restaurant I  noticed the rustic color walls, candle lights and immediately I was greeted by  the warm welcome of the staff . Since then I have been back  many  times. Each time the food has been consistently great , the home made Pasta, fresh tuna tartar -- the staff  knows my favorite table and my favorite wine.  This neighborhood restaurant is home away from home. When I  have friends from out of town or to celebrate special occasions I  take them to Amarena.  Amerena offers   fantastic Italian food in  true San Francisco style--subdued , cozy and romantic ambience.
author: sepideh a.

description: Been here a couple times with my girlfriend and each time it was very good.  A good local spot for a nice dinner out..
author: Richard C.

description: Love this place.  So quaint and great food.  They are so friendly and helpful, what a great neighborhood restaurant!
author: Sam L.

description: Excellent service and excellent food.  We never realized this place was just two blocks away from us until yesterday, but now I think its going to be one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.  There were four of us and all the dishes were great-- as were the appetizers (buffalo mozzarella & bruschetta) and desserts (chocolate souffle & vanilla gelato with cherries).  The waitress/hostess was very friendly/helpful and the place had a very warm feeling to it.
author: Michael M.

description:
We went there with positive, high hopes. We surely would of become "regulars" there if we were satisfied with the food as we
dine out often. But, rather we were very disappointed. The New Year's Eve 4-course dinner we had was a failure. At $65.00 per person, the dinner was pathetically meager. To start off: Appetizers: The prosciutto stuffed w/vegs was good but only one small piece;  the octopus portion was so small, with only a few curls of the Octopus tenticles (oh yes, they did put 4 small wedges of roasted potatoes on it which was odd. We planned on sharing the two appetizers, but there was nothing to share. Pasta: We each had linguini with giant prawns. They left the heads and skin on the three overcooked prawns they gave with this dish which were very difficult to peel off - this was messy. (They should of only left the tail on and peel the skins off before serving. We came to the conclusion that the heads were left on to make the prawns look bigger - they were not really giant at all. This pasta dish was okay but not anything to rave about. The pasta portion was adequate - obviously the "filler dish" part of the dinner. Now, the very worse and unexcusable part of this dinner was the Osso Bucco. Usually, this is something that is cooked in liquids a long time so it is very tender when served. The first sign of a problem was that the Osso Bucco was all curled up when it was served. The second sign of a problem is when it was difficult to put our forks into it and hard to cut.  It was full of tough fat/grissle, and finally we had to complain to the owner who pathetically made some poor excuses about it. There was no excuse for this.....the cook had screwed up big time!  If this
is how the rest of the Osso Bucco was cooked, there were going to
be big problems with the remaining customers who were coming in.
There were many reservations for this New Years Eve dinner.
There was only one other dish served to replace this.....Sea Bass.
If there was even a 3 oz portion of the fish served, it is an exaggeration.
It was pleasant, but very plain and bland.  It was served with a tiny
1-1/2" square of solid aborio rice.  White plate, white fish, white rice,
pretty boring presentation. Oh there were about 4 tiny tiny tomatos
cut in half for color. What a teaser.  The Dessert: their special
chocolate cake.....a "one quarter inch' sliver  thin piece of a brownie with small strips biscotti and walnuts embedded in it. This was good, but such a small portion which looked like a twig on the plate.
The only thing we enjoyed was the wine and Cappucino's.   At 
$65.00 per person (not including the wine or coffee), customers were completely taken advantage of with the extremely small portions. Worse of all, the flavor and quality of the food were very disappointing.
(Others sitting nearby were equally dissatisfied). If you don't know what good quality Italian food is all about....then this place is for you......but, if you do know Italian food......don't even bother to consider this place.  We are native San Franciscans, Italians,
and have been to many Italian restaurants here and in Italy......and we
are sorry to say "this place is a true "joke".  PS: this restaurant has
no heat......and on a cold 40 degree night.....it was chilly in there.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: I love Amarena. The food is good the staff and owner are wonderful. It is the perfect cozy neighborhood Italian restaurant. I guess to some it would have a more elegant or even romantic atmosphere but since I now know everyone by name it is kind of a great place to go with a neighbor when I don't feel like cooking and want something decadent. I have literally called them at 11pm when my girlfriend and I had a mean chocolatey craving and they stayed open so we could run over in our PJs to pick up a dessert. Not sure if they have beer but they have wonderful wines.
author: Luna S.

description: This place is all a great neighborhood restaurant should be. Tasty affordable, food.  The owner is super hospitable. I eat here all the time and never had anything bad. Try the Wild Boar pasta, simply the best in the City--believe me I've tried them all. The atmosphere/decor is great too, like stepping in to a courtyard of an Italian village.
author: michele c.

description:
want a break from the busy loud city?
step into italy for a few hours and be treated by great food and amazing hospitality.  always a great experience and the owner and team are good people.
get away for a couple hours and enjoy!
author: m b.

description: A favorite neighborhood restaurant. Their stuffed calamari and osso bucco are especially tasty. Best of all, the service is great. The owner and waiters are always there to welcome you with a smile.
author: ofelia R.

description: Good ambiance-simple and easy.  Beet salad was good but a little oily. Gnocci w/ mushrooms was good but cream was a bit heavy.  However, the seafood linguine was AWESOME - salmon was very flavorful and included clams, shrimp, squid and white wine sauce was great.  Solid 4 stars!
author: cal b.

description: Luca, my server, was adorable, the happy hour prices are really nice (the most expensive thing I got, at $8, was a class of Prosecco), Paolo, the owner, introduced himself and checked up on me a few times, the bread is absolutely amazing, *and* it's steps from my apartment--perfect. Some Yelp reviews complained about the quiet, but that was actually a plus for me. There are lots of things I'd like to try on the menu, so I will definitely come back! Amarena would be a great place to just grab a glass of wine and maybe some desert, too.
author: Sadie H.

description: Went here for Valentine's Day as it was the first place that had availability after a very long search on OpenTable. Now I know why. What a huge disappointment. Both my wife and I left completely unsatisfied with the meal and a little under $200 poorer for the experience. It was a "special" menu for the night so we weren't able to order the plates that others recommended. First plate of beet salad (blech) and polenta (decent), second plate of pasta and risotto was pretty good, main course of veal was not at all appealing. I'd give it a C- at best. The desert was good, service was pretty standard, and the ambiance was romantic I suppose - but the food was a tremendous letdown. I just moved to SF so maybe this is the way most restaurants operate on Valentine's Day. Jack up prices since they know we desperate men will pay and then pass off second or third rate dishes to improve their profit for the night. Needless to say we won't be back.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Authentic Italian food with a real feel of a northern Italian eatery.  Paulo the owner is friendly, generous and enthusiasctic that you are visiting his "little italy".  Most if not all the wines are from Italy and are hand picked by Paulo.  I haven't had a bad wine there yet and I go here a couple of times a month.  The place is cozy and dim lit for a romantic dinner.  Small groups fare well too.  The feeling is likened to eating at home in someone's dining room.  My many visits are solo as I get off work late (too tired to cook) and arive via motorcycle due to the terrible parking in this neighborhood.  I recommend taking a taxi for sure unless you are local enough to go by foot.  I sit at the bar which has 3 or  4 chairs and share conversation with the staff while enjoying a glass of Montepulciano d'Abruzzo or Amarone della Valpolicella and wait for arguably the best ossobuco con tagliolini I've ever had (and you too).
author: William S.
